original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya ste /
translated: This teaching of the Bhagavan Buddha, which illuminates the ultimate reality, is called nectar because it is the cause for attaining the state of nirvana, the nectar of immortality.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni gang zag dang chos bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs nas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni gang zag dang chos bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs nas 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas who possess immeasurable accumulations of merit and wisdom, having realized the reality of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, strive to bring benefit to all beings.

original: rab tu brtson par byed pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nye ma lta bur gyur nas gsung gi 'od zer dag gis sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi blo gros kyi pad ma dag kha 'byed par mdzad pas
analyzed: rab tu brtson par byed pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nye ma lta bur gyur nas gsung gi 'od zer dag gis sems can skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi blo gros kyi pad ma dag kha 'byed par mdzad pas
translated: When they do so, they become like the sun, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete Buddha, and with the light rays of his speech, they cause the lotus flowers of the intelligence of fortunate sentient beings to open.

original: / bdag dang gzhan gyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / bdag dang gzhan gyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúambrosia‚Äù because it is the cause for attaining the state of deathlessness, which is nirvana that does not abide in the extremes of either existence or peace.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su 'dris par @93b byas pa gang bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs nas tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis kyang thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su 'dris par @93b byas pa gang bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs nas tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The disciples also, through the knowledge that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation, and through the practice of realizing the suchness of selflessness, manifest nirvana in this very life.

original: rang gi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bdud rtsi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúambrosia‚Äù because it is the cause for attaining the state of deathlessness, which is nirvana that completely pacifies all suffering.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig brgyal tshe 'di la tshogs ma bsags pa nyid kyis thar pa thob par ma gyur na de lta na yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la de la nges par 'grub ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig brgyal tshe 'di la tshogs ma bsags pa nyid kyis thar pa thob par ma gyur na de lta na yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la de la nges par 'grub ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Even if one who has not accumulated the collections in this life does not attain liberation, it is said that ‚Äúin that case, it will definitely be accomplished in other lives.‚Äù

original: nyan thos gang dag tshogs ma byas pa nyid kyis 'phral la ma grub pa de dag la yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos gang dag tshogs ma byas pa nyid kyis 'phral la ma grub pa de dag la yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that even those ≈õrƒÅvakas who do not achieve the result in the present life through not completing the accumulations will definitely achieve it in other lives.

original: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: he says,üîΩ‚ÄúAs it is said‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: de nyid shes pa 'di la ni //üîΩ'dod chags bral ba ma thob kyang //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa 'di la ni // 'dod chags bral ba ma thob kyang //
translated: In this regard,

original: tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
translated: even though ≈õrƒÅvaka yogis do not obtain freedom from attachment in this life through knowing suchness, they definitely obtain it in other lives without effort,

original: nges par 'thob ste las bzhin no //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nges par 'thob ste las bzhin no // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: just like the fruitions of karma.

original: nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa de kho na shes pas tshe 'di la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob kyang tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad pa med par nges par 'thob ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa de kho na shes pas tshe 'di la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob kyang tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad pa med par nges par 'thob ste /
translated: Even though they do not obtain freedom from attachment in this life through knowing suchness, they definitely obtain it in other lives without effort,

original: dper na las kyi rnam par smin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na las kyi rnam par smin pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the fruitions of karma.

original: ji ste yang brgya la /
analyzed: ji ste yang brgya la /
translated: If, however, it is the case that

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: the perfect buddhas do not appear,

original: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the sravakas have exhausted the defilements,üîΩthey do not have the conditions for the arising of the knowledge of thatness.

original: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang de lta mod kyi tshe rabs gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la gzhan gyi rkyen med par /
analyzed: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang de lta mod kyi tshe rabs gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la gzhan gyi rkyen med par /
translated: However, in other lives, they have accumulated the imprints of the practice of the knowledge of complete seclusion, and thus their minds are trained.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of the pratyekabuddhas

original: rten pa med las rab tu skye //
analyzed: rten pa med las rab tu skye //
translated: arises from the absence of support.

original: rten pa med pa ni lus dang sems rab tu dben pa ste /
analyzed: rten pa med pa ni lus dang sems rab tu dben pa ste /
translated: The absence of support is the complete seclusion of body and mind.

original: de'i phyir rten pa med pa'i rgyu de las rab tu skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten pa med pa'i rgyu de las rab tu skye ste /
translated: Therefore, it arises from the cause of the absence of support.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams sam 'phags pa nyan thos gzhan dag la
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams sam 'phags pa nyan thos gzhan dag la
translated: The meaning of this is that the yogis of the sravakas who manifest the limit of reality do not need the support of other buddhas or other noble sravakas in order to manifest the knowledge of thatness.

original: brten pa'i rten gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid thob pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: brten pa'i rten gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid thob pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though they have attained freedom from attachment,

original: ci ste yang brgya la nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa gang dag tshe 'di la de kho na shes pa goms par byas pa dag cung zad tshogs ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma thob ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang brgya la nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor pa gang dag tshe 'di la de kho na shes pa goms par byas pa dag cung zad tshogs ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma thob ste /
translated: if they have not completed the accumulations, they will not attain the state of an arhat in this life.

original: tshe rabs gzhan @94a * //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan @94a * //
translated: In other lives,

original: dag la yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: dag la yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'i tshe na /
translated: they will actualize the limit of reality.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
translated: If perfect buddhas have not appeared

original: nyan thos rnams zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams zad par 'gyur te /
translated: and ≈õrƒÅvakas have become extinct,

original: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang tshe rabs snga ma gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma
analyzed: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang tshe rabs snga ma gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma
translated: even though they lack the conditions for the arising of knowledge of thatness, because they have accumulated the imprints of cultivating the knowledge of complete isolation in other past lives, the wisdom of pratyekabuddhas arises in their minds.

original: yin pa rten pa med pa tsam gyi rkyen las rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //üîΩde'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni de sgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsam pa thag pas de bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: yin pa rten pa med pa tsam gyi rkyen las rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to // de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni de sgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsam pa thag pas de bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: It is taught that the mere absence of support is the condition for the arising of the existent.üîΩTherefore, since this nectar-like teaching is what causes those who practice it to attain the state of nectar in this life and in future lives, those who desire what is good for themselves should practice it with a sincere mind.üîΩThis is the statement that encourages others to take up this nectar-like teaching.

original: bstan pa bdud rtsi 'di gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i tshig yin te de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni de sgrub par rnams la rang rang gi dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / tshogs dang /
analyzed: bstan pa bdud rtsi 'di gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i tshig yin te de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni de sgrub par rnams la rang rang gi dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / tshogs dang /
translated: Therefore, this nectar-like teaching is what causes those who practice it to attain the state of nectar in this life and in future lives.

original: theg pa dang / rkyen gyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: theg pa dang / rkyen gyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas /
translated: The power of the cause and the power of the condition are the vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag legs par 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa spang bar 'dod pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsam pa thag pas 'di nyid 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag legs par 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa spang bar 'dod pa bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis bsam pa thag pas 'di nyid 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, yogis who desire to abandon the jungle of sa·πÉsƒÅra and attain the state of nectar should strive in this with a firm intention.

original: 'di kho na las don dam pa nges par 'grub po //
analyzed: 'di kho na las don dam pa nges par 'grub po //
translated: The ultimate is definitely accomplished from this alone.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma thob med par bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyis sgrub pa kha na ma thob med par bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is as follows: The refutation of the proofs stated by others and the demonstration that the proofs stated by us are without fault teach that compounded phenomena are empty of self and being mine.

original: bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: It is the result of the means of knowledge and the compendium.

original: bdag dang chos brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i don 'bras bur blta ba ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan dag gis gang zag dang chos bdag yod par smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang /
analyzed: bdag dang chos brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i don 'bras bur blta ba ni rang gi sde pa dang gzhan dag gis gang zag dang chos bdag yod par smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang /
translated: In this chapter, the eighteenth chapter on the examination of the self and phenomena, the meaning of the treatise is seen as the result of the means of knowledge. The proponents of our own schools and others who speak of the existence of a self of persons and phenomena have their proofs refuted.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa bdag nyid kyis gang zag dang chos bdag med pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma thob med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa @94b nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa bdag nyid kyis gang zag dang chos bdag med pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma thob med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa @94b nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the author of the treatise himself teaches the proof of the selflessness of persons and phenomena without fault. Thus he teaches that compounded phenomena are empty of self and being mine.

original: bdag dang chos ngo bo nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes sgrub po zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang chos ngo bo nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes sgrub po zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: What is the good of teaching the self and phenomena as having entityness? And in order to dispel the claim of others that this teaching is a mere dry treatise of sophistry, here the source of trustworthy scripture is also established.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pas zhus pa las /
translated: Therefore, the questions of SubƒÅhu, the son of the Bhagavatƒ´ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ, are established.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: SubƒÅhu, form is not a self or not a self.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not a self or not a self.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnams par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin te /
translated: That form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not a self or not a self is the perfection of wisdom.

original: des ni chos bdag med pa bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos bdag med pa bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the qualities and source of teaching the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: in other s≈´tras,üîΩit is said:

original: 'di la bdag med sems can med //
analyzed: 'di la bdag med sems can med //
translated: Here there is no self and no sentient being.

original: srog kyang yod min gang zag med //
analyzed: srog kyang yod min gang zag med //
translated: There is no life-force, and no person.

original: lus 'di khams rnams 'dus tsam du //
analyzed: lus 'di khams rnams 'dus tsam du //
translated: This body is merely a composite of elements.

original: bdag la de ltar rab tu snang //
analyzed: bdag la de ltar rab tu snang //
translated: It appears to me in that way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: in other s≈´tras,üîΩit is said:

original: 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
translated: Here there is no self or sentient being.

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
translated: These phenomena have causes.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: in other s≈´tras,üîΩit is said:

original: srid mo gzhan yang khyod kyi lus 'di la bdag med sems can med skyes bu med gang zag med shed bu med tshor ba po med byed pa po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni /üîΩgang zag bdag med par bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs bstan to //
analyzed: srid mo gzhan yang khyod kyi lus 'di la bdag med sems can med skyes bu med gang zag med shed bu med tshor ba po med byed pa po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni / gang zag bdag med par bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs bstan to //
translated: Sister, in this body of yours there is no self, no sentient being, no person, no individual, no human, no one who feels, and no one who acts.üîΩThis demonstrates the qualities and sources of the teaching of the selflessness of persons.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i khungs de dag grub pa ni bdag dang chos ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan gyi khungs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i khungs de dag grub pa ni bdag dang chos ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan gyi khungs yin no //
translated: The establishment of those sources of confidence is the source of the qualities of the teaching of the essencelessness of persons and phenomena.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i shes rgya nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i shes rgya nyid yin no //
translated: The fact that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise is due to the great knowledge and scholarship of the author himself.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma @95a * //
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma @95a * //
translated: The fact that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise is due to the great knowledge of the master and the extent of his understanding in composing the commentary.

original: las bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: las bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the eighteenth chapter of the PrajiiiimUla called the Prajfiiipradipa, composed by the master Bhavaviveka, is completed.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in order to teach the essencelessness of time by refuting the special attributes of the negation of emptiness, the nineteenth chapter is begun.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be viewed as having the sense of the cause of engaging in a thesis and the sense of being related to what will be stated in the text that follows.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, from the point of view of the sense of the cause of engaging in a thesis,

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in order to refute the specific counter positions to emptiness,

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: the treatise-writer, in the context of beginning the first chapter, the examination of conditions, made the thesis that all things are not produced.

original: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Therefore, here the treatise-writer states this in the context of the sense of the cause of engaging in that thesis as it was stated.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is one‚Äôs own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Its counter position is the position of the opponent.

original: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: It is this: they are proponents of the intrinsic reality of things.üîΩThe qualification means that the former position, that the opponent is a proponent of the intrinsic reality of things, is posited.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smras pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa 'og nas don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smras pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa 'og nas don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The argument that proves the intrinsic reality of things is stated below: ‚ÄúThe intrinsic reality of things definitely exists ultimately,

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of manifestation.üîΩFor example, like a lamp.‚ÄùüîΩThe argument that proves the intrinsic reality of things is stated below: ‚ÄúThe intrinsic reality of things definitely exists ultimately,üîΩbecause it is the cause of manifestation.

original: dper na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byungüîΩba dag yin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: For example, like a lamp.‚Äù

original: de dgag pa zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pa zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The refutation of that means that chapter nineteen is composed in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩdus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas / dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the passage from the treatise is as follows.üîΩThe nineteenth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate that time does not intrinsically exist.

original: dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i @95b dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
analyzed: dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i @95b dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
translated: The meaning of the passage from the treatise that will appear below is that time is taught to be essenceless.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /üîΩdus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na / dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: By what process is that result achieved?üîΩThe result of this chapter is the demonstration that time does not intrinsically exist.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de thob pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de thob pas de'i phyir /
translated: That result is achieved by the process of refuting the specific attributes of the opponent‚Äôs position that time intrinsically exists.

original: 'grel ba byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho na bstan to //
analyzed: 'grel ba byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho na bstan to //
translated: The author of the commentary, in the context of the introduction to the chapter, teaches only the first result that arises from the means.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚Äúthe distinction that is the opposite of emptiness.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says this:

original: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality, the entities do have an intrinsic reality,

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no //
translated: because they are the cause of manifestation, like a lamp.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist is not the cause of manifestation,

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
translated: like the cloth of tortoise hair.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of entities is the cause of manifestation in the three times, therefore it alone exists.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason, the example of the dissimilar class, the application and the conclusion.

original: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa de na dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa de na dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which is not, like the cloth of tortoise hair, is not the cause that illuminates the three times, and therefore it does not exist.

original: mar me lha bu bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de yang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer
analyzed: mar me lha bu bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de yang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer
translated: But that which is, like the lamp, the cause that illuminates the pot, the son of Devadatta, does exist. In the same way, the essence of things is the cause that illuminates the three times and therefore it too exists.

original: te / de ni 'di na dus yod par smra ba bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las dus shes zhes bya ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
analyzed: te / de ni 'di na dus yod par smra ba bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las dus shes zhes bya ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äútime‚Äù is permanent and exists as a different object from the nature of things.üîΩThe activity of the nature of things is the distinction of the state of engagement in the past, the future, and the present.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba sngar 'das pa dang / de dung ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis 'di ni 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba sngar 'das pa dang / de dung ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis 'di ni 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the past time.

original: 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the future time.üîΩThis is the present time.

original: 'di ni da ltar gyi dus so zhes gsal bar byed pas des na dus kyang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag par yod /
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar gyi dus so zhes gsal bar byed pas des na dus kyang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag par yod /
translated: Therefore time is a permanent meaning of the term that is a different object from the nature of things.

original: @96a * // dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: @96a * // dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gzhung yin no //
translated: The nature of things is also the cause that clarifies the three times, and since it possesses activity, it alone exists.üîΩThis is the treatise of the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute those specific counteragents to emptiness, the treatise states the following in order to teach that time does not exist inherently.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary states:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed de dag gi skye ba gang yin pa de bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed de dag gi skye ba gang yin pa de bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The arising of those formations that belong to the conventional is called ‚Äúaction.‚Äù

original: de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba yin pas dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad pa dang ma spyad pa las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba yin pas dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad pa dang ma spyad pa las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
translated: Since that action is the arising of the nature of things, those things themselves are said to be past, future, and present in terms of the causal and resultant actions that have been performed and those that have not been performed.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus shes zhes khas len te /üîΩdper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs nas brjod /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus shes zhes khas len te / dper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs nas brjod /
translated: Therefore, we accept that time is the action itself, which is the action that determines another action that belongs to the conventional.

original: le'u glags so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: le'u glags so zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHe came just now‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe chapter is finished.‚Äù

original: skabs 'dis ni sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la bya ba rdzas su grub pa med la /
analyzed: skabs 'dis ni sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la bya ba rdzas su grub pa med la /
translated: This section shows that according to the scriptures of the Buddhists, the nature of things does not substantially exist even conventionally.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las logs shig na dus zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag pa yang med pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid las logs shig na dus zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag pa yang med pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: And since apart from the nature of things there is no other permanent object called ‚Äútime,‚Äù the nature of things is not the cause that illuminates the three times.

original: pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag mi 'grub par ston te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag mi 'grub par ston te /
translated: Therefore the thesis and reason of the opponent are not established.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed phung po lnga zhes bya ba de dag gi sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i skye ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed phung po lnga zhes bya ba de dag gi sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i skye ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: According to the scriptures of the Buddhists, the arising of the five aggregates that are conditioned phenomena that belong to the category of conventionalities is called ‚Äúaction.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i bya ba de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid rgyu dang rkyen las sgyu ma tsam du skye ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid rgyu dang rkyen las sgyu ma tsam du skye ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The action of arising is the mere illusion of the entity itself arising from causes and conditions.

original: de las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa med pas dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga spyad pa las ni 'das pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa med pas dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga spyad pa las ni 'das pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Since it does not exist substantially separate from them, those entities themselves are called ‚Äúpast‚Äù when both cause and effect have passed.

original: gnyi ga ma spyad pa las ni ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod /üîΩrgyu spyad la 'bras bu ma spyad pa 'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma spyad pa las ni ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod / rgyu spyad la 'bras bu ma spyad pa 'am /
translated: They are called ‚Äúfuture‚Äù when neither has been experienced.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis srang mda'i mthon dam na bzhin du 'jug bzhin pa las ni da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis srang mda'i mthon dam na bzhin du 'jug bzhin pa las ni da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
translated: They are called ‚Äúpresent‚Äù when the cause has been experienced but the effect has not been experienced, or when both cause and effect are engaged like the high and low points of a scale.üîΩTherefore, conventionally, the action of arising is the entity itself arising.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du skye ba'i bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba de nyid kyis bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod cing sel bar @96b byed pa nyid la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du skye ba'i bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba de nyid kyis bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod cing sel bar @96b byed pa nyid la /
translated: That very action eliminates and excludes other actions.

original: dus shes khas len te /
analyzed: dus shes khas len te /
translated: We accept that this is the meaning of time.

original: dper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs pa'i bya bas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus zhes gdags pa dang / de tsam gyi bya ba nyid kyis brjod /
analyzed: dper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs pa'i bya bas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus zhes gdags pa dang / de tsam gyi bya ba nyid kyis brjod /
translated: For example, the mere act of coming is designated as time, and the act of coming is expressed by the mere act of coming.

original: le'u glags pas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba de nyid la dus zhes gdags par zad kyi ;
analyzed: le'u glags pas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa'i bya ba de nyid la dus zhes gdags par zad kyi ;
translated: The act of coming is designated as time, and nothing else.

original: de las ma gtogs par logs shig nas dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs par logs shig nas dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i bya ba yang med la /
translated: Apart from that, there is no act that is a different object from the thing, and

original: dus kyang med pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dus kyang med pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: there is no time. Therefore, since the nature of things is not the cause that illuminates the three times,

original: pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag tha snyad du yang sangs rgyas pa dag gi phyogs la ma grub po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag tha snyad du yang sangs rgyas pa dag gi phyogs la ma grub po zhes bstan to //
translated: it is shown that the thesis and reason of the opponent are not established for the Buddhist position, even conventionally.

original: don dam par ni ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la yang skye ba'i bya ba gzhan med la /
analyzed: don dam par ni ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la yang skye ba'i bya ba gzhan med la /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it is untenable, so it should be analyzed‚Äù and so on shows that in reality, the entity of things has no other activity of arising.

original: dngos po rnams las dus zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan du gyur pa dang / rtag pa yang med pas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs dag ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: dngos po rnams las dus zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gzhan du gyur pa dang / rtag pa yang med pas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs dag ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ba ston to //
translated: Since time is not a different object of expression from things, and is not permanent, it should be analyzed just as the thesis and reason of the opponent are untenable.

original: 'di la dus yod par smra ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus gzhan pa dang / rtag par smra ste zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di la dus yod par smra ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus gzhan pa dang / rtag par smra ste zhes bya bas ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /
translated: Here, those who propound the existence of time say that time is different from conditioned things and is permanent. This shows the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: 'di na dus yod par smra ba bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las dus zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
analyzed: 'di na dus yod par smra ba bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las dus zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur ba'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
translated: Here, those who propound the existence of time, such as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, say that time, which is a different object of expression from conditioned things, exists permanently in their texts.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba sngar 'das pa dang / da dung ma 'ongs ba dang / da ltar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis 'di ni 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba sngar 'das pa dang / da dung ma 'ongs ba dang / da ltar 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis 'di ni 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the past time.üîΩThis is the future time.

original: 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the present time.

original: 'di ni da ltar gyi dus so zhes gsal bar byed pa des na dus kyang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar gyi dus so zhes gsal bar byed pa des na dus kyang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las don gzhan du gyur pa'i tshig gi don rtag par yod la /
translated: Since it is clearly distinguished in this way, time is a permanent thing that exists as a different object from the intrinsic reality of things.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of things is the cause that clearly distinguishes the three times, it exists because it possesses activity.

original: de la re zhig don dam par dus 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las gzhan par mi 'thad par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par dus 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las gzhan par mi 'thad par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To begin with, in order to demonstrate the inference that ultimately time is untenable as different from conditioned things,

original: de la don dam par dus ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don @97a * //
analyzed: de la don dam par dus ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don @97a * //
translated: ultimately time is not different from conditioned things.

original: gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: It should be apprehended as not being a different object.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is an entity, like the nature of conditioned entities.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the thesis, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du /üîΩdus kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba de bzhin du / dus kyang dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the nature of conditioned entities should be apprehended as not being a different object from conditioned entities because it is an entity.üîΩIn the same way,

original: dus kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: time should be apprehended as not being a different object from the entities of time because it is an entity.

original: da ni don dam par dus rtag pa mi 'thad par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don dam par dus rtag pa mi 'thad par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the inference that time is not tenable as permanent in an ultimate sense,

original: de bzhin du don dam par dus ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par dus ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: in the same way, time is not permanent in an ultimate sense.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is the basis of the definition, for example, like a pot.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And these are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na bum pa ni mtshan nyid gzhi yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni mtshan nyid gzhi yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pot is not permanent because it is the basis of the definition.

original: dus kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, time is not permanent because it is the basis of the definition.üîΩIf you say that because of space and so on, it is not established,

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin
translated: this is the opponent‚Äôs words that fault the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the basis of the definition,‚Äù of the Madhyamaka as not being established.

original: te / de dag na re 'di na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin yang rtag par mthong bas /
analyzed: te / de dag na re 'di na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin yang rtag par mthong bas /
translated: For they say, ‚ÄúSpace and so on are seen to be permanent, even though they are the basis of the definition.‚Äù

original: des na ci re zhig mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ci re zhig mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, what is it?üîΩ

original: dus kyang mi rtag par ram /üîΩ'on te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus kyang mi rtag par ram / 'on te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, is time impermanent, like a pot, because it is the basis of characteristics?üîΩOr is time permanent, like space, because it is the basis of characteristics?

original: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag bzhin du dus kyang rtag par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa dag bzhin du dus kyang rtag par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is not certain, the Madhyamaka reason is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /üîΩde dag kyang de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de dag kyang de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the author of the commentary says:üîΩSince those are also refuted in the same way, the absence of the discordant side is not uncertain.

original: don dam par nam mkha' la sogs pa de dag kyang dus bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho @97b bo'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par nam mkha' la sogs pa de dag kyang dus bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho @97b bo'i gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since those such as space are also refuted in the same way as time in the ultimate, the absence of the discordant side is not uncertain.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te /
translated: The mind that thinks this is the present form has an object that is the referent of the term related to an entity that is different from its own nature.

original: yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it generates conviction.

original: dper na dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par
analyzed: dper na dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par
translated: For example, the mind that generates conviction in the thought many or few club bearers has an object that is the referent of the term related to a club that is an entity different from the nature of Devadatta and so on.

original: mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is seen that this is so.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la da ltar da ltar ro snyam du yid ches pa skye ba yod pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la da ltar da ltar ro snyam du yid ches pa skye ba yod pas /
translated: So too, here, since the mind that thinks this is the present form generates conviction,üîΩit has an object that is the referent of the term related to an entity that is different from the nature of the present form.

original: de'i phyir da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo 'di la yang rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod de gzugs las gzhan gyi tshig gi don gang yin pa de ni dus yin pas /

original: de'i phyir de ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang dus yod par smra ba dag dus 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las gzhan yin par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang dus yod par smra ba dag dus 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las gzhan yin par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

original: dper na lhas byin la sogs pa dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la dbyug pa can lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brelüîΩpa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong bas dbyug pa can snyam du /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin la sogs pa dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la dbyug pa can lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong bas dbyug pa can snyam du /
translated: For example, in the case of many or few people such as Devadatta who have sticks, the mind that generates the thought ‚Äúthose who have sticks‚Äù sees the object, the referent of the term ‚Äúthose who have sticks,‚Äù as existing as a different thing from the self of Devadatta and so on.üîΩTherefore the mind that generates the thought ‚Äúthose who have sticks‚Äù sees the referent of the term ‚Äúthose who have sticks‚Äù as existing separately from the self of Devadatta.

original: yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de de'i yul la dbyug pa can lhas byin gyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa dbyug pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas dbyug pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don de ni
analyzed: yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de de'i yul la dbyug pa can lhas byin gyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa dbyug pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas dbyug pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don de ni
translated: The referent of the term ‚Äúthose who have sticks‚Äù is

original: dbyug pa can gyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dbyug pa can gyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: different from the self of those who have sticks.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs la da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la yang da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong bas
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs la da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la yang da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong bas
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúpresent‚Äù is seen to be a different thing related to the present time.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul la yang da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa @98a * //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul la yang da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa @98a * //
translated: The object of the mind that thinks ‚Äúpresent form‚Äù arises with conviction that it is present form.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúpresent‚Äù is also a different thing.

original: da ltar gyi dus zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas da ltar gyi dus zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don de ni da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas da ltar gyi dus zhes bya ba'i dngos po'i tshig gi don de ni da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of the word ‚Äúpresent‚Äù is a different thing from the entity of present form.

original: 'di skad bstan te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po la yid ches pa'i blo'i yul las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyang yod la /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po la yid ches pa'i blo'i yul las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyang yod la /
translated: This is taught because the nature of past, future, and present things exists as an object of the mind that is confident in things of the past, future, and present.

original: dngos po de dag gi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas de'i phyir dus gsum gyi 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus kyi dngos po'iüîΩtshig gi don gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dngos po de dag gi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi dngos po'i tshig gi don kyang logs shig na yod pas de'i phyir dus gsum gyi 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus kyi dngos po'i tshig gi don gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And the meaning of the term of a thing of the past, future, or present that is different from the nature of those things also exists elsewhere. Therefore, the meaning of the term of a thing of the three times is different from conditioned things of the three times.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la 'dir yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don la dus ma yin pa dang
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la 'dir yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don la dus ma yin pa dang
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says, ‚ÄúBecause confidence arises in that,‚Äù the meaning of the term that is different from the nature of the reason is not a thing of the three times.

original: / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don mthong ba'i phyir yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpog pas dus ma yin pa nyid dang rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad
analyzed: / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don mthong ba'i phyir yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpog pas dus ma yin pa nyid dang rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag gsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad
translated: Because the meaning of the words ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is seen, the arising of confidence is inferred. Since it is not timely and is not permanent, the fault of the probandum being the nature of the subject and the fault of the distinction being stated are clarified.

original: par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: par bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said that the thesis has the fault of the probandum being the nature of the subject and the fault of the distinction being stated.

original: 'dis ni pha rol po dag yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dus rtag pa yod par rjes su dpog pa de kun rdzob tu yang dam bcas pa la chos can dus kyi ngo bo
analyzed: 'dis ni pha rol po dag yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dus rtag pa yod par rjes su dpog pa de kun rdzob tu yang dam bcas pa la chos can dus kyi ngo bo
translated: This shows that the reason ‚Äúbecause the arising of confidence is inferred‚Äù is not established. The inference that the permanent time that is different from the intrinsic reality of form exists is a thesis that, even conventionally, has the fault of the probandum being the nature of the subject, time,üîΩand the fault of the distinction being stated, that is, the fault of the distinction of time being stated.

original: nyid dang dus kyi khyad par gzhan yin pa dang / rtag pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag ma grub par ston te /
analyzed: nyid dang dus kyi khyad par gzhan yin pa dang / rtag pa zhes bya ba bsal ba'i skyon yod pas pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag ma grub par ston te /
translated: Thus it shows that the thesis and reason of the opponent are not established.

original: de yang dper na lhas byin dbyug pa can yin no snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul dbyug pa can gyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa de ni dus kyang ma yin gzugs las gzhan yang ma yin /
analyzed: de yang dper na lhas byin dbyug pa can yin no snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul dbyug pa can gyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa de ni dus kyang ma yin gzugs las gzhan yang ma yin /
translated: For example, the object of the mind that gives rise to the thought ‚ÄúDevadatta has a stick‚Äù is the stick itself, which is a different thing from the self of Devadatta who has the stick.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is not the time, nor is it different from form, nor is it permanent.üîΩIn the same way, the object of the mind that gives rise to the thought ‚ÄúThis is present form‚Äù is the present form itself.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus zhes bya bar pha rol po dag 'dod pa de yang dus kyang ma yin /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de'i yul da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus zhes bya bar pha rol po dag 'dod pa de yang dus kyang ma yin /
translated: The other thing that the opponent asserts, the so-called present time, is not the time,

original: @98b gzugs las gzhan yang ma yin /
analyzed: @98b gzugs las gzhan yang ma yin /
translated: nor is it different from form,

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it permanent.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs nyid kyang dus ma yin pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi bya bas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa de las gzhan pa'i dus kyang med pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi bye ba de nyid rtag pa yang ma yin par yid ches pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir /üîΩdes na pha rol po dag yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpog pas dus ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs nyid kyang dus ma yin pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi bya bas bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa de las gzhan pa'i dus kyang med pa'i phyir dang / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi bye ba de nyid rtag pa yang ma yin par yid ches pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir / des na pha rol po dag yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpog pas dus ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the present form itself is not a different time, because there is no other time that is not a different time from the action of present form, and because the present form itself is not permanent, the mind that believes this arises.üîΩTherefore, since it is inferred that the opponent believes this, the present form itself is not a different time, it is not a different time, it is not permanent, and it is not permanent.

original: pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa la chos can dus la bsgrub par bya ba chos dngos po rnams las gzhan nyid dang rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos can dus de'i ngo bo nyid dang dus de'i khyad par gzhan nyid dang rtag pa nyid ces bya ba
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa la chos can dus la bsgrub par bya ba chos dngos po rnams las gzhan nyid dang rtag pa nyid sgrub pa'i chos can dus de'i ngo bo nyid dang dus de'i khyad par gzhan nyid dang rtag pa nyid ces bya ba
translated: The opponent's thesis is that the subject, time, is established as a different thing from entities and as permanent. The subject is time, and the predicate is its nature, its difference from another time, and its permanence.

original: de dag bsal ba'i skyon yod pas kun rdzob tu yang pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag ma grub po /
analyzed: de dag bsal ba'i skyon yod pas kun rdzob tu yang pha rol po'i dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag ma grub po /
translated: Since the faults of those are eliminated, even in the relative, the opponent‚Äôs thesis and reason are not established.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: There is also no example.

original: don dam par dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can du 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir /üîΩde ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan
analyzed: don dam par dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can du 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir / de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan
translated: Because in the ultimate truth, the connection between a stick and a stick-bearer is not established.

original: pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de don dam par ma grub pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas rigs pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de don dam par ma grub pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas rigs pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is illogical‚Äù teaches that the example of the opponent, ‚Äújust as in the case of many sticks and few sticks, the cognition that arises with the conviction ‚ÄòThis is a stick-holder‚Äô is in terms of the object of the word ‚Äòstick-holder,‚Äô which is a thing that is different from the nature of Devadatta and so on,‚Äù is not established in the ultimate truth. Therefore, since the opponent‚Äôs proof has the fault of an incomplete example, it is illogical.

original: yang na gal te de ltar gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de khyad par gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni yang na gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gis sngar dam bcas pa'i phyogs da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos
analyzed: yang na gal te de ltar gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de khyad par gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni yang na gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gis sngar dam bcas pa'i phyogs da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos
translated: Again, if you prove that the mind that thinks ‚Äúthis is form‚Äù is an object of a word that is the referent of a specific attribute, then you would be proving what is already established for us, and you would contradict your own tenets.üîΩIf you are proving that the mind that thinks ‚Äúthis is present form‚Äù is an object of a word that is a thing that is different from itself, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: po dang 'bral pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te zhes bya ba de ni da ltar gyi gzugs rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te zhes bya bar ni mi sgrub
analyzed: po dang 'bral pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te zhes bya ba de ni da ltar gyi gzugs rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po da ltar gyi dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te zhes bya bar ni mi sgrub
translated: If you are proving that the mind that thinks ‚Äúthis is present form‚Äù is an object of a word that is a thing that is different from itself, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: kyi / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po @99a * //
analyzed: kyi / da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po @99a * //
translated: If you are proving that the object of the word ‚Äúpresent‚Äù is a thing that is different from the intrinsic reality of form,

analyzed: dus ma yin pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par sgrub po zhe na ni de lta na grub pa la sgrub pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i skyon chags pas mi rung ste /
translated: and that it is related to some other particular thing, such as a pot or a cloth, that is not the right time, then you are proving what is already established for us, and you commit the error of contradicting your own tenets.

original: 'di ltar de dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dbu ma pa'i phyogs la yang da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is because in the Madhyamaka system, the cognition that thinks ‚Äúpresent form‚Äù is not a cognition whose object is a thing that is different from the intrinsic reality of form and is related to time.

original: gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan dpe'i dngos po bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan dpe'i dngos po bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i khyad par gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Because it is established that the object of the word is related to the entity of form itself and to some other thing, such as a pot or a cloth, which is different from the entity of form, it is an establishment of what is already established.

original: khyed rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dus dang 'brel pa'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par 'dod pa'i phyir /

translated: Because you assert that the mind that thinks ‚Äúpresent form‚Äù is the object of the word that is related to an entity that is different from the entity of form itself and related to time,

analyzed: rang gi thub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: you contradict your own tenets.

original: ci ste blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: ci ste blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni dpe med de /
translated: But if you prove that the mind is the object that is related to the meaning of the word that has the characteristic of the time of form, then there is no example.

analyzed: blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de da
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúWe prove that the mind that thinks ‚Äòpresent form‚ÄôüîΩis related to the object that is the meaning of the term characterized by theüîΩpresent time, which is different from the present form itself,‚Äù then the object

original: ltar gyi gzugs dang rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin par bsgrubs pas des na da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de'i yul la da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las
analyzed: ltar gyi gzugs dang rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin par bsgrubs pas des na da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de'i yul la da ltar gyi gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid las
translated: of the mind that thinks ‚Äúpresent form‚Äù would be the present form itself andüîΩthe object that is the meaning of the term characterized by the present time,üîΩwhich is different from the present form itself. Therefore, the meaning of theüîΩterm characterized by the present time would be different from the entity of

original: gzhan pa da ltar gyi dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don logs shig na yod pas dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don ni gzugs kyi dngos po las gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sgrub po zhe na yang /
analyzed: gzhan pa da ltar gyi dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don logs shig na yod pas dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don ni gzugs kyi dngos po las gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar sgrub po zhe na yang /
