original: de lta na yang pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de la dpe med de /
analyzed: de lta na yang pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de la dpe med de /
translated: However, there is no example for the opponent‚Äôs proof.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩlhas byin dbyug pa can yin no snyam pa'i blo de ni gzugs kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin gyi /üîΩdus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can ma yin pas des na lhas byin dbyug pa can ma yin no snyam pa'i blo gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i yul can de gzugs @99b dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / lhas byin dbyug pa can yin no snyam pa'i blo de ni gzugs kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can yin gyi / dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel pa'i yul can ma yin pas des na lhas byin dbyug pa can ma yin no snyam pa'i blo gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i yul can de gzugs @99b dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel
translated: Why?üîΩThe mind that thinks Devadatta is a club wielder is a subject that is related to the meaning of the word form, but it is not a subject that is related to the meaning of the word time.

original: pa'i yul can yin par bstan par mi nus pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i yul can yin par bstan par mi nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the mind that thinks Devadatta is not a club wielder, which is a subject that is related to the meaning of the word form, cannot be shown to be a subject that is related to the meaning of the word time.

original: dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, that example is empty of the probandum.

original: dpyad par rgyas pa ni yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yod pa nyid dgag pa bstan pa bzhin du dus dgag pa yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dpyad par rgyas pa ni yod pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yod pa nyid dgag pa bstan pa bzhin du dus dgag pa yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The extensive analysis is like the refutation of existence. This means that just as the refutation of existence is presented, the refutation of time should be expressed in the same way.

original: de yang sngar phrad pa brtag pa'i skabs su mu stegs bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug las yod pa nyid dgag pa'i skabs su yod pa nyid dang ldan pas yod pa nyid du 'dod na yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang rang las yod pa nyid du
analyzed: de yang sngar phrad pa brtag pa'i skabs su mu stegs bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug las yod pa nyid dgag pa'i skabs su yod pa nyid dang ldan pas yod pa nyid du 'dod na yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang rang las yod pa nyid du
translated: Moreover, in the context of the analysis of contact, the refutation of existence is like the refutation of the six categories of the tƒ´rthika Vai≈õe·π£ika. If you assert that something exists because it possesses existence, then even nonexistence would exist from itself,

original: 'gyur te / de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: because it would have that nature. For example, like heat, even without depending on cold, it would be heat by its very nature.

original: yod pa nyid ma yin pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la yod pa nyid du rtogs pa tsam du zad de dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid yod pa nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la yod pa nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la yod pa nyid du rtogs pa tsam du zad de dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid yod pa nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la yod pa nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i
translated: It is merely the realization that the nonexistence of an entity does not depend on another entity. The dependence on another entity is not the cause of the cognition of existence, but existence is the cause of that cognition.

original: phyir ro // yod pa nyid dang yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid yod pa nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // yod pa nyid dang yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid yod pa nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that existence and nonexistence possess existence, then it would be pointless and contradictory to refute them.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis yod pa nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni yod pa nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis yod pa nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni yod pa nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you imagine that an inexpressible entity possesses existence later, then an entity does not possess existence.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin bas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin bas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du /
translated: Because it is an entity, like, for example, the inexpressible itself in a moment. Therefore, your inference is undermined by your own example.

original: 'dir yang dus nyid dang ldan pas dus nyid du 'dod na dus nyid ma yin pa yang rang las dus nyid du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'dir yang dus nyid dang ldan pas dus nyid du 'dod na dus nyid ma yin pa yang rang las dus nyid du 'gyur te ;
translated: If you assert that time is time because it possesses time, then that which is not time would become time by itself.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa lam ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa lam ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, fire would be hot by itself even without depending on cold things, because it would have that nature.

original: dus nyid ma yin pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la dus nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid dus nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la dus nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: dus nyid ma yin pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la dus nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid dus nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la dus nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir
translated: If you imagine that which is not time, which does not depend on other things, to be time, that is mere imagination. The dependence on other things is not the cause of the cognition of time, but time is the cause of that cognition.

original: ro // dus dang dus ma yin pa nyid dus nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // dus dang dus ma yin pa nyid dus nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that time and nontime possess time, that is meaningless and is inconsistent with your refutation.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis dus nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni dus nyid dang @100a * //üîΩldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis dus nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni dus nyid dang @100a * // ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you imagine that a non-thing later comes to possess time, then a non-thing does not possess time.üîΩBecause it is a non-thing, like the non-thing that is the moment of that non-thing itself.üîΩThis is the refutation of your own inference.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'oüîΩ/ // / bam po drug cu gsum pa /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du ci rigs par dgag par bya'o / // / bam po drug cu gsum pa /
translated: As explained above, you should refute the assertions of the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on in accordance with the system presented above.

original: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa gang dag dus dngos po rnams las gzhan pa dang rtag par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par spyir bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa la sogs pa gang dag dus dngos po rnams las gzhan pa dang rtag par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung mi 'thad par spyir bstan nas /
translated: Thus, in general, the texts of the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on, who assert that time is different from things and is permanent, are untenable.

original: da ni 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ltos nas grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: da ni 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ltos nas grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: Now, if time were to exist as some thing, would it be established in dependence on that?

original: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or would it be established from itself without depending on that?

original: brtag pa gnyis ka yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdus kyi dbye ba 'grub na yang ltos pa can nam /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis ka yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / dus kyi dbye ba 'grub na yang ltos pa can nam /
translated: In order to demonstrate that both of these analyses are untenable,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIf the divisions of time were to be established, then would they be dependent or

original: 'on te ma ltos pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'on te ma ltos pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: independent?‚Äù

original: de la re zhig rtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate that the first, permanence, is untenable,

original: de la gal te ltos pa can du dam 'cha' na /
analyzed: de la gal te ltos pa can du dam 'cha' na /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you maintain that they are dependent,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //üîΩgal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa // gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: then the present and the future

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: would exist in the past.‚Äù

original: des ni pha rol po dag dus ltos te 'grub par 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag dus ltos te 'grub par 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
translated: This demonstrates the opponent‚Äôs position that time is established in dependence.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'dus pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'dus pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na'o //
translated: If the present and future times exist in dependence on the past time,

original: de ni de mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then he demonstrates the inferential statement that establishes that as untenable:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and the future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the past.

original: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If they were time, they would be dependent, like the past.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, if the present were time, it would be dependent, like the past.

original: dper na 'das pa'i dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yodüîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na 'das pa'i dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if the present and future were time, they would exist in the past because they would be dependent.üîΩIf they existed in the past, they would be past.

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the present and future would exist in the past.

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed in the past, they would be past.

original: de ltar na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there would be only one time.

original: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If it were only one time, then reliance would be untenable.

original: 'di ltar @100b de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar @100b de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: In that case, how could it be that it relies on itself? Because reliance is untenable, time is untenable.üîΩOr else,

original: yang na ; da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: yang na ; da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future

original: gal te 'das pa ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das pa ltos gyur na //
translated: depended on the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: the present and future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the past.

original: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas ni /üîΩgal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus na yod
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas ni / gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus na yod
translated: This is the remainder of the phrase ‚Äúat one time.‚ÄùüîΩIf the present and future times existed in dependence on the past time, as the opponent asserts, then the present and future times would exist in the past at one time.

original: pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: This shows the error that the present and future would exist in the past at one time.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference that establishes that, he says:

original: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, those that are related would also be simultaneous, because if they were never unrelated, they would be related.

original: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like a father and son.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property that proves it, and the example are applied in order.üîΩFor example, a father and son are simultaneous, because if they were never unrelated, they would be related.

original: dper na pha dang bu dag ni lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gang dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang bcas pa de
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu dag ni lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gang dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang bcas pa de
translated: In the same way, if the present and future were related to the past,

original: dag kyang lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag kyang lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: they would also be simultaneous, because if they were never unrelated, they would be related.

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the present and future would sometimes exist in the past.

original: lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus ltos na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang lan 'ga' 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' 'das pa'i dus ltos na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang lan 'ga' 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they sometimes existed in the past, then those two would sometimes be in the past.

original: de ltar na lan 'ga' dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lan 'ga' dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, they would sometimes be in one time period.

original: lan 'ga' dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: lan 'ga' dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If they were sometimes in one time period, it would not be tenable that they rely on each other.

original: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could they rely on each other?

original: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because it is untenable that they rely on each other, time is untenable.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa snga mas ni 'das pa'i dus nyid bzhin du rtag tu dus gcig nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur bar bstan la /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa snga mas ni 'das pa'i dus nyid bzhin du rtag tu dus gcig nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur bar bstan la /
translated: With respect to this, the former inference demonstrates that, like the past itself, there would be the error that time would always be one time period.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'dis ni pha dang bu dag bzhin du lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na dus gcig nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'dis ni pha dang bu dag bzhin du lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na dus gcig nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: This inference demonstrates that, like the father and the son, if they were not sometimes different, there would be the error that time would be one time period.

original: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das @101a * //üîΩpa'i dus na yod par mi 'dod na de lta na skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das @101a * // pa'i dus na yod par mi 'dod na de lta na skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: But if you do not assert that the present and future exist in the past due to the teaching of the reason of dependence, then this other error would also ensue.

original: ci ste pha rol po dag dbu ma pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan kyang skyon der 'gyur bar khas mi len cing /
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po dag dbu ma pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan kyang skyon der 'gyur bar khas mi len cing /
translated: This is stated in response to the following: ‚ÄúThe present and future would exist in the past due to the teaching of the reason of dependence by the MƒÅdhyamika, but we do not accept that error.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang yin la /
translated: The present and future are dependent on the past,üîΩbut we do not assert that the present and future exist in the past.‚Äù

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par yang mi 'dod na de lta na de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par yang mi 'dod na de lta na de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that if you do not assert that the present and future exist in the past due to the teaching of the reason of dependence by the MƒÅdhyamika, but you do not accept that error, then this other error would ensue: it would be untenable that they are dependent.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future

original: gal te de na med gyur na //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /üîΩdes ni pha rol po dag da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos te 'grub par yang 'dod la /
analyzed: gal te de na med gyur na // zhes bya ba smras te / des ni pha rol po dag da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos te 'grub par yang 'dod la /
translated: did not exist there,üîΩBy that he demonstrates the scriptures of the opponent, who asserts that the present and future are established in reliance on the past,

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par yang mi 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par yang mi 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
translated: but who does not assert that the present and future exist in the past.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na'o //
translated: If the present and future did not exist there in the past,

original: da ni de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa mi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩda ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ni de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa mi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that in that case it is untenable that the present and future rely on the past, he says:

original: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: How could the present and future

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: rely on it?

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na /
translated: If the present and future did not exist there in the past,

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'das pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar 'das pa'i dus de la ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'das pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar 'das pa'i dus de la ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: How could the present and future that do not exist in the past rely on the past?

original: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na ltos par 'thad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na ltos par 'thad pa yin na /
translated: If all three times were to exist together, it would be tenable that they rely on each other.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa 'das pa'i dus na med pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa 'das pa'i dus na med pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is untenable that the present and future that do not exist in the past rely on the past.

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ltos te 'grub la /üîΩltos te 'grub par khas len na dus gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas dus mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ltos te 'grub la / ltos te 'grub par khas len na dus gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas dus mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If they were to rely on each other as the opponent asserts, they would be established in reliance.üîΩIf you accept that they are established in reliance, it follows that they would exist at the same time.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate that time is untenable, he says: If they were to rely on each other, the present and future would be established as the present and future in reliance on the past.

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te @101b 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'dasüîΩpa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te @101b 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the present and future exist in reliance on the past, then the present and future would be established as the present and future in reliance on the past.

original: de ltar 'grub par khas len na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'grub par khas len na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they are established in that way, then the present and future would exist in the past.

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed in the past, then those two would also be past.

original: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be only one time.

original: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If there were only one time, reliance would be untenable.

original: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could it be that it relies on itself?

original: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because reliance is untenable, time is untenable.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the valid cognition of that,

original: kha cig na re de lta na don dam par da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re de lta na don dam par da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag med de /
translated: some say: In that case, in the ultimate, the entities of the present and future do not exist in the present and future because

original: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: if they are time, they would be dependent.

original: dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhe'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like the past.

original: de ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dngos po ltos pa dang bcas pa thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dngos po ltos pa dang bcas pa thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: This is a syllogism of the author of the commentary himself proving that all things that are dependent are ultimately essenceless.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na 'das pa'i dus ni dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'das pa'i dus ni dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the past is time, but it is dependent.

original: de la ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin da ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin da ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Just as the present and future do not exist in the past, so too if the present and future exist in dependence on the past, they would not exist by way of their own intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the past.

original: 'das pa'i dus bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe yin /üîΩda ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dpe yin / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the past‚Äù is the example.

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif the present and future depended on the past‚Äù is the application.

original: zhes gsungs pas 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it demonstrates a reason based on a relationship‚Äù is the conclusion.üîΩFor example, the past is related to the past itself, and therefore it exists in the past.

original: dper na 'das pa'i dus ni 'das pa'i dus nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang 'das pa'i dus te de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par
analyzed: dper na 'das pa'i dus ni 'das pa'i dus nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang 'das pa'i dus te de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yod par
translated: In the same way, the present and future are related to the past, and therefore they exist in the past.

original: 'gyur te / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus dang 'brel par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur te / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus dang 'brel par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the present and future are related to the past?

original: dus yod par smra ba dag nyid da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par 'dod pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dus yod par smra ba dag nyid da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par 'dod pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand this from the fact that those who maintain that time exists assert that the present and future exist in dependence on the past.

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig
translated: Thus, since the error arises that the present and future exist in the past, the assertion that the present and future exist in dependence on the past is illogical.

original: yin no // gzhan ma yin pa na re 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // gzhan ma yin pa na re 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The opponent says: If they are not different, it is illogical to state a reason of relation.

original: ltos pa dang 'brel pa nyid yin yang dbyug pa can dbyug pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan de ba sharma la sogs pa dag gis rnam par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges paüîΩnyid yin pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang 'brel pa nyid yin yang dbyug pa can dbyug pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan de ba sharma la sogs pa dag gis rnam par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a refutation of the reason ‚Äúbecause they are related‚Äù as explained by the elder Deva≈õarman and so on, because it is illogical.

original: 'di ni dbyug pa can lhas byin la dbyug pa la ltos shing 'brel pa yin yang dbyug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur bar mthong bas nges na ci re zhig 'brel pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par
analyzed: 'di ni dbyug pa can lhas byin la dbyug pa la ltos shing 'brel pa yin yang dbyug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur bar mthong bas nges na ci re zhig 'brel pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par
translated: This is because it is seen that the stick-holder Devadatta is related to the stick but is not the stick itself.

original: 'gyur ram / 'on te 'brel pa'i phyir dbyug pa can dbyug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur @104a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ram / 'on te 'brel pa'i phyir dbyug pa can dbyug pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur @104a * //
translated: Or is it like the stick-holder, who is not the stick itself because of the connection?

original: pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir 'grel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir 'grel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is uncertain, therefore the reason ‚Äúbecause of the connection‚Äù is illogical.

original: gzhan yang 'di na pha dang bu lta bu dus tha dad pa dag la yang 'grel pa yod par mthong bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na pha dang bu lta bu dus tha dad pa dag la yang 'grel pa yod par mthong bas /
translated: Moreover, here it is seen that there is connection between father and son, even though they are different in time.

original: des na dus tha dad par gyur na yang 'brel pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na dus tha dad par gyur na yang 'brel pa 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even though they become different in time, connection is established.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa la ltos par gyur na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa la ltos par gyur na /
translated: If the present and future depend on the past,

original: de dag dus gcig tu gyur pa la 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dus gcig tu gyur pa la 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then because connection exists between them in the same time,üîΩlike the past time, the reason ‚Äúbecause of the connection‚Äù is uncertain and illogical.

original: dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin te zhes gang smras pa de yang ma nges pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad do //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin te zhes gang smras pa de yang ma nges pas rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by the author of the commentary himself.

original: de ltar re zhig ltos pa can gyi dus ma thub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ltos pa can gyi dus ma thub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Thus, ‚Äútime is not tenable as a basis for dependence‚Äù is the conclusion.üîΩIf time were to exist as a thing,

original: sngar da ni 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: sngar da ni 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: then it would be established in dependence on that.üîΩBut if it were to be established from itself without dependence,

original: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes smos pa la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes smos pa la brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: then both of these analyses would be untenable.

original: da ni brtag pa gnyis mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brtag pa gnyis mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the second analysis is untenable,üîΩit is said:

original: 'on te ma ltos par dam 'cha' na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ma ltos par dam 'cha' na de'i phyir /
translated: If you assert that it is not dependent,üîΩthen it is said:

original: 'das pa la ni ma ltos par //
analyzed: 'das pa la ni ma ltos par //
translated: Without depending on the past,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: those two are not established.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma ltos par yang dag ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma ltos par yang dag ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without depending on the past, the present and future times are not established from themselves.

original: de gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate those two,üîΩit is said:

original: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi rgyu 'das pa la ma ltos par da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa de gnyis rgyu med par 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi rgyu 'das pa la ma ltos par da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa de gnyis rgyu med par 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The present and future are not established without depending on the past cause. The present and future are not established without a cause.

original: de'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the summary of that, he said:

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ltos pa med par da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ma grub pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ltos pa med par da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ma grub pa //
translated: Since the present and future are not established without dependence,

original: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ongs dus kyang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /üîΩde ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas ltos par mi 'thad la 'das pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang
analyzed: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ongs dus kyang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smras te / de ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas ltos par mi 'thad la 'das pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang
translated: Therefore the present and future times do not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the present and future do not exist in the past time, it is untenable that they depend on the past. Also, without depending on the past, the establishment of those two does not exist. Therefore the present and future times do not exist.

original: de gnyis yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de gnyis yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Since those two do not exist, to explain the reason, he said:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sgrar brjod pa'i dus dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sgrar brjod pa'i dus dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the times expressed as the past, future, and present do not exist.

original: ma ltos par yang dus @104b gsum yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma ltos par yang dus @104b gsum yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that the three times do not exist without depending on each other.

original: des ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that the second conception is untenable.

original: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis //
analyzed: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis //
translated: The remaining two pairs should be understood in the same way.

original: lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i dus gnyis po bsnor ba dag kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i dus gnyis po bsnor ba dag kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remaining two pairs should be understood in the same way means that the two pairs, the past and present and the future and present, should be understood in the same way as the past and future.

original: ci ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis da ltar byung ba'i dus la ltos pa dang ma ltos
analyzed: ci ltar da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis da ltar byung ba'i dus la ltos pa dang ma ltos
translated: Just as it has been demonstrated that the two times, the present and the future, are not established in dependence on or without dependence on the past, so the two times, the past and the future, are not established in dependence on or without dependence on the present.

original: par yang 'grub pa med pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa'i dus gnyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bsnor ba lhag ma gnyis kyang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes ston to //

translated: the best, the worst, the middling, etc.

original: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
translated: And the one, etc. should be understood.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: de la re zhig / mchog dang tha ma 'bring sogs dang // zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig / mchog dang tha ma 'bring sogs dang // zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Among them, first, in order to demonstrate the best, the worst, the middling, etc.,

original: de la mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa ni rang gi rigs las ma 'das par yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa ni rang gi rigs las ma 'das par yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that the best, the worst, the middling, etc. are endowed with the increase and decrease of qualities without going beyond their own type.

original: des ni mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring zhes bya ba dag gi tshul bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring zhes bya ba dag gi tshul bstan to //
translated: This shows the superior, inferior, and middling.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: This is how it is applied.

original: dper na bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dag las re zhig bram ze yang rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs dag las re zhig bram ze yang rang gi rigs las ma 'das pa bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: For example, among Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, a Brahmin is not beyond his own class. Because of possessing the increase of good qualities, it is called superior.

original: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
analyzed: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
translated: Because of possessing the decrease of good qualities, it is called inferior.

original: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of possessing neither the increase nor decrease of good qualities, it is called middling.

original: rgyal rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya /
translated: A Kshatriya is not beyond his own class. Because of possessing the increase of good qualities, it is called superior.

original: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
analyzed: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
translated: Because of possessing the decrease of good qualities, it is called inferior.

original: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
translated: The middling is the one who possesses neither increase nor decrease of good qualities.

original: rje'u rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya /
analyzed: rje'u rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya /
translated: The best is the one who possesses the increase of good qualities, without going beyond his own caste.

original: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
analyzed: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
translated: The worst is the one who possesses the decrease of good qualities.

original: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring @105b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring @105b zhes bya'o //
translated: The middling is the one who possesses neither increase nor decrease of good qualities.

original: dmangs rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: dmangs rigs kyang rang gi rigs las ma 'das bzhin du yon tan 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ni mchog ces bya'o //
translated: The best is the one who possesses the increase of good qualities, without going beyond his own caste.

original: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
analyzed: yon tan 'grib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni tha ma zhes bya /
translated: The worst is the one who possesses the decrease of good qualities.

original: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba yang ma yin 'grib pa yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni 'bring zhes bya'o //
translated: The middling is the one who possesses neither increase nor decrease of good qualities.

original: yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du skyon yang de las bzlog te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du skyon yang de las bzlog te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The faults should be applied in the opposite manner to the qualities.

original: ji ltar rigs bzhi la yon tan dang skyon gyis mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring gi tshul bstan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs bzhi la yon tan dang skyon gyis mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring gi tshul bstan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the four castes are shown to be superior, inferior, and middling in terms of their qualities and faults,

original: dngos po srid do cog thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po srid do cog thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so too should this be applied to all things.

original: 'dir yang gal te mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de dag ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de dag ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur ram /
translated: Here, if something called ‚Äúsuperior, inferior, and middling‚Äù existed, would they be established in dependence on each other?

original: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma ltos par rang las 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or would they be established from themselves without depending on each other?

original: brtag pa gnyis ka yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang ltos pa can nam /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis ka yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir de dag kyang ltos pa can nam /
translated: In order to show that both of these analyses are untenable, it says:üîΩDo they exist in dependence on each other,

original: 'on te ma ltos par 'grub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'on te ma ltos par 'grub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Or do they exist without depending on each other?

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the first analysis is untenable, it says:

original: de la don dam par mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de la don dam par mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In that regard, in the ultimate, those who have the nature of the best and the middling do not have the nature of the best and the middling,

original: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: because if they had the nature of the best and the middling, they would be dependent.

original: dper na tha ma'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na tha ma'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like those who have the nature of the worst.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na tha ma'i ngang tshul can ni ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na tha ma'i ngang tshul can ni ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, those who have the nature of the worst, if they had the nature of the worst, would be dependent.

original: de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can dag kyang ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de la de'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can dag kyang ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang de dag gi ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Just as they do not have the nature of the worst, in the same way, those who have the nature of the best and the middling, if they had the nature of the best and the middling, would be dependent. Therefore, they also do not have the nature of the best and the middling.

original: de bzhin du ngang tshul can gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /üîΩdon dam par mchog dang tha ma'i ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngang tshul can gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te / don dam par mchog dang tha ma'i ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: So too, the other two types of states should be expressed in the same way.

original: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: The ultimate supreme and inferior states do not have their own intrinsic reality, because if they were states, they would be dependent.

original: dper na 'bring gi ngang tshul can bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du don dam par 'bring dang tha ma'i ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: dper na 'bring gi ngang tshul can bzhin no // de bzhin du don dam par 'bring dang tha ma'i ngang tshul can dag la de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: For example, it is like the state of the middling.

original: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: So too, the ultimate middling and inferior states do not have their own intrinsic reality, because if they were states, they would be dependent.

original: dper na mchog gi ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na mchog gi ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the state of the supreme.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni ji ltar @106a * //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni ji ltar @106a * //
translated: By these reasonings, the three times are not established.

original: sngar dus brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: sngar dus brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Previously, in the chapter on the examination of time, it was said:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: depended on the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: then the present and future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: It would have existed in the past.

original: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If it were time itself, it would be dependent, like the past.

original: yang na / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: yang na / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: Again, if the present and future

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: depended on the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: the present and future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would have existed in the past.

original: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwould have existed‚Äù is a remainder from the verse that goes, ‚ÄúIt would have existed in the past.‚Äù

original: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: In this context, some say, ‚ÄúIf they were dependent, they would exist at the same time.

original: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: If they were not incompatible at any time, they would be dependent.üîΩFor example, it is like a father and son.‚Äù

original: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: In this context, if the inferiorüîΩdepended on the superior,üîΩthe inferior would existüîΩin the superior.

original: 'dir yang / mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: 'dir yang / mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
translated: If the superior and the middling

original: gal te tha ma ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te tha ma ltos gyur na //
translated: depended on the inferior,

original: mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
translated: the superior and the middling

original: tha ma la ni yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha ma la ni yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the inferior.

original: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tha ma'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ngang tshul can nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tha ma'i ngang tshul can bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If it has a state, then it would have to rely on something else, like the inferior state.üîΩOr else,

original: yang na / mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: yang na / mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
translated: If the superior and middling states

original: gal te tha ma ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te tha ma ltos gyur na //
translated: rely on the inferior state,

original: mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring gi ngang tshul can //
translated: then the superior and middling states

original: tha ma la ni yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: tha ma la ni yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the inferior state.

original: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat some time‚Äù is supplied to complete the sentence.

original: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Here, those that rely on something else would be simultaneous,

original: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: because they would not be incompatible at some time, since they rely on something else.üîΩFor example, like a father and son.

original: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba'i skabs bstan to //
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin no zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ba'i skabs bstan to //
translated: The context is explained as before.

original: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma la yod par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma la yod par mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept that the superior, middling, and inferior states exist in the inferior state, even though you have presented the reason that they rely on something else,üîΩthen the superior and middling states would not exist in the inferior state.

original: de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag dbu ma pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pas /üîΩmchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan kyang skyon der 'gyur bar khas mi len cing mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag dbu ma pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan pas / mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan kyang skyon der 'gyur bar khas mi len cing mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang yin la /
translated: In that case, how could the best and medium be dependent on the worst?üîΩThis is saying, ‚ÄúIf the opponent does not accept the fault that the best and medium would exist in the worst, even though the Madhyamaka has demonstrated the reason of their dependence,

original: mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par yang mi 'dod na de lta na de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes ston te de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos par mi 'thad
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par yang mi 'dod na de lta na de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid mi 'thad pa'i skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes ston te de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos par mi 'thad
translated: and if they do not assert that the best and medium are dependent on the worst, then this other fault that their dependence is untenable would also arise for them.‚ÄùüîΩIn that case, it is untenable that the best and medium are dependent on the worst.

original: do // 'di ltar @106b mchog dang 'bring dag gal te tha ma la med par gyur na /
analyzed: do // 'di ltar @106b mchog dang 'bring dag gal te tha ma la med par gyur na /
translated: In this way, if the best and medium do not exist in the worst,

original: mchog dang 'bring tha ma la med pa de dag ji ltar tha ma de la ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring tha ma la med pa de dag ji ltar tha ma de la ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not exist in the best, middling, and least be dependent on the least?

original: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na /
translated: If all three existed,

original: ltos par 'thad pa yin na mchog dang 'bring tha ma la med pa dag tha ma la ltos par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ltos par 'thad pa yin na mchog dang 'bring tha ma la med pa dag tha ma la ltos par mi 'thad do //
translated: then it would be tenable that they are dependent. But it is not tenable that that which does not exist in the best, middling, and least is dependent on the least.

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ltos te 'grub la /
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na ltos te 'grub la /
translated: If they exist in dependence,üîΩthen it follows that they are of one nature.üîΩIf it is accepted that they are established in dependence, then it follows that they are of one nature.

original: ltos te 'grub par khas len na ngang tshul gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas ngang tshul mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ltos te 'grub par khas len na ngang tshul gcig tu thal bar 'gyur bas ngang tshul mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate that it is untenable that they are of one nature, it is said:üîΩIf they exist in dependence,üîΩthen the best and middling would be established as the best and middling in dependence on the least.

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar mchog dang 'bring dag gal te tha ma la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar mchog dang 'bring dag gal te tha ma la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
translated: If the best and middling existed in dependence on the least, as the opponent asserts, then the best and middling would not exist without the least.

original: de lta na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pas mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since they are dependent, the best and medium are established as best and medium in reliance on the worst.

original: de ltar 'grub par khas len na de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'grub par khas len na de lta na mchog dang 'bring dag tha ma la yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they are established in that way, then the best and medium would exist in the worst.

original: tha ma la yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang tha ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha ma la yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang tha ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed in the worst, then those two would also be worst.

original: de lta na ngang tshul gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ngang tshul gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be only one mode of being.

original: ngang tshul gcig kho na yin na ltos par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ngang tshul gcig kho na yin na ltos par mi 'thad de /
translated: If there is only one mode of being, it is untenable that they are dependent.

original: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could that very thing be dependent on that very thing?

original: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ngang tshul yang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ngang tshul yang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since dependence is untenable, it is untenable that they have a mode of being.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re /
translated: In order to demonstrate the measure of that, the author of the commentary himself says:
