translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation and proof statements, ‚Äúone, etc., should be understood in the same way,‚Äù he says,

original: de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne, etc., should be understood in the same way.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: gcig nyid dang gnyis nyid dang mang po nyid la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang gnyis nyid dang mang po nyid la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne, two, many, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang ltos pa can nam /
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang ltos pa can nam /
translated: Here also, ‚Äúone should understand in the same way as before‚Äù means that these are also dependent or independent.

original: 'on te ma ltos par 'grub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'on te ma ltos par 'grub pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: But if it were to be established without depending on another,

original: brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: then both of these analyses are untenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate that the first analysis is untenable,

original: don dam par grangs gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par grangs gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: ultimately, the entity of oneness does not exist as one,üîΩbecause if it were a number, it would be like two, since it would depend on another.

original: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gnyis nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gnyis nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what should be said.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These should be applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example.

original: dper na gnyis nyid ni grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la yang gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du grangs gcig nyid kyang grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la yang gcig nyid kyi ngo boüîΩnyid med do //
analyzed: dper na gnyis nyid ni grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la yang gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du grangs gcig nyid kyang grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de la yang gcig nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Similarly, if singularity is a number, it is dependent, and therefore it does not have the entity of singularity.

original: sogs pa'i sgras lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be applied to the remaining two.

original: don dam par grangs gnyis nyid la gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par grangs gnyis nyid la gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In reality, duality does not have the entity of duality,

original: grangs yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: grangs yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no //
translated: because if it is a number, it is dependent, and therefore it is singularity.

original: de bzhin du don @108b dam par grangs mang po nyid la mang po nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don @108b dam par grangs mang po nyid la mang po nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In the same way, in reality, plurality does not have the entity of plurality,

original: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gcig nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gcig nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: because if it is a number, it is dependent, and therefore it is singularity.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni grangs ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni grangs ltos te 'grub par mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: These arguments demonstrate that it is untenable that numbers are established in dependence on each other.

original: ma ltos par 'grub pa med pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa yang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma ltos par 'grub pa med pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa yang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The second analysis, that they are not established without depending, should be applied as appropriate, as before.

original: de dag ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The verse that teaches that they are not established either in dependence or without dependence should be applied as follows:

original: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
translated: If the one and the two

original: gal te mang po ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mang po ltos gyur na //
translated: Were to depend on the many,

original: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
translated: The one and the two

original: mang po la ni yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mang po la ni yod par 'gyur //
translated: Would exist in the many.

original: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
translated: If the one and the two

original: gal te de la med gyur na //üîΩgcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gal te de la med gyur na // gcig dang gnyis kyi ngang tshul can //
translated: Were not to exist in the many,üîΩHow could the one and the two

original: ji ltar de la ltos par gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par gyur //
translated: Depend on the many?

original: mang po la ni ma ltos par //
analyzed: mang po la ni ma ltos par //
translated: Without depending on the many,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Those two are not established.üîΩTherefore, the one and the two

original: de phyir gcig gi ngang tshul dang // gnyis kyi tshul yang yod ma yin /
analyzed: de phyir gcig gi ngang tshul dang // gnyis kyi tshul yang yod ma yin /
translated: Do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And similarly, the two remaining verses should be applied in the same way.

original: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: If they have the nature of one and many,

original: gal te gnyis la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gnyis la ltos gyur na //
translated: And if they depend on two,

original: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: Then they would have the nature of one and many,

original: gnyis la yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis la yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: And they would exist in two.

original: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can ;
analyzed: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can ;
translated: If they have the nature of one and many,

original: / gal te de na med gyur na //
analyzed: / gal te de na med gyur na //
translated: And if they do not exist there,

original: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gcig dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: Then they have the nature of one and many,

original: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: But how could they depend on that?

original: gnyis kyi ngang tshul ma ltos par //
analyzed: gnyis kyi ngang tshul ma ltos par //
translated: Without depending on the nature of two,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Those two cannot be established.üîΩTherefore, they do not have the nature of one,

original: de phyir gcig gi ngang tshul dang // mang po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir gcig gi ngang tshul dang // mang po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: Nor do they have the nature of many.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: If they have the nature of two and many,

original: gal te gcig la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gcig la ltos gyur na //
translated: And if they depend on one,

original: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: Then they would have the nature of two and many,

original: gcig la yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig la yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: And they would exist in one.

original: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: The mode of being of two or many

original: gal te de na med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de na med gyur na //
translated: If it does not exist in that,

original: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: gnyis dang mang po'i ngang tshul can //
translated: The mode of being of two or many

original: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: How could it rely on that?

original: gcig gi ngang tshul ma ltos par /
analyzed: gcig gi ngang tshul ma ltos par /
translated: The mode of being of one, not relying on that,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: The establishment of those two does not exist.

original: de phyir gnyis kyi ngang tshul dang / mang po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir gnyis kyi ngang tshul dang / mang po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the mode of being of two and also many do not exist.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: de dag gis snga ma bzhin du sgrub pa dang // sun dbyung ba dag kyang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis snga ma bzhin du sgrub pa dang // sun dbyung ba dag kyang bstan par bya'o //
translated: As before, the proofs and refutations should be explained.

original: gang dag grangs dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de @109a * //üîΩdag gnyis pa med pa ni gcig yin la /üîΩde dang gzhan gnyis yin /
analyzed: gang dag grangs dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de @109a * // dag gnyis pa med pa ni gcig yin la / de dang gzhan gnyis yin /
translated: Those who do not assert number to be different from thingsüîΩare two, because they are not different from one.

original: de gnyis dang gzhan ni gsum yin //
analyzed: de gnyis dang gzhan ni gsum yin //
translated: Those two and different are three.

original: de phan chad ni mang po yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dgag pa dag bstan pas ni bye brag pa dag grangs dngos po las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de phan chad ni mang po yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni sngar grangs can dgag pa dag bstan pas ni bye brag pa dag grangs dngos po las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa bstan to //
translated: They assert that beyond that, it is many.üîΩThe refutation of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya previously explained refutes the Vai≈õe·π£ika assertion that number is a substance that is a meaning of a word that is different from the thing.

original: skabs 'dis ni bye brag pa dag las gang dag grangs zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa ston te /
analyzed: skabs 'dis ni bye brag pa dag las gang dag grangs zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa ston te /
translated: This section refutes the Vai≈õe·π£ika assertion that number is not a thing that is different from the thing that is the meaning of the word number.

original: de dag na re grangs gcig ces bya ba ni gnyis pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag na re grangs gcig ces bya ba ni gnyis pa med pa'o //
translated: They say that one is the absence of a second.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gcig de dang gzhan phrad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gcig de dang gzhan phrad pa'o //
translated: Two is the conjunction of that one and another.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dang gzhan phrad pa'o //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dang gzhan phrad pa'o //
translated: Three is the conjunction of those two and another.

original: de phan chad ni mang po yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de phan chad ni mang po yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Beyond that, it is many.

original: de dag gi gzhung dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung dgag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the refutation of their position,

original: de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: it should be explained as before.

original: don dam par gcig la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par gcig la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Ultimately, one does not have the entityness of the other,

original: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they are enumerated, like the other one.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.üîΩFor example, the other one and the two and so on are enumerated, and therefore they do not have the entityness of two and so on.

original: dper na gcig las gzhan pa gnyis la sogs pa ni bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du gcig kyang bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang gcig gi ngo bo nyid med
analyzed: dper na gcig las gzhan pa gnyis la sogs pa ni bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag la gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du gcig kyang bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de la yang gcig gi ngo bo nyid med
translated: Likewise, one is enumerated, and therefore it also does not have the entityness of one.üîΩSimilarly, two does not have the entityness of two and so on should be stated.

original: de / de bzhin du gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de / de bzhin du gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: They are connected in the following way:

original: don dam par gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: ultimately, two does not have the entityness of two,üîΩbecause it is enumerated.

original: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because they are countable, like something else.

original: gsum la gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gsum la gsum gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The three do not have the nature of three,

original: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because they are countable, like something else.

original: mang po la mang po'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: mang po la mang po'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Many do not have the nature of many,

original: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because they are countable, like something else.üîΩHaving analyzed the meaning of the thesis, one should apply it extensively as before.

original: dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya bas ni grangs can dgag pa'i skabs de dag la dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro zhes bya bas ni grangs can dgag pa'i skabs de dag la dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
translated: This teaches that in those contexts refuting the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the thesis is the only difference;

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag snga ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the reason and example are applied as before.

original: gcig dang gnyis dang mang po dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa rgyas par sbyar ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis dang mang po dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa rgyas par sbyar ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The inference refuting one, two, and many should be applied extensively.

original: @109b da ni gcig la sogs pa 'ang shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsogs pa'i sgras ni chung ngu dang / chen po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: @109b da ni gcig la sogs pa 'ang shes par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir / sogs pa'i sgras ni chung ngu dang / chen po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the inclusion of such things as one, the root text states:üîΩThe words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include small and large, long and short, near and far, past and future, cause and effect, the conditioned and the unconditioned, and so on.

original: de dag kyang ltos pa dang ma ltos par 'grub pa med pa'i tshul snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ltos pa dang ma ltos par 'grub pa med pa'i tshul snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And just as the previous arguments apply to the establishment of the prior and subsequent existences, they also apply to the establishment of these in the same way.

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang don dam par rang las rab tu 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang don dam par rang las rab tu 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, none of these are ultimately established from themselves.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: However, in terms of worldly convention, they should be expressed in accordance with what is commonly accepted.

original: dus yod par smra ba dag na re don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus yod par smra ba dag na re don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Those who maintain that time exists say: Time definitely exists ultimately.

original: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has measure.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni tshad med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni tshad med de /
translated: That which does not exist has no measure,

original: dper na rta'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: dus la ni tshad skad cig dang / thang cig dang // yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag yod do //
analyzed: dus la ni tshad skad cig dang / thang cig dang // yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag yod do //
translated: Time has measure, such as a moment, a minute, an hour, a day, a night, a fortnight, a month, a season, a year, and so on.

original: gang tshad dang ldan pa de ni yod de /
analyzed: gang tshad dang ldan pa de ni yod de /
translated: That which has measure exists,üîΩlike grain and so on. Therefore time definitely exists.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni dus yod par smra ba dag skad cig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dus yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni dus yod par smra ba dag skad cig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dus yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te
translated: This is a statement that proves time exists through the reason that it has measure, such as a moment and so on.

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩ'di na rta'i rva lta bu med pa gang tshad dang mi ldan pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi 'bru la sogs pa gang dag tshad dang ldan pa de dag ni yod pa yin pa de bzhin du dus kyang skad cig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / 'di na rta'i rva lta bu med pa gang tshad dang mi ldan pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi 'bru la sogs pa gang dag tshad dang ldan pa de dag ni yod pa yin pa de bzhin du dus kyang skad cig la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan
translated: They are the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the proof, the example of the similar class, and the conclusion.

original: pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say: ‚ÄúThat which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, is not a measure. That which is a measure, such as grain, does exist. In the same way, time also exists because it is a measure of moments and so on.‚Äù

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: One does not apprehend non-enduring time.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The collection of formations is non-enduring because it has the nature of arising and disintegrating.

original: de la ni khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba @110a * //
analyzed: de la ni khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba @110a * //
translated: You also do not hold that time exists even conventionally.

original: smras te ; skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag ni nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang /
analyzed: smras te ; skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag ni nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang /
translated: You say that instants, moments, hours, nights, days, fortnights, months, seasons, years, and so on are the states of the collection of internal and external formations that arise and disintegrate and definitely do not endure.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid dag gi gnas skabs yin la 'du byed kyi tshogs de dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas nges par mi gnas pa de nges par mi gnas pa de la ni dus yod par
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid dag gi gnas skabs yin la 'du byed kyi tshogs de dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas nges par mi gnas pa de nges par mi gnas pa de la ni dus yod par
translated: Since those collections of formations have the qualities of arising and disintegrating, they definitely do not endure.

original: smra ba khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs skad cig ma la sogs pas tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pas dus dngos po las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don logs shig
analyzed: smra ba khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs skad cig ma la sogs pas tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pas dus dngos po las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don logs shig
translated: You also, when speaking conventionally, do not apprehend time as a thing, and therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause time is endowed with measure, like an instant,‚Äù is not established.üîΩ

original: na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: You also do not hold that time exists even conventionally, because your reason, ‚Äúbecause time is endowed with measure,‚Äù is not established. Therefore time does not exist as a different object from things.

original: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
translated: Time that is to be apprehended

original: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: Does not exist as enduring.

original: dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Since time that is to be apprehended as a different object from things does not exist as enduring and ascertained to be its very essence, this is what is being said:

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can mi gnas pa de ni mi rtag pa'i phyir khyed kyang dus nyid yod par mi 'dod pas 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis dus de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can mi gnas pa de ni mi rtag pa'i phyir khyed kyang dus nyid yod par mi 'dod pas 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis dus de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba
translated: You also do not assert that time exists because you assert that the collection of formations that are subject to arising and disintegration and do not endure are impermanent. Therefore what other than the thing that is a formation is time, which is to be apprehended as its very essence?

original: nges par gnas pa yang med pas de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan par nges par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar yud tsam yang cung zad 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa yang med pas de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan par nges par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no // 'di ltar yud tsam yang cung zad 'das pa 'am /
translated: Since it does not endure, time definitely does not exist as a thing that is different from compounded phenomena.

original: cung zad ma 'ongs pa la yud tsam zhes gdags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: cung zad ma 'ongs pa la yud tsam zhes gdags pa yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, a moment is imputed to a small portion of the past or a small portion of the future.

original: yud tsam zhes bya ba ril por nges par gnas pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: yud tsam zhes bya ba ril por nges par gnas pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Since a moment does not exist as a thing that is a complete and fully present entity, what need is there to mention that night and day, a half-month, a month, a season, a year, and so on do not exist?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'di na skad cig dang thang cig tsam zhig nges par gnas pa yod par sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'di na skad cig dang thang cig tsam zhig nges par gnas pa yod par sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: If you think that a moment and an instant definitely exist, then we will explain this point.

original: skad cig dang thang cig tsam zhig nges par gnas pa yang med de /
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig tsam zhig nges par gnas pa yang med de /
translated: A moment and an instant do not exist.

original: gal te nges par gnas pa zhig yod par gyur na de na 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te nges par gnas pa zhig yod par gyur na de na 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: If it were to exist as something that definitely endures, then it would not be past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor would it be future.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it definitely endures.

original: nges par gnas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir de ni da ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir de ni da ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even present because it definitely endures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i @110b phyir da ltar zhes brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i @110b phyir da ltar zhes brjod pa yin na /
translated: Because it is said to be present due to engagement.

original: gal te de nges par gnas pa yin na de grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de nges par gnas pa yin na de grub pa yin gyi /
translated: If it definitely endures, then it is established.

original: 'jug pa ma yin pas 'jug pa ma yin pa ni da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa ma yin pas 'jug pa ma yin pa ni da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not engaged, it is not present because it is not engaged.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gis nges par gzung bar bya ba'i dus 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan pa nges par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis nges par gzung bar bya ba'i dus 'du byed kyi dngos po las gzhan pa nges par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the time that is to be definitely apprehended as something that definitely endures does not exist apart from the entity of the formative forces.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar gzung bar bya /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar gzung bar bya /
translated: How can that which does not exist be apprehended?

original: gang gzung du med pa de ni dus su gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gzung du med pa de ni dus su gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: That which cannot be apprehended cannot be designated as time.

original: de'i phyir / ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
translated: Therefore, how can it be imputed when it is not apprehended?

original: gzung du yod na gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩrnam pa gang gis kyang ma bzung zhing ma dmigs pa'i dus nam mkha'i me tog lta bu de dus su ji ltar gdags te 'di ltar 'du byed kyi tshogs kun rdzob tu gzung du yod pa de nyid dus yin par 'dod na ni gzung du yod pa de
analyzed: gzung du yod na gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te / rnam pa gang gis kyang ma bzung zhing ma dmigs pa'i dus nam mkha'i me tog lta bu de dus su ji ltar gdags te 'di ltar 'du byed kyi tshogs kun rdzob tu gzung du yod pa de nyid dus yin par 'dod na ni gzung du yod pa de
translated: The meaning is that if it is apprehended, it is to be imputed.üîΩHow can it be imputed at a time when it is not apprehended and not observed by any means, like a flower in the sky?

original: la dus zhes gdags par bya ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: la dus zhes gdags par bya ba nyid yin na /
translated: If you assert that time is the collection of compounded phenomena that are apprehended conventionally, then it is to be imputed as time,üîΩsince it is apprehended.üîΩBut you assert that time is ultimately substantially existent and different from the collection of compounded phenomena.

original: khyod ni dus zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs las gzhan pa don dam par rdzas su yod par 'dod pas de lta bu'i tshig gi don nges par gnas pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: khyod ni dus zhes bya ba 'du byed kyi tshogs las gzhan pa don dam par rdzas su yod par 'dod pas de lta bu'i tshig gi don nges par gnas pa ma yin pa /
translated: Since the meaning of such words is not ascertained,

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang ma bzung ba de dus zhes bya bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang ma bzung ba de dus zhes bya bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: that which is not apprehended by any means is not suitable to be imputed as time.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad ni 'du byed nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa nyid dag gi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad ni 'du byed nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa nyid dag gi chos yin gyi /
translated: Thus, this passage teaches that the measure of a moment and so on is a phenomenon of other actions, such as the movement of the sun, that are delimited by compounded phenomena.üîΩIt is not a phenomenon of time.

original: dus kyi ma yin par bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /üîΩpha rol po dag gi sgrub pa'i chos yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad de ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: dus kyi ma yin par bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te / pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa'i chos yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad de ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
translated: Since this is taught, the basis of the reason is not established and there is no example.üîΩThis is taught by the following.üîΩThe measure of a moment and so on, which is the predicate of the probandum of the opponent, is a phenomenon of compounded phenomena and not a phenomenon of time.üîΩSince this is taught, apart from other actions, such as the movement of the sun, that delimit other things, time does not exist as a separate self.

original: dus kyi chos ma yin pas bstan pas des na nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan gyis gzhan yongs su gcod pa ma gtogs par dus zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid logs shig na med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs yud tsam la sogs pa'i
analyzed: dus kyi chos ma yin pas bstan pas des na nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan gyis gzhan yongs su gcod pa ma gtogs par dus zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid logs shig na med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs yud tsam la sogs pa'i
translated: Therefore the reason of the opponent, such as a moment, is not established.

original: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang / pha rol po dag gi dpe 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas shes par bya ba de yang don dam par med par ma grub po //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang / pha rol po dag gi dpe 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas shes par bya ba de yang don dam par med par ma grub po //
translated: The basis of that is not established, and the example of the opponent, like a grain, etc., is not established as ultimately non-existent.

original: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: It is not apprehended in a non-abiding time.

original: ces bya ba 'di la gzhan dag na re 'di la dngos po nges par gnas pa rnams ni tshad las gzung du rung ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di la gzhan dag na re 'di la dngos po nges par gnas pa rnams ni tshad las gzung du rung ste /
translated: In this regard, some say that things that definitely abide can be apprehended by a measure.

original: dper na shing 'di ni mtho'o 'di ni chu ring ngo /
analyzed: dper na shing 'di ni mtho'o 'di ni chu ring ngo /
translated: For example, this tree is tall, this is short,

original: mi 'di ni thung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'di ni thung ngo //
translated: this person is short,

original: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin @111a * //
analyzed: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin @111a * //
translated: this elephant is big.üîΩBut time does not definitely abide in that way, so a measure is not established for it.

original: na dus ni de ltar nges par gnas pa ma yin pas de la tshad mi 'grub po zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta na re /
analyzed: na dus ni de ltar nges par gnas pa ma yin pas de la tshad mi 'grub po zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta na re /
translated: This is what they say. This is the context for the elder Buddhapalita's commentary.

original: gal te dus shing la sogs pa ltar nges par gnas pa yin par gyur na ni des na mtho zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad las gzung du rung bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir dus la ni gang tshad las gzung bar bya ba ril
analyzed: gal te dus shing la sogs pa ltar nges par gnas pa yin par gyur na ni des na mtho zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshad las gzung du rung bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir dus la ni gang tshad las gzung bar bya ba ril
translated: If time definitely abided like a tree and so on, then it would be possible to apprehend it by means of a measure such as high.üîΩBut because time is not definitely abiding as a whole that is to be apprehended by means of a measure, therefore it is not apprehended by means of a measure.

original: por nges par gnas pa min pa de'i phyir tshad las gzung du med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: por nges par gnas pa min pa de'i phyir tshad las gzung du med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The words of the opponent are: ‚ÄúBecause your reason is not established, namely, ‚Äòbecause it is endowed with a measure.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: Nondifferent says: That is not good.üîΩBecause it is possible to apprehend the measure of that which is not physical and does not definitely abide.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa la yang tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de ma nges pas bzang po ma yin pa nyid duüîΩsun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa la yang tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de ma nges pas bzang po ma yin pa nyid duüîΩsun 'byin pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the commentary author‚Äôs own words refuting the elder Buddhapalita‚Äôs explanation as being inconclusive and therefore not good.

original: 'di na sgra dang las lta bu gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa dag la yang sgra chung ngo sgra che'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di na sgra dang las lta bu gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa dag la yang sgra chung ngo sgra che'o zhe 'am /
translated: But here, sound and action, which are not physical and definitely do not endure, are seen to be measurable, as in ‚Äúsound is small,‚Äù ‚Äúsound is loud,‚Äù

original: las chung ngo las che'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: las chung ngo las che'o zhe 'am /
translated: ‚Äúaction is small,‚Äù ‚Äúaction is great,‚Äù

original: de dag dge'o mi dge'o zhes tshad gzung du rung bar mthong bas /üîΩdes na ji re zhig tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dge'o mi dge'o zhes tshad gzung du rung bar mthong bas / des na ji re zhig tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äúthey are virtuous,‚Äù ‚Äúthey are nonvirtuous.‚Äù

original: shing la sogs pa bzhin du nges par gnas par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa bzhin du nges par gnas par 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, how could they definitely endure like wood and so on because they are measurable?üîΩOr, because they are measurable, like sound and so on, they do not definitely endure.

original: 'on te tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir sgra la sogs pa bzhin du nges par gnas pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu bzhi pa /
analyzed: 'on te tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir sgra la sogs pa bzhin du nges par gnas pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes zer ro / // / bam po drug cu bzhi pa /
translated: Since this is not certain, it is not good.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone says:

original: dus ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: dus ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: Time is permanent.

original: de la skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ni nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las nor bu bzhin nam /
analyzed: de la skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ni nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las nor bu bzhin nam /
translated: In response to that, the existence of instants, moments, and seconds, and the existence of the past, future, and present are like a jewel due to the distinction of the diversity of their presence.üîΩOr it is like the distinction of ripening due to the distinction of what is to be ripened.üîΩThis is because the past and so on are not different from the aggregates.üîΩThis is because the past and so on are not different from the aggregates.üîΩThis is because the past and so on are not different from the aggregates.

original: smin pa'i khyad par las smin par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dag ni 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can rnams kyi khyad par yin pas mi rtag pa'i phyir dus ma yin la /üîΩde las gzhan pa dus kyi ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin pas dus dngos po las gzhan pa dang rtag pa nyid med do zhes bshad pa de la 'dir dus yod par smra ba dag dus zhes bya
analyzed: smin pa'i khyad par las smin par bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sngar dbu ma pas skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dag ni 'du byed kyi tshogs skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can rnams kyi khyad par yin pas mi rtag pa'i phyir dus ma yin la /üîΩde las gzhan pa dus kyi ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin pas dus dngos po las gzhan pa dang rtag pa nyid med do zhes bshad pa de la 'dir dus yod par smra ba dag dus zhes bya
