original: ba dngos po las gzhan pa dang / rtag pa yod @111b par gzhung 'dzugs shing phyir zlog pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ba dngos po las gzhan pa dang / rtag pa yod @111b par gzhung 'dzugs shing phyir zlog pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: It is a word that rejects the establishment of a time that is different from things and that is permanent.

original: de dag na re don dam par dus ni dngos po las gzhan pa dang rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de dag na re don dam par dus ni dngos po las gzhan pa dang rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: They say that time is ultimately different from things and is permanent.

original: skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa dag de la yod pa ni tha snyad du nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa dag de la yod pa ni tha snyad du nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: But the impermanent entities of moments, seconds, hours, and so on are imputed conventionally to exist in time.

original: dper na shel sgong yongs su dag pa la kha dog gi rkyen nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las shel sgong yang kha dog sna tshogs nyid du snang ba dang / smin par bya ba'i shing tog rigs gcig pa la smin pa'i bya ba nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las shing tog kyang kha dog sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na shel sgong yongs su dag pa la kha dog gi rkyen nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las shel sgong yang kha dog sna tshogs nyid du snang ba dang / smin par bya ba'i shing tog rigs gcig pa la smin pa'i bya ba nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs nyid kyi khyad par las shing tog kyang kha dog sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, a completely pure crystal is multicolored due to the condition of the color of the various objects that it faces. Also, a fruit of a single type ripens due to the condition of the various objects that it faces.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa phyed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa phyed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the Commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po dngos po gzhan la brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po dngos po gzhan la brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In our system, things that are dependent and reliant on other things are called momentary and so on.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la chos mngon pa bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rdul phra rab shin tu mgyogs par rdul phra rab gzhan gyi gan du 'gro ba ni skad cig ces bya'o zhes grag ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la chos mngon pa bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rdul phra rab shin tu mgyogs par rdul phra rab gzhan gyi gan du 'gro ba ni skad cig ces bya'o zhes grag ste /
translated: In our system, in the Abhidharma that is our tenet system, it is said that the extremely rapid movement of a subtle particle to another subtle particle is called a moment.

original: des na dngos po dngos po gzhan dag la brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de de yang dngos po'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dngos po dngos po gzhan dag la brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de de yang dngos po'i chos yin gyi /
translated: Therefore in our system, things that are dependent and reliant on other things are called momentary and so on.

original: dus kyi ni ma yin pas gal te khyed kyang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dus zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po la brten te gdags par 'dod na ni de kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi ni ma yin pas gal te khyed kyang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dus zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po la brten te gdags par 'dod na ni de kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: But if you assert that time is imputed in dependence on things such as moments in conventional expressions, then that is precisely what we assert.

original: 'on te don dam par skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po la brten pa gzhan rtag pa zhig yod par 'dod na ni de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brtag pa gnyis ston te /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po la brten pa gzhan rtag pa zhig yod par 'dod na ni de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brtag pa gnyis ston te /
translated: But if you assert that time is ultimately dependent on things such as moments, then it would be permanent and it does not exist.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, to demonstrate the first of those two analyses,

original: de la gal te dus ni dngos bsten na tha snyad du de dngos por brjod na ni de 'dod pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal te dus ni dngos bsten na tha snyad du de dngos por brjod na ni de 'dod pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: if time is dependent on things, then if it is conventionally called a thing, that is precisely what we assert.

original: khyed kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dus zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po'i chos de dag nyid yin par brjod na ni de kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: khyed kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du dus zhes bya ba skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po'i chos de dag nyid yin par brjod na ni de kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid yin no ;
translated: If you assert that time is dependent on things such as moments in conventional expressions, then that is precisely what we assert.

original: / brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: / brtag pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate the second analysis,

original: ci ste don dam par na ni //
analyzed: ci ste don dam par na ni //
translated: But if ultimately,

original: dngos po nyid kyang ma grags pas //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyang ma grags pas //
translated: since the thing itself is not renowned,

original: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: how could time be a nonthing?

original: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is as follows.

original: don dam par ni skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid kyang @112a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni skad cig la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid kyang @112a * //
translated: Since ultimately the thing itself, such as a moment, is not renowned,

original: ma grags pas dngos po med pa'i phyir dus dngos po la brten pa gzhan rtag pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: ma grags pas dngos po med pa'i phyir dus dngos po la brten pa gzhan rtag pa ga la yod de /
translated: how could time, which is dependent on a thing, be a different permanent entity?

original: skye ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: skye ba lta bu ste /
translated: It is like arising.

original: de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin no //
translated: It is a conditioned phenomenon, not time.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the engagement of many continuities of conditioned phenomena is called ‚Äúlong,‚Äù and the cognition that arises from the engagement of few continuities of conditioned phenomena is called ‚Äúshort.‚Äù

original: 'du byed kyi rgyun mang po 'jug pa las yun ring po zhes bya ba dang 'du byed kyi rgyun nyung du 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ste zhes bya ba yang dper na mar med gnyid kyi rgyun mang po rgyun rings su 'jug
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyun mang po 'jug pa las yun ring po zhes bya ba dang 'du byed kyi rgyun nyung du 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ste zhes bya ba yang dper na mar med gnyid kyi rgyun mang po rgyun rings su 'jug
translated: For example, when many continuities of sleep engage quickly, it is called ‚Äúlong sleep.‚Äù

original: pa la / yun ring po zhes bya zhing rgyun nyung du dus nye bar 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: pa la / yun ring po zhes bya zhing rgyun nyung du dus nye bar 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ba lta bu ste /
translated: And the arising of the cognition of ‚Äúquickly‚Äù is due to the engagement of a short duration.

original: de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med pas dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin no // de'i phyir snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med pas dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, this is a conditioned phenomenon, not time.üîΩTherefore, since the cognition of prior and posterior, etc., is a conditioned phenomenon, it is not tenable that time exists without a cause.

original: de sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin pas
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin pas
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe reason is not established‚Äù is that the cognition of prior and posterior, etc., is a conditioned phenomenon, not time, even conventionally.

original: pha rol po dag gi dus de rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho nar bsgrub pa'i phyir dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par dus lha rdzas
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi dus de rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho nar bsgrub pa'i phyir dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par dus lha rdzas
translated: because the reason ‚Äúbecause the signs of time such as prior and subsequent exist‚Äù is not established, for the purpose of establishing that the time of others exists as the entity of a substance.

original: kyi ngo bo nyid yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kyi ngo bo nyid yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: How could time ultimately exist as the entity of a substance?üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúHow do we know that the cognition of prior and so on is a conditioned phenomenon and not a time phenomenon?‚Äù

original: ci ste snga ma la sogs par shes pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ga la shes she na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re de 'thad pa gang las de ltar shes zhes 'dri ba'iüîΩtshig yin no //
analyzed: ci ste snga ma la sogs par shes pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ga la shes she na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re de 'thad pa gang las de ltar shes zhes 'dri ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a question from the opponent asking, ‚ÄúWhat is the proof that we know it in that way?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: dus rtag pa dang gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus rtag pa dang gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúbecause there is no inference that demonstrates time as permanent and singular.‚Äù

original: pha rol po dag la dus rtag pa dang / gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las dpags na snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin par shes so //
analyzed: pha rol po dag la dus rtag pa dang / gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las dpags na snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin par shes so //
translated: It is understood that the cognition of the prior and so on is a conditioned phenomenon, not a time phenomenon, since there is no inference that reveals the opponent's permanent and unitary time.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference, he says:

original: tha snyad du yang snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni dus rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni dus rtag pa dang gcig pu'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the prior and so on is not the cause of a permanent and unitary time even conventionally,

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is a cognition, like the cognition of form and so on.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang @112b dus rtag pa dang gcig bu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du snga ma la sogs par shes pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang dus rtag pa dang gcig
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang @112b dus rtag pa dang gcig bu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du snga ma la sogs par shes pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang dus rtag pa dang gcig
translated: For example, consciousness of form and so on is not the cause of a permanent, single entity even conventionally, because it is consciousness.

original: pu'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: pu'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, consciousness of the past and so on is not the cause of a permanent, single entity even conventionally, because it is consciousness.

original: gal te dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: If you think that time exists substantially,üîΩbecause it exists as a designation,

original: btags par yod pa'i phyir ro zhe zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag btags par yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dus rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i phyir ro zhe zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag btags par yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dus rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement by an opponent that time is established as existing substantially by the reason that it exists as a designation.

original: de dag gi ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: For them, the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes it, and the example are applied in order.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag la dbu ma pas /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag la dbu ma pas /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way would say to them:

original: ji lta bu zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dper na ji lta bu zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dper na ji lta bu zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù

original: de skad ces dris pa na pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa na pha rol po dag na re /
translated: When asked this, the opponent might say:üîΩIf you say that time exists like form, etc.,

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: if the opponent says that time exists as a substance,

original: btags par yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na'o //
translated: because it exists as an imputation, like form, etc.

original: de skad ces zer na de dag la dbu ma pas 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de dag la dbu ma pas 'di skad ces /
translated: If they say this, the Madhyamika would say to them:

original: don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pa med pas /
analyzed: don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pa med pas /
translated: ultimately, as has been explained, since things such as form are not established,

original: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: how can time be a non-thing?

original: ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what should be said.

original: don dam par sngar rigs pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pas med pas pha rol po'i dpe med de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par sngar rigs pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pas med pas pha rol po'i dpe med de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ultimately, since things such as form are not established, as has been explained by the reasoning stated earlier, the opponent‚Äôs example does not exist; it does not exist at all.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the fault stated earlier is not applicable to us. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar don dam par dus dngos po las gzhan pa dang / rtag pa nyid med pa de'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do ;
analyzed: de ltar don dam par dus dngos po las gzhan pa dang / rtag pa nyid med pa de'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do ;
translated: As such, ultimately time is not different from things, and it does not have permanence. Therefore, as previously stated, the error that the basis of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established and there is no example remains unrefuted.

original: ;'dir smras pa /
analyzed: ;'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: don dam par dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúTime definitely exists as the nature of a substance ultimately

original: rtags yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a reason.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rtags med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rtags med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no reason,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey.

original: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang / phyi ma dang / cig car dang / cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang myur ba zhes bya ba dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i gtan
analyzed: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang / phyi ma dang / cig car dang / cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang myur ba zhes bya ba dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i gtan
translated: Time is the basis of the signs of earlier and later, simultaneous and not simultaneous, and long and short. Therefore time definitely exists as the nature of a substance.

original: tshigs kyis dus rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: tshigs kyis dus rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the opponent who proves that time exists as the nature of a substance through the reason that the signs of earlier and later time and so on exist.üîΩThey are the subject,

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba @113a * //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba @113a * //
translated: the predicate,

original: chos dang ; sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chos dang ; sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the proving property, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the proof, and the conclusion.

original: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu yod pa ma yin pa gang la rtags med pa de ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu yod pa ma yin pa gang la rtags med pa de ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, that which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, does not have the signs of earlier and later and so on. Therefore it does not exist as the nature of a substance.

original: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni don dam par rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni don dam par rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Time is said to exist as the ultimate nature of substance, because the prior and posterior signs exist in time.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
translated: No entity whatsoever exists.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says this.

original: don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes ston to //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes ston to //
translated: If no entity whatsoever exists ultimately, how could the prior and posterior signs of time exist?

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de las yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni nyid ces nges par bzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba de las yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni nyid ces nges par bzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of exclusion. The statement of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the root text has the meaning of exclusion, which is to say, ascertainment.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In our system, ultimately, there are no things at all.

original: des ni don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin na dus kyi rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag lta yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If ultimately there are no things at all, how could the prior and posterior parts of time exist?

original: de ltar rtags med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dus la rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pas don dam par dus rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtags med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dus la rtags snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pas don dam par dus rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there are no such signs, the opponent‚Äôs reason, ‚Äúbecause the prior and posterior parts of time exist,‚Äù is unestablished. Therefore time does not ultimately exist as a substantial entity.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the prior and posterior parts of time are known conventionally, but they are known as conditioned phenomena, not as time. Therefore the opponent‚Äôs reason is unestablished.

original: tha snyad du ni 'du byed kyi rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya bar shes pa de skye zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni 'du byed kyi rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya bar shes pa de skye zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Conventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni dper na khang khyim tha dad par mar me btsugs pa'i rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas khang khyim snga ma'i mar me'i rgyun las phyi ma'i mar mi rgyun snga phyir gyur pa lta bu la snga ma dang phyi ma zhe'amüîΩ/ pha rol po dag dang tshu rol zhe'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni dper na khang khyim tha dad par mar me btsugs pa'i rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas khang khyim snga ma'i mar me'i rgyun las phyi ma'i mar mi rgyun snga phyir gyur pa lta bu la snga ma dang phyi ma zhe'am / pha rol po dag dang tshu rol zhe'am /
translated: Conventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya bar shes pa skye bas de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya bar shes pa skye bas de yang 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi dus kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: Conventionally, in dependence on a different continuum of compounded phenomena, one knows the former and the latter, and one says, ‚ÄúIt arises‚Äù and so on.üîΩConventionally

original: 'du byed kyi skad cig ma tha mi dad par nye bar gyur pa las cig car zhes bya ba dang de las bzlog pa las cig car ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba @113b yang dper na mar me de gnyis dus gcig tu byung ba
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skad cig ma tha mi dad par nye bar gyur pa las cig car zhes bya ba dang de las bzlog pa las cig car ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba @113b yang dper na mar me de gnyis dus gcig tu byung ba
translated: Since the final moment of compositional activity is not different, it is called ‚Äúsimultaneous.‚Äù The opposite of that is called ‚Äúnot simultaneous.‚Äù

original: la cig car zhes bya zhing dus gcig ma yin par byung ba la cig car ma yin pa zhes bya bar shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la cig car zhes bya zhing dus gcig ma yin par byung ba la cig car ma yin pa zhes bya bar shes pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, when two lamps arise at the same time, they are called ‚Äúsimultaneous.‚Äù When they do not arise at the same time, they are called ‚Äúnot simultaneous.‚Äù

original: dus rdzas su yod par mi 'grub bo zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dus rdzas su yod par mi 'grub bo zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore time is not established as substantially existent.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that point,

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe nyid du bzhag pa dag gi dngos po med na dus ga la yod de dpe ma bstan pas dus mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe nyid du bzhag pa dag gi dngos po med na dus ga la yod de dpe ma bstan pas dus mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: since the entity that is the defining characteristic of form does not exist, if the entities that are posited as examples do not exist, how could time exist? Since the examples are not demonstrated, time is not established.üîΩThat is the meaning of the statement.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dpe med pas dus rdzas su yod par ma grub bo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni pha rol po'i sgrub pa la dpe med pas dus rdzas su yod par ma grub bo zhes bstan to //
translated: Those statements demonstrate that time is not established as substantially existent because the examples of the opponent are not established.

original: shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med kyang yod do zhes btags par yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs btags
analyzed: shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med kyang yod do zhes btags par yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs btags
translated: Even though things that do not substantially exist, such as a chariot, an army, a forest, and so on, do not exist, they are imputed to exist. Therefore your reason is not established.

original: par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par ma grub par ston te /
analyzed: par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin par ma grub par ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the reason ‚Äúbecause they exist as designations‚Äù is not established.

original: 'di na shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med do zhes btags par yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig btags par yod pa'i phyir shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa
analyzed: 'di na shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med do zhes btags par yod par mthong bas des na ci re zhig btags par yod pa'i phyir shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa
translated: Here, even things that do not substantially exist, such as a chariot, an army, a forest, and so on, are seen to be designated as ‚Äúnot existing.‚Äù Therefore, what is the point of saying, ‚ÄúBecause they exist as designations, things that do not substantially exist, such as a chariot, an army, a forest, and so on,

original: dag bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dag bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: are like a reflection‚Äù?

original: 'on te btags par yod pa'i phyir dus rdzas su yod par 'gyur pa ma nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de ma grub bo //üîΩgal te shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rtsibs la sogs pa
analyzed: 'on te btags par yod pa'i phyir dus rdzas su yod par 'gyur pa ma nges pa nyid yin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de ma grub bo // gal te shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rtsibs la sogs pa
translated: But since it is not certain that time exists substantially because it exists as a designation, therefore your reason is unestablished.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because wholes such as chariots are taught to be substantial,üîΩthis is a statement by the opponent that since wholes such as chariots are taught to be substantial because they are composed of parts such as wheels,

original: yan lag dag gis brtsams pas rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yan lag dag gis brtsams pas rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: our reason is not established because it is uncertain.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa dgag pa sngar bshad zin pas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa dgag pa sngar bshad zin pas skyon med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that since the refutation of the teaching that wholes are substantial has already been explained, there is no error.

original: yan lag can rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin par dgag pa'i phyir rdzas su dpag pa sngar bshad pa dag gis shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa bkag zin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
analyzed: yan lag can rdzas nyid du yod pa ma yin par dgag pa'i phyir rdzas su dpag pa sngar bshad pa dag gis shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa bkag zin pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
translated: Since the existence of the parts-possessor as a substance has already been refuted by the previous explanations of the inference of substance, the opponent‚Äôs reason is not non-mistaken.

original: kyi skyon med pa ma yin pas rdzas su yod par ma grub bo //
analyzed: kyi skyon med pa ma yin pas rdzas su yod par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is not established that it exists as a substance.

original: gang dag dus ni dngos po la bsten nas gdags pa kho na @114a * //
analyzed: gang dag dus ni dngos po la bsten nas gdags pa kho na @114a * //
translated: Those who say that time is only imputed in dependence on things,

original: yin te ; yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: yin te ; yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
translated: such as ‚ÄúIt remained for a moment,‚Äù

original: nyin gcig 'dug go //
analyzed: nyin gcig 'dug go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt remained for a day,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIt will remain for a month,‚Äù

original: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya bas ni bye brag pa la sogs pa gang dag dus dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag la yang zhes bya bas ni bye brag pa la sogs pa gang dag dus dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na yin te /
translated: and so on, the phrase ‚Äúto them as well‚Äù indicates that the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on say that time is only imputed in dependence on things.

original: yud tsam dang / nyin mo dang ; zla ba'i dngos po la brten nas 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: yud tsam dang / nyin mo dang ; zla ba'i dngos po la brten nas 'dug par gyur to //
translated: It is said that it remained in dependence on the things of a moment, a day, and a month.

original: 'dug go // 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes dus gsum pa gdags par 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dug go // 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes dus gsum pa gdags par 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa ston to //
translated: and will exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag la yang /
translated: But this is not so, as the following is stated:

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
translated: If no entity exists at all,

original: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩzhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: how could time exist?üîΩThe meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no time other than that‚Äù is that even the entities of moments, days, months, and so on do not exist in the least in reality.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dus med par ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni yud tsam dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang don dam par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de las gzhan pa'i dus kyang med pa'i phyir dngos po la brten nas gdags pa'i dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //üîΩdus yod par smra ba dag na re dus na yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dus med par ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni yud tsam dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag kyang don dam par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas de las gzhan pa'i dus kyang med pa'i phyir dngos po la brten nas gdags pa'i dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to // dus yod par smra ba dag na re dus na yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, because there is no time other than that, how could time exist as a designation based on entities?

original: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who assert that time exists say: Time exists because it is the cause of the engagement of special expressions.

original: 'di na gang med pa de ni brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de ni brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ste /
translated: Here, we do not see that which does not exist as the cause of the application of a special expression.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: dus ni sab ma byas so //
analyzed: dus ni sab ma byas so //
translated: Time is said to be made, is made, and will be made.

original: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas /üîΩde'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas / de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since we see that it is the cause of the application of a special expression,üîΩtherefore time surely exists.

original: 'dir dus yod par smra ba dag dus ni sab ma la sogs pa byas so //
analyzed: 'dir dus yod par smra ba dag dus ni sab ma la sogs pa byas so //
translated: Here, those who advocate the existence of time say, ‚ÄúTime is said to be made, is made, and will be made.üîΩSince we see that it is the cause of the application of a special expression,

original: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dus yod pa kho nar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dus yod pa kho nar sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is a statement that proves that time surely exists as a reason.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion.

original: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa gang brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /üîΩdus ni sab ma la sogs pa byas so //
analyzed: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu med pa gang brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi / dus ni sab ma la sogs pa byas so //
translated: Here, the nonexistence of something like the horn of a rabbit is not the cause of the application of the term ‚Äúnonexistence.‚Äù

original: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pas @114b de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pas @114b de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But time is the cause of the application of the term ‚Äúexistent,‚Äù as in ‚Äúcloth is woven,‚Äù ‚Äúis being woven,‚Äù and ‚Äúwill be woven.‚Äù Therefore time definitely exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established, because the application of the special expression ‚Äúproduced‚Äù and so on is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni sab ma la sogs pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni sab ma la sogs pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
translated: The application of the special expression ‚Äúproduced‚Äù and so on is a conditioned phenomenon such as a cloth and so on,

original: dus kyi ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus kyi ma yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: but not time. Therefore the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /üîΩbrjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te / brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs de'i don 'gal ba nyid du ston to //
translated: It also has a contradictory meaning.üîΩThe reason for the application of the special expression is conventional because the meaning of the opponent‚Äôs reason is contradictory.

original: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa ma yin pa'i phyir gal te de kun rdzob pa yin par bsgrubs na dus don dam par yod par 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa ma yin pa'i phyir gal te de kun rdzob pa yin par bsgrubs na dus don dam par yod par 'dod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for the application of the special expression is not conventional because if it is established that it is conventional, it contradicts the assertion that time exists ultimately.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dus ma grub pa'i phyir de bsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /üîΩde ltar dus ltos pa dang / ma ltos pa la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dus ma grub pa'i phyir de bsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i mjug bsdu ba yin te / de ltar dus ltos pa dang / ma ltos pa la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir sngar pha rol po dag gis don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, since time is not established in any way, the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of the removal of that,‚Äù is not established. This is the conclusion of the root of the reason.

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mar me bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Since time is not established in any way through dependence on other things, nondependence on other things, and so on, the meaning of the root of the reason stated by the opponent, ‚ÄúUltimately, the entityness of things definitely exists because it is the cause of manifestation, like a butterlamp,‚Äù is not established.

original: de ltar dus nyid ma grub pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus de gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho nar grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar dus nyid ma grub pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus de gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa kho nar grub bo //
translated: Since time itself is not established, the entityness of things is not the cause of the manifestation of time. Therefore it is established that ultimately the entityness of things definitely does not exist.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'brasüîΩbu yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is this: By stating the faults of the first chapter of the opponent and by demonstrating one‚Äôs own faultless proof, the specific counter positions to emptiness are refuted, and thus it is shown that things are essenceless with respect to time. This is the summary and the result of valid cognition.üîΩHere, in the context of the nineteenth chapter, the meaning of the chapter is seen to be the result of valid cognition.

original: dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent says in the first chapter of his treatise: Ultimately, entities do exist,

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper @115a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper @115a * //
translated: Because they are the causes of clear cognitions.

original: na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / bstan bcos mdzad pas rang gi dus mi 'thad pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: na mar me bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / bstan bcos mdzad pas rang gi dus mi 'thad pa'i sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Through refuting the opponent‚Äôs position that is incompatible with emptiness, he has shown that time is essenceless.üîΩWhat is the benefit of showing that time is essenceless?

original: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, some have said that this treatise is merely a dry exercise in logic. To dispel such talk, we have also established here a scriptural source that can be trusted.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: To this end, the BhagavƒÅn said in the Sublime Questions of SubƒÅhu S≈´tra:

original: des dus gsum po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag rab tu shes te /
analyzed: des dus gsum po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dag rab tu shes te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe knows the three times‚Äîthe past, the future, and the present.‚Äù

original: de la 'du byed gang dag 'das shing 'gags pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed gang dag 'das shing 'gags pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The past time is the time of those formations that have passed and ceased.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs shing ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs shing ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The future time is the time of those that have not yet arisen.

original: gang dag da ltar byung zhing 'jug pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag da ltar byung zhing 'jug pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The present time is the time of those that have arisen and not yet ceased.

original: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched gang yin pa de ni mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched gang yin pa de ni mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes te /
translated: One should understand that the aggregates, elements, and sense bases of the present time do not endure and are not enduring.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the world does not endure for more than an instant.

original: skad cig ma gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan la /üîΩgnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan la / gnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan /
translated: In that instant, the time of arising is different,üîΩthe time of enduring is different,

original: 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan /
translated: and the time of ceasing is different.

original: skad cig ma de yang mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las chos nyid kyi yang chos nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma de yang mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las chos nyid kyi yang chos nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: And so too, in other s≈´tra passages, the intrinsic reality of phenomena is not past,üîΩnot present, and so on.

original: da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: And so too, in other s≈´tra passages, the TathƒÅgata is not past, not future,üîΩnot present, and so on.

original: da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is established.

original: mdo sde mtshan nyid dang bcas pa de dag gi don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed rnams kho na dus nyid du gsungs kyi de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde mtshan nyid dang bcas pa de dag gi don ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed rnams kho na dus nyid du gsungs kyi de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of those s≈´tras with characteristics is that the BhagavƒÅn also taught that only formations are time and he taught that there are no formations that are other than those.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin @115b pas de'i phyir rtog ge skam po tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan dang khungs yin @115b pas de'i phyir rtog ge skam po tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs pa ma yin no //
translated: The establishment of those scriptures which are thus believed is the quality and the source of the teaching of the essencelessness of time. Therefore, it is not established by mere dry logic.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The teaching of those [scriptures] as the very objects to be explained by this treatise is the knowledge of the master himself and the skill of the commentator.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba
translated: This completes the commentary on the nineteenth chapter of the Root Verses of the Middle Way called ‚ÄúAn Examination of Time,‚Äù composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, the lamp of wisdom.

original: rdzogs so / //
analyzed: rdzogs so / //
translated: It is complete.

original: / da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
analyzed: / da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the essencelessness of cause and effect by way of refuting the specific counter-positions to the teaching of the essencelessness of time, the twentieth chapter is begun.

original: la / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: la / dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù in this context should be understood to mean the sense of ‚Äúcause‚Äù in the sense of a promise, and the sense of ‚Äúthat which is to be connected with what follows.‚Äù

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, in terms of the sense of ‚Äúcause‚Äù in the sense of a promise,

original: da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of time by way of refuting the specific counter-positions to the teaching of the essencelessness of time, it is said.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byasüîΩnas de skad smras te /üîΩdus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te / dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi
translated: Here, the treatise was composed in order to engage with that thesis.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúthe teaching of the essencelessness of time‚Äù is a reference to the chapter on time in the Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúnow, the nineteenth chapter is begun in order to teach the essencelessness of time by refuting the specific objections to emptiness‚Äù means that the essencelessness of time is taught.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúits specific objections‚Äù refers to the specific objections of the opponents.

original: dus ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dus ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar ston pa yin no //
translated: It is only time that has an intrinsic reality.üîΩThe ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is the distinction of those who propound that time has an intrinsic reality.üîΩThe ultimate truth is that time exists, because it is the cause of the engagement of the effect.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba'i khyad par 'og nas don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /üîΩ'bras bu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba'i khyad par 'og nas don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste / 'bras bu 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: The twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i don gyi dbang gis ni rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa @116a * //üîΩbrtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i don gyi dbang gis ni rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa @116a * // brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.üîΩThe twenty-first chapter is composed in order to refute that.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad ces smras so //
translated: The meaning of the following text of the Twenty Verses on Cause and Effect, which will be presented below, is the teaching of the essencelessness of cause and effect. Therefore, it is said with this in mind.

original: de la rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin //
analyzed: de la rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin //
translated: In this regard, what is the effect of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what means is that effect attained?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /üîΩdus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la / dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang
translated: The teaching of the essencelessness of cause and effect is its effect.

original: po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: po kho nar bstan to //
translated: And the effect is attained by the means of the refutation of the specific counter positions to the teaching of the essencelessness of time. Therefore, the author of the commentary first presents the effect of the means and the means in this context of the introduction to the chapter.

original: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe specific counter position to the teaching of the essencelessness of time‚Äù is mentioned in the commentary.

original: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par dus ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir dus grub na skyon med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par dus ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir dus grub na skyon med pas 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter, it was shown that time is not established, and so the reason is faulty. In order to show that if time were established, there would be no fault, and so the point would be established, it is said here, ‚ÄúIf you say . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i skabs su dbu ma pas dus ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pas /
analyzed: sngar dus brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i skabs su dbu ma pas dus ltos pa dang ma ltos par yang 'grub pa med par bstan pas /
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter, the one on time, it was shown that time cannot be established either as dependent or as independent.

original: dus ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Since time is not established, the reason that the opponent gives, ‚Äúbecause they exist ultimately,‚Äù is not established.

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir 'dir pha rol po dag dus grub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon med pas rang gi 'dod pa'i don grub par bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir 'di skad ces zer ro zhes byaüîΩbar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir 'dir pha rol po dag dus grub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon med pas rang gi 'dod pa'i don grub par bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the error of unestablished cause, here the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf time is established, then there is no error of unestablished reason, and thus our desired meaning is established.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: Time should be known to exist ultimately,

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the establishment of effects.

original: 'di nas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid yod kyang dus tshigs med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di nas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid yod kyang dus tshigs med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'gyur la /
translated: Even though the assembly of seed and so on exists, if the season does not exist, the sprout does not arise, but if it does exist, it does arise.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that which does not exist is not seen to be the cause of the establishment of an effect, therefore, by the power of the reason stated, time should be known to exist ultimately.

original: de dag @116b ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / rjes su 'gro bas mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / ldog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag @116b ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / rjes su 'gro bas mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / ldog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively: the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, the indication of the concordant example, the indication of the discordant negative example, and the conclusion.

original: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu gang med pa 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ba de ni yod pa ma yin gyi dus tshig ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid yod kyang de med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: 'di na ri bong gi rva lta bu gang med pa 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ba de ni yod pa ma yin gyi dus tshig ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid yod kyang de med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur
translated: Here, the nonexistence of something like the horn of a rabbit is not seen to be the cause of the establishment of an effect. That is nonexistent. But time is not like that. Even though the collection of seeds and so on exists, without it, a sprout does not arise.

original: gyi yod na 'gyur bas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i ma thus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gyi yod na 'gyur bas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i ma thus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But if it exists, it does arise. Therefore, since it is the cause of the establishment of an effect, time is the reason stated. Therefore time definitely exists ultimately.

original: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In order to refute those specific counter positions that demonstrate that time is essenceless, in order to demonstrate that cause and effect are essenceless, the author of the commentary says:üîΩIn response to those who say this,

original: de la re zhig gang dag gi / grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgrangs can dang / bye brag pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa dang po 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag gi / grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgrangs can dang / bye brag pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa dang po 'di bshad de /

original: de yang gal te 'bras bu skye ba nyid 'thad par gyur na ni 'bras bu skye bas dus kyang yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de yang gal te 'bras bu skye ba nyid 'thad par gyur na ni 'bras bu skye bas dus kyang yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, if the arising of an effect were tenable, then time would exist due to the arising of an effect.

original: 'bras bu skye ba nyid mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi dus yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba nyid mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi dus yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since the arising of an effect is untenable, how could time that possesses an effect exist?

original: 'di ltar gal te tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar gyur na 'bras bu de tshogs pa nyid de la yod pa'am med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar gyur na 'bras bu de tshogs pa nyid de la yod pa'am med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this way, if an effect arose from the mere assembly, then would that effect arise from the mere assembly that exists or that does not exist?

original: gnyi ga las kyang de skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga las kyang de skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: An effect does not arise from either.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i dang po 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i dang po 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the first hypothesis is untenable, the first verse is explained as follows.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:üîΩIf it arises from the mere assembly

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
translated: of causes and conditions,

original: pha rol po'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions.‚Äù

original: des ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /üîΩgrangs can dang / bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu sngaüîΩna yod pa nyid las @117a * //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te / grangs can dang / bye brag pa la sogs pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid las @117a * //
translated: This shows the opponent‚Äôs position.üîΩSƒÅ·πÉkhyas, Vai≈õe·π£ikas, and so on assert that an effect that exists earlier arises from the assembly of causes and conditions.üîΩIf, according to their system, an effect that exists earlier arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: skye bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: skye bar gyur na'o //
translated: then how could it arise from the assembly of causes and conditions?

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable,üîΩit is said:

original: de yang de la yod na /
analyzed: de yang de la yod na /
translated: If it exists in that assembly,

original: 'o na de lta na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na /
translated: then how could it arise from the assembly of causes and conditions?

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: how could it arise from the assembly of causes and conditions?

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
translated: It could not arise,

original: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the fault of the negation being contradictory would arise.

original: yod pa dang skye ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig gis gcig 'gog pas dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa dang skye ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig gis gcig 'gog pas dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that existence and arising are mutually exclusive, and that the error of contradiction arises because they are mutually exclusive.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gal te yod na ni ci'i phyir skye 'on te skye na ni yod pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni ci'i phyir skye 'on te skye na ni yod pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, why would it arise? But if it arises, it is not existent.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba dang skye'o zhes bya ba de dag mi mthun pas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
