analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba dang skye'o zhes bya ba de dag mi mthun pas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He thinks that since existence and arising are mutually exclusive, they are contradictory.

original: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin na 'bras bu yod pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin na 'bras bu yod pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If the effect exists in the assemblage itself, how could that existent effect arise from the assemblage?

original: ci ste yod kyang yang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i skye ba brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang yang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i skye ba brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were to arise even though it exists, then the examination of arising would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya /
translated: Why? Because it arises even though it exists.

original: thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na gal te yod na de skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i ngo
analyzed: 'di ltar nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // yang na gal te yod na de skye bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i ngo
translated: Because it would never arise.üîΩMoreover, if it exists, it would not arise, etc.

original: bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung bar ston to //
translated: This demonstrates that the opponent‚Äôs thesis that the effect is only the assembly of causes and conditions is untenable, because the error of the effect‚Äôs arising from itself would ensue.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this,

original: yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis yod pa la yang skye ba med pas 'bras bu de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'bras bu chos kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis yod pa la yang skye ba med pas 'bras bu de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'bras bu chos kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
translated: since the effect would not arise even if it existed, because it is inferred to exist, the error of the effect‚Äôs arising from itself would ensue, because the opponent‚Äôs thesis that the effect is the essential nature of the arising of an existent phenomenon is refuted.

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: how could it arise from the assembly?

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
translated: It would not arise.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that the faults stated would ensue.

original: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The meaning is that the faults of the negation would ensue, just as they were stated.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: don dam par 'bras bu yod par ni skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu yod par ni skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: An existent effect does not arise in the ultimate,

original: yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yod pa bzhin pas de'i phyir brtag pa dang po mi 'thad do zhes bstan te //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yod pa bzhin pas de'i phyir brtag pa dang po mi 'thad do zhes bstan te //
translated: because it exists, like, for example, an existent pot. Therefore the first conception is untenable.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the untenability of the second conception, he says:

original: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen @117b rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen @117b rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For those who assert in their tenets that the effect does not exist in the assemblage of causes and conditions, this is explained.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis pa 'di bshad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In particular, this second verse is stated in order to refute the tenets of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and SautrƒÅntikas, who assert that effects arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions that do not exist previously.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //üîΩtshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi // tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:üîΩIf things arise from the assemblyüîΩof causes and conditions,

original: pha rol po'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul gyis 'bras bu'o //
translated: then the effect would exist in the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the opponent.

original: des na pha rol po'i gzhung bstan pa ston te /
analyzed: des na pha rol po'i gzhung bstan pa ston te /
translated: Thus he demonstrates the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa la sogs pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa la sogs pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga
translated: In particular, the philosophical systems of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, SautrƒÅntika, and so on assert that the effect arises from the mere assembly of causes and conditions, which did not exist previously.

original: na med pa nyid las skye bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: na med pa nyid las skye bar gyur na'o //
translated: If the effect arose from the mere assembly of causes and conditions, which did not exist previously,

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde yang khyed don dam par med par ston pas 'o na des na /
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / de yang khyed don dam par med par ston pas 'o na des na /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable,üîΩsince you are teaching that the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions,üîΩthen how could the effect arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions?

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: how could the effect arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions?

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
translated: It would not arise.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin na 'bras bu med pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin na 'bras bu med pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, how could the nonexistent effect arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions?

original: ci ste med kyang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de skyes na yang med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste med kyang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de skyes na yang med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were to arise even though it does not exist, then in that case, even when it has arisen, it would be nonexistent.

original: skye ba na med pa skyes na ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba na med pa skyes na ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: How could that which is nonexistent when arising arise?

original: 'di ltar ba lang skye ba skyes na rtar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang skye ba skyes na rtar mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the arising of an ox arises, it does not become a horse.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmed pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis med pa la skye ba med pas 'bras bu de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'bras bu chos kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis med pa la skye ba med pas 'bras bu de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la 'bras bu chos kyi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro
translated: In order to demonstrate just this,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúBecause it is nonexistent, it does not arise. Because it is nonexistent, it does not arise. Because it is nonexistent, it does not arise.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that because the opponent‚Äôs thesis is refuted by the

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: fact that the arising of an effect is impossible, the error of the intrinsic reality of the arising of an effect is thereby refuted.

original: pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: pha rol po dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la 'bras bu skye ba'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs assertion that the effect is not present in the assembly of causes and conditions is untenable because it would entail the error of the effect arising from a state that is opposite in nature to the effect.

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩdon dam par 'bras bu med par ni skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / don dam par 'bras bu med par ni skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa bzhin pas de'i phyir brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan to //üîΩbstan @118a * //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa bzhin pas de'i phyir brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad do zhes bstan to // bstan @118a * //
translated: An effect that is ultimately nonexistent does not arise because it is nonexistent, like the nonexistent sky flower and so on. Therefore the second conception is untenable.

original: bcos mdzad pas yang ser skya pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcos mdzad pas yang ser skya pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: The treatise author now states the following in order to refute the scriptures of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya:

original: gang dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par dam bcas pa de dag gi phyir yang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gang dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par dam bcas pa de dag gi phyir yang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor those who assert that the effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions, it is also said . . .‚Äù

original: 'dis ni grang can dag rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul gyis snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni grang can dag rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul gyis snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
translated: This demonstrates another way to refute the scriptural assertion of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya that effects arise from the prior existence of the assemblage of causes.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said:üîΩIf the effect exists in the assemblage

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: of causes and conditions,

original: des ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /üîΩgrangs can dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyal 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul
analyzed: des ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te / grangs can dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyal 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skye bar 'dod pas gal te de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul
translated: This shows that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya assertion that effects arise from the prior existence of causes is untenable.üîΩIn the SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophical system, it is asserted that effects arise from the prior existence of causes in the manner of potency, and later, due to the power of conditions, they arise in the nature of manifest entities.üîΩIf effects arose from the prior existence of causes in the manner of potency

original: du snga na yod pa nyid las skye bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: du snga na yod pa nyid las skye bar gyur na ni /
translated: in the assemblage of causes,

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable, it is said:

original: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
analyzed: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
translated: If the collection were apprehended,

original: yod pa'i phyir skye ba bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir skye ba bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it would exist, just like arising.

original: de ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid yin na yod pa'i phyir dper na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skyes pa bzhin du rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa gzung du yod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid yin na yod pa'i phyir dper na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du skyes pa bzhin du rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa gzung du yod pa'i rigs so //
translated: Thus, if the effect were to exist in the assembly of causes in the manner of a potentiality, then, because it would exist, it would be logical for the potentiality of the effect to be apprehended in the assembly of causes, just as arising exists in the nature of the clarifier.

original: de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang med par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate that it does not exist, he says:

original: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med //
translated: It is not apprehended in the assembly.

original: yid btud pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yid btud pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even with mental analysis.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa nyid ni yid btud pas brtags na yang gzung du med pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa nyid ni yid btud pas brtags na yang gzung du med pa'i phyir de yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This is because the potentiality of the effect in the assembly of causes is not apprehended even when analyzed with mental analysis. This demonstrates that it does not exist.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu'i chos gzung du med pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya bar ni de ltar tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma 'dis ni rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa snga na yod pa ma
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu'i chos gzung du med pa nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya bar ni de ltar tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma 'dis ni rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i nus pa snga na yod pa ma
translated: Thus this final verse of the root text teaches that the effect-entity is not apprehended from the mere assembly of causes and conditions.

original: yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzung du med pa nyid yin par mdo mdzad pas bstan to //
analyzed: yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni gzung du med pa nyid yin par mdo mdzad pas bstan to //
translated: The author of the s≈´tra teaches that the reason proving that the potency of the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions prior to the effect is that it is not apprehended.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the valid knowledge of that,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, the inference is that the effect, such as a sprout, does not exist in the mere assembly of causes and conditions, such as the seed,

original: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended there.‚Äù

original: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not apprehended does not exist there,

original: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin no //
translated: like a cloth in a pot.

original: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu yang de bzhin pas @118b de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu yang de bzhin pas @118b de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the sprout is just like that, therefore the sprout, the effect, should be apprehended as not existing in the assemblage itself of the seed and so on.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical argument, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na bum pa gang la snam bu gang gzung du med pa'i bum pa de la snam bu de yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tshogs pa nyid gang la myu gu gang gzung du med pa'i tshogs pa nyid de la yang myu gu de yod pa
analyzed: dper na bum pa gang la snam bu gang gzung du med pa'i bum pa de la snam bu de yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tshogs pa nyid gang la myu gu gang gzung du med pa'i tshogs pa nyid de la yang myu gu de yod pa
translated: For example, just as a pot in which a cloth is not apprehended does not have that cloth, so too the sprout in the assemblage itself in which the sprout is not apprehended does not exist in that assemblage.

original: ma yin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa snga na yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa snga na yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the power of the effect, such as the sprout, does not exist prior to the assemblage of causes, such as the seed.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here, some Enumerators object:

original: ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang nye ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang / cha phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'dra ba /
analyzed: ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang nye ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang / cha phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'dra ba /
translated: ‚ÄúYour reason is indeterminate because, when there is an obstruction to the apprehension of existent things, such as an object that is too far away, too close, a defective sense faculty, a distracted mind, a subtle object, an obscured object, a dominant object, or a similar or mixed object, those existent things are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gegs su gyur pa dag yod na dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig na re dbu ma pa'i
analyzed: 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gegs su gyur pa dag yod na dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig na re dbu ma pa'i
translated: Here, some Enumerators say that the reason is indeterminate because, when there is an obstruction to the apprehension of existent things, such as an object that is too far away, too close, a defective sense faculty, a distracted mind, a subtle object, an obscured object, a dominant object, or a similar or mixed object, those existent things are not apprehended. Therefore, the reason is indeterminate.

original: gtan tshigs sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The reason is that the effect, such as a sprout, does not exist in the assembly of causes such as the seed itself,

original: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: because it is not apprehended there.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhya say in their treatise called the Sixty-Chapter Tantra:

original: 'di la grangs can dag gi grub pa'i mtha' rgyud drug cu pa zhes bya ba las dngos po yod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: 'di la grangs can dag gi grub pa'i mtha' rgyud drug cu pa zhes bya ba las dngos po yod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: Even though things exist, there are eight reasons why they are not apprehended:üîΩBecause they are too distant, too close,

original: de yang / ha cang ring phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
analyzed: de yang / ha cang ring phyir nye phyir dang // dbang po nyams phyir yid med phyir //
translated: because the sense organ is impaired, because there is no mind,üîΩbecause they are subtle, because they are obscured,

original: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil non phyir dang 'dres phyir ro //üîΩzhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: cha phra phyir dang bsgribs phyir dang // zil non phyir dang 'dres phyir ro //üîΩzhes 'byung ste /
translated: because they are overwhelmed, and because they are mixed.

original: de la ha cang ring ba'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ni dper na bya zhig grong 'di nas grong gzhan du 'phur ba mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi ha cang thag ring ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la ha cang ring ba'i phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur ba ni dper na bya zhig grong 'di nas grong gzhan du 'phur ba mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi ha cang thag ring ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not observed because it is too distant, for example, a bird flying from one village to another is not observed, but it is not nonexistent. It is not observed because it is too distant.

original: gang ha cang thag ring ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang ha cang thag ring ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is something that is not too distant not observed?

original: nye phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is too close.

original: dper na lhas byin gyi mig la mig sman gnas pa mi dmigs @119a * //
analyzed: dper na lhas byin gyi mig la mig sman gnas pa mi dmigs @119a * //
translated: For example, ointment on Devadatta‚Äôs eyes is not observed,

original: kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: but it is not nonexistent.

original: ha cang thag nye ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ha cang thag nye ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not observed because it is too close.

original: gang ha kyang thag nye ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang ha kyang thag nye ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is something that is not too close not observed?

original: dbang po nyams phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dbang po nyams phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the sense faculty is impaired.

original: dper na slob pas ldongs zhes smras pa'i sgra 'on pas mi thos kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na slob pas ldongs zhes smras pa'i sgra 'on pas mi thos kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, a sound that is said to be ‚Äúdeafening‚Äù is not heard by the deaf, but it is not nonexistent.

original: dbang po nyams pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not observed because the sense faculty is impaired.

original: gang dbang po ma nyams pas de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang dbang po ma nyams pas de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived by the unimpaired sense faculty?

original: yid med phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yid med phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the mind is absent.

original: dper na mda' mkhan gyi nyen kor nas rgyal po'i pho brang bskyod pa na mda' mkhan mda'i las la sems g-yengs pas mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: dper na mda' mkhan gyi nyen kor nas rgyal po'i pho brang bskyod pa na mda' mkhan mda'i las la sems g-yengs pas mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi ;
translated: For example, when a person moves from the vicinity of an archer to the king‚Äôs palace, the archer is not perceived because his mind is distracted by his work of shooting arrows, but he is not absent.

original: yid nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, the mind is not perceived because it is not fixed.

original: gang yid nges par gnas pa des ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang yid nges par gnas pa des ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived by the mind that is fixed?

original: cha phra phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: cha phra phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because of its subtlety.

original: dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, smoke, dust, mist, etc., which are in the sky, are not perceived, but they are not absent. They are not perceived because of their subtlety.

original: gang cha phra ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang cha phra ba ma yin pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived by that which is not subtle?

original: bsgribs phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsgribs phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is obstructed.

original: dper na sa ba ma dang rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na sa ba ma dang rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, a pot, etc. is not non-existent because it is not perceived, even though it is obscured by a cloth, a wall, etc.

original: bsgribs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not perceived because it is obscured.

original: gang ma bsgribs pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang ma bsgribs pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived if it is not obscured?

original: zil non phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zil non phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it is overwhelmed.‚Äù

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od kyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, the light of the sun overwhelms the light of the planets, stars, and fireflies, so that they are not perceived, but they are not non-existent.

original: zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are not perceived because they are overwhelmed.

original: gang zil gyis ma non pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang zil gyis ma non pa de ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived if it is not overwhelmed?

original: 'dres phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dres phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it is mixed.‚Äù

original: dper na phug ron dang sran chung la sogs pa 'dra ba mang po 'dres pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na phug ron dang sran chung la sogs pa 'dra ba mang po 'dres pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: For example, many pigeons, beans, etc. are mixed and not perceived, but they are not non-existent.

original: 'dra ba 'dres pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba 'dres pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are not perceived because they are mixed.

original: de ltar 'di na dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis gzung du med pa dag mthong bas des re zhig gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras buüîΩmyu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya 'am /
analyzed: de ltar 'di na dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis gzung du med pa dag mthong bas des re zhig gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya 'am /
translated: Thus, although things exist, they are not perceived due to the eight conditions of nonperception. Therefore, since they are not perceived for the time being, like a cloth in a pot, it is not apprehended that the result,üîΩsuch as a sprout, exists in the assembly of causes, such as a seed.

original: 'on te gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na ha cang @119b ring ba la sogs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma nges pa'i phyir dbu
analyzed: 'on te gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na ha cang @119b ring ba la sogs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma nges pa'i phyir dbu
translated: Or, since it is not apprehended, like something too far away, it is not ascertained that the result, such as a sprout, exists in the assembly of causes, such as a seed.

original: ma pa'i gtan tshigs de la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma pa'i gtan tshigs de la ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the fault of inconclusiveness applies to the Madhyamaka reason.

original: grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smras te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag las gzhan kha cig na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid dang ma
analyzed: grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smras te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs can dag las gzhan kha cig na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid dang ma
translated: Others than the Samkhyas say this other fault: Because the reason of the Madhyamikas is not apprehended.

original: grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i skyon gzhan 'dogs pa ston te /
analyzed: grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i skyon gzhan 'dogs pa ston te /
translated: The phrase Others than the Samkhyas say this other fault and so on teaches the other faults that are imputed by some others than the Samkhyas, who say, The meaning of the reason of the Madhyamikas, 'because it is not apprehended,' is not ascertained and is not established.

original: de'i phyir de dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
translated: Therefore, they say, What is the meaning of the reason of the Madhyamikas, 'because it is not apprehended'?

original: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If it means because it is not apprehended by direct perception, then it is not ascertained.

original: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Because although the realities of the senses are not apprehended by direct perception, they exist.

original: 'di na de kho na nyi shu rtsa lnga dag las blo'i dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod par shes pas des na ci re zhig mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin duüîΩsa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya 'am /
analyzed: 'di na de kho na nyi shu rtsa lnga dag las blo'i dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod par shes pas des na ci re zhig mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya 'am /
translated: Here, although the reality of the sense faculties is not apprehended by direct perception among the twenty five principles, it is known to exist.üîΩTherefore, is it apprehended as nonexistent, like a cloth on a pot, because it is not apprehended by direct perception?

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na dbang po'i de kho na dag bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma nges pa'i phyir gal te dbu
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na dbang po'i de kho na dag bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba yod pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba ma nges pa'i phyir gal te dbu
translated: Or is it apprehended as existent, like the reality of the sense faculties, because it is not apprehended by direct perception?

original: ma pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason is ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by direct perception,‚Äù then it is indeed indefinite.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni gal te dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni gal te dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir
translated: This teaches the treatise that says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the reason of the MƒÅdhyamika, ‚Äòbecause it is not apprehended,‚Äô is not apprehended by inference,

original: ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: then the meaning is not established.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston to //
translated: Thus it is because the existence of the capacity of the effect called the sprout in the assemblage of causes such as the seed is apprehended by inference.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that inference, he says,

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong bar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong bar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Thus the cause is apprehended as not empty of the effect by inference.

original: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a measure.

original: gang tshad yod pa des mi stong ste /
analyzed: gang tshad yod pa des mi stong ste /
translated: That which has a measure is not empty.

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the nature of the effect.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang @120a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang @120a * //
translated: So too, the cause is also limited by the measure of the three‚Äîpleasure, pain, and delusion‚Äîthe five‚Äîsound and so on, and the one‚Äîprimal substance.

original: sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa rgyu'i tshad kyis na tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa rgyu'i tshad kyis na tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, because the cause is limited, the effect is not empty.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example that possesses the property of the probandum, the application, and the conclusion are applied in order.

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid lta bu gang tshad yod pa de ni 'bras bu de nyid kyis mi stong pa de bzhin du rgyu yang snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin gsum gyi 'gyur ba dang / yan lag bde ba dang /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid lta bu gang tshad yod pa de ni 'bras bu de nyid kyis mi stong pa de bzhin du rgyu yang snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin gsum gyi 'gyur ba dang / yan lag bde ba dang /
translated: For example, whatever has a limited nature, like an effect, is not empty of that effect. So too, the cause is also not empty of the three‚Äîthe transformations of sattva, rajas, and tamas‚Äîand the five‚Äîsound and so on‚Äîand the one‚Äîprimal substance.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba gcig dang / de dag la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i rgyu tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bus nus pas sa bon mi stong pa sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba gcig dang / de dag la sogs pa rang bzhin gyi char gtogs pa'i rgyu tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bus nus pas sa bon mi stong pa sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Therefore, because the cause is finite, the effect is finite. Since the seed is not empty of the sprout, the sprout is apprehended by inference because the cause, the collection of seed and so on, exists.

original: pa yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir gal te dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin na ni don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir gal te dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin na ni don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: If you say that the reason of the Madhyamaka is not apprehended by inference, then the meaning is not established.

original: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nar gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nar gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If you say that the reason is qualified in this way, then the meaning of the reason is not established,üîΩbecause things that are not apprehended by direct perception are apprehended by inference.

original: mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de
translated: The Enumerators say: Why do you Buddhists say, ‚ÄúBecause the reason is not apprehended‚Äù?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar na don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar na don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas /
translated: If you apply the reason to mean ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by inference,‚Äù then the fault of nonestablishment of the reason would ensue.

original: 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs de'i don ma ngesüîΩpa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs de'i don ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: Here, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended‚Äù is not the apprehension of direct perception, so if you state the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by direct perception alone,‚Äù then the meaning of that reason is not ascertained.üîΩFor example, in this world, things that are not apprehended by direct perception are seen to be apprehended by inference, even though they are separated by place, time, and nature.

original: 'di ltar 'di na mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag kyang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig mngon sum @120b kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag kyang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig mngon sum @120b kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by direct perception alone,‚Äù

original: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ba'am /
translated: for example, like a cloth on a pot, the collection of seeds and so on does not exist in the sprout and so on?

original: 'on te mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs paüîΩnyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir dbu ma pa mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir dbu ma pa mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir
translated: Or, because it is not apprehended by direct perception alone, like things that are not apprehended by direct perception, such as objects, times and natures that are distant, are apprehended by inference, so too the collection of seeds and so onüîΩis apprehended by the inference that it exists as the effect called a sprout.

original: ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: But if you say that because it is not apprehended by direct perception alone, it is not apprehended by direct perception alone, and you state a qualified reason, then that reason is not suitable because its meaning is uncertain.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúWhy do the Buddhists state their reasonüîΩas because it is not apprehended? If they say because it is not apprehended by the apprehension of direct perception alone, then the reason is qualified.

original: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi
analyzed: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi
translated: If they say because it is not apprehended by direct perception alone, then the fault of the meaning of the reason being indefinite still exists.

original: skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang tshad ma thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes
analyzed: skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang tshad ma thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes
translated: Since they wish to completely abandon that fault, here they state their reason as because it is not apprehended. Because it is not apprehended in any way by any of the aspects of direct perception, inference, or valid knowledge, they say because it is not apprehended in any way.

original: bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de /
analyzed: bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de /
translated: If you understand the meaning of the reason, then there is the fault that the meaning is not established.

original: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Thus, the seed and so on itself is the effect called the sprout and so on, which exists prior to it in the manner of potential, because it is apprehended by inference.

original: re zhig de dag ni grangs can dag las gzhan dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid dang / ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu lnga pa /üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni grangs can dag las gzhan dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid dang / ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no / // / bam po drug cu lnga pa / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: For now, those are the words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and others that say, ‚ÄúBecause the reason of the MƒÅdhyamika is not apprehended, that is not ascertained and is not established.‚Äù

original: grangs can dag gi sgrub pa sun dbyung ba dang rang gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi sgrub pa sun dbyung ba dang rang gi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary, in order to refute the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs proof and to dispel the fault that his own reason is not ascertained and is not established,
here says:

original: gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir tha snyad du ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir tha snyad du ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because they are not apprehended at all, therefore, it is not the case that they are not ascertained due to being too distant, etc.

original: don dam par ni ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because things that are too distant, etc. are not established ultimately.üîΩThis is what he says.

original: des ni sngar 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: des ni sngar 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here, he first refutes some Enumerators:

original: ha cang ring ba dang ha cang nye ba dang dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang cha phra ba dang bsgribs pa dang zil gyis non pa dang 'dra ba 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gegs su gyur pa dag yod na dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
analyzed: ha cang ring ba dang ha cang nye ba dang dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang cha phra ba dang bsgribs pa dang zil gyis non pa dang 'dra ba 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gegs su gyur pa dag yod na dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa
translated: If there are obstructions to apprehending existent things, such as being too distant, too near, a defective sense faculty, a distracted mind, subtlety, obstruction, being outshone, or being mixed, then existent things are not apprehended. Therefore, your reason is indefinite.

original: nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i lan 'debs shing dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de tha snyad dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med pa ston to //üîΩde la re zhig tha snyad du ni kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa zhes bya bar rnam par ma brtags pas bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid
analyzed: nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i lan 'debs shing dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de tha snyad dang don dam pa gnyi gar yang ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med pa ston to // de la re zhig tha snyad du ni kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs de gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa zhes bya bar rnam par ma brtags pas bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid
translated: In response to the statement ‚ÄúYou have a fault,‚Äù he shows that the fault of not being established in either the conventional or the ultimate does not apply to the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äúbecause of not being apprehended.‚Äù

original: la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In that regard, conventionally, because he specifies ‚Äúbecause of not being apprehended,‚Äù he does not analyze whether it is a case of direct perception or inference. Therefore the collection of seeds and so on is not apprehended as existing prior to the effect in the manner of being its cause.

original: de la gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par bzung bas mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rjes su dpag pas bzung ba lta bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par bzung bas mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rjes su dpag pas bzung ba lta bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Because it is definitely ascertained that it is not apprehended, it is not the case that it is not ascertained, since there is no apprehension by inference of a contradictory object that is not apprehended by direct perception.

original: grangs can dag gi dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag nyid kyang ma nges pa nyid yin pas de dag gis kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du sgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi dngos po yod kyang mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag nyid kyang ma nges pa nyid yin pas de dag gis kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du sgrub par mi nus te /
translated: Since the reason that things exist for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya but are not observed is too remote and too close, and so on, are themselves not ascertained, they cannot prove that my reason is not ascertained.

original: 'di ltar 'di na nyi ma la sogs pa dag ha cang thag ring po na gnas kyang dmigs pa dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa dag ha cang thag nye ba na gnas kyang dmigs par mthong bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na nyi ma la sogs pa dag ha cang thag ring po na gnas kyang dmigs pa dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa dag ha cang thag nye ba na gnas kyang dmigs par mthong bas /
translated: In this way, the sun and so on are observed to exist even though they are very distant, and smell, taste, and so on are observed to exist even though they are very close.

original: des na ci re zhig ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir dper na bya dang mig sman yod kyang mi dmigs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod kyang mi dmigs pas med pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /üîΩ'on te ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na ci re zhig ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir dper na bya dang mig sman yod kyang mi dmigs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod kyang mi dmigs pas med pa ma yin par 'gyur ram / 'on te ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir na /
translated: Or, is it that the effect does not exist because it is not observed in the assembly of causes and conditions, like a sprout, etc., in the assembly of a seed, etc., because it is too far away or too near?

original: nyi ma la sogs pa dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa dag yod na @121b dmigs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod na dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs na mi dmigs pas yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa dag yod na @121b dmigs pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod na dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rigs na mi dmigs pas yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ba
translated: If the sun, etc., and smell, taste, etc., exist, they are observed. It is logical that if the effect called a sprout, etc., exists in the assembly of causes and conditions such as a seed, etc., it would be observed. But since it is not observed, it does not exist.

original: ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma nges pa de dag gis kho bo'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du
analyzed: ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs ha cang ring ba'i phyir dang ha cang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma nges pa de dag gis kho bo'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du
translated: Because of that, your reason is indefinite, because it is too remote, because it is too close, and so on.

original: sgrub par mi nus pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par mi nus pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since you cannot prove that my reason is not ascertained, my reason is not indefinite.

original: don dam par ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan
analyzed: don dam par ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan
translated: In the ultimate, your reason, ‚Äúbecause it is too remote,‚Äù and so on, are not established, because the things that are the basis of the reason are not established.

original: tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since the discordant side does not exist, my reason is not indefinite.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin pa'i tshad dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smras te
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin pa'i tshad dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smras te
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say this: ‚ÄúThe reason, because it is not apprehended, is not established.

original: / gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: / gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason?

original: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If it means because it is not apprehended by direct perception, then it is not established.

original: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the principles of the sense faculties are not apprehended by direct perception, but they exist.üîΩIf it means because it is not apprehended by inference, then the meaning is not established.‚Äù

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas
translated: If it means because it is not apprehended by direct perception, then it is not established.

original: gzung ba nyid yin par sgrub la /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid yin par sgrub la /
translated: It is established that it is apprehended.üîΩIf you say that it is not apprehended by inference, then the meaning is not established.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa nyid du sgrub
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa nyid du sgrub
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by inference‚Äù establishes that it is apprehended by inference.

original: cing de'i tshad ma yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong bar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: cing de'i tshad ma yang 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong bar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The valid knowledge that establishes that is as follows: The cause is apprehended as not empty of the effect.

original: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a measure.

original: gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
analyzed: gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
translated: That which has a measure is not empty of it.

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of the effect.üîΩIn the same way, the cause is also the measure of the cause of pleasure, pain, and delusion, the five such as sound, and one, and so on. Therefore, because the cause has a measure, the effect is not empty.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyis tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bstan pa
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyis tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bstan pa
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause the cause has a measure‚Äù teaches that.

original: de'i gtan tshigs tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang rgyu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la @122a * //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yang rgyu yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gsum dang sgra la @122a * //
translated: The syllogism that demonstrates the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is limited‚Äù is:üîΩThe subject, a cause, is limited because of being limited by the three‚Äîpleasure, pain, and delusion‚Äîand the five‚Äîsound and so on‚Äîand one and so on.

original: sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa'i tshad kyis tshad yod pas zhes bya ba de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sogs pa lnga dang gcig la sogs pa'i tshad kyis tshad yod pas zhes bya ba de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: grangs can dag gis rgyu'i tshad snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis rgyu'i tshad snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the measure of a cause is that which has the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: rang bzhin gyi yan lag bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga dang / gtso bo gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyis tshad yod par bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gtan tshigs tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas desüîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs rgyu ni 'bras bu mi stong par gzung bar bya ste zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yan lag bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga dang / gtso bo gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyis tshad yod par bstan pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir grangs can dag gtan tshigs tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs rgyu ni 'bras bu mi stong par gzung bar bya ste zhes bya ba de ma grub po //
translated: The Enumerators‚Äô thesis is that the cause is not empty of the effect because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs parts, and because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs measure. The parts of the effect are the three qualities of pleasure, pain, and confusion, the five objects such as sound, and the one principal nature. The measure of the cause is the measure of the effect.üîΩThe Enumerators say, ‚ÄúThe effect is not empty because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs parts and because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs measure.‚Äù

original: tshad kyi gtan tshigs spyir brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: tshad kyi gtan tshigs spyir brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
translated: The meaning of that is not established for us because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs parts and because the cause is not empty of the effect‚Äôs measure.üîΩThe reason is not established because we do not accept that the effect is not empty.üîΩThe reason is not established because the effect is empty.

original: 'bras bu yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te grangs can dag rgyu dang rang bzhin pa'i tshad kyis tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin pa'i tshad btang
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te grangs can dag rgyu dang rang bzhin pa'i tshad kyis tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin pa'i tshad btang
translated: Because the effect is also empty of the effect itself.

original: ste / tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de spyir kha dog dang dbyibs dang gnas skabs la sogs pa'i tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: ste / tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de spyir kha dog dang dbyibs dang gnas skabs la sogs pa'i tshad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ste /
translated: This is saying that if the SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄúThe reason ‚Äòbecause it has a limited size‚Äô is not established,‚Äù and they give up the reason ‚Äúbecause it has a limited size that is of the nature of its cause,‚Äù and they say, ‚ÄúThe reason ‚Äòbecause it has a limited size‚Äô is a general reason because it has a limited size in terms of color, shape, state, and so on,‚Äù then that is unacceptable because there is no example that follows the reason.

original: sngar grangs can dag gis gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag gis gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
translated: Previously the SƒÅ·πÉkhya said, ‚ÄúThat which has a limited size is not empty of that.‚Äù

original: dper na 'bras bu sa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de don dam par 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir de la kha dog dang dbyibs dang gnas skabs la sogs pa'i tshad med pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'iüîΩskyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu sa'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de don dam par 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir de la kha dog dang dbyibs dang gnas skabs la sogs pa'i tshad med pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.üîΩSince that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.

original: de ni tha snyad du yang sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid yin na de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pas bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du yang sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid yin na de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pas bstan pa'i phyir
translated: Since that is the case, the seed and so on are not established as the nature of the sprout and so on.

original: / tha snyad du yang gang zhig gang gis mi stong pa de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / tha snyad du yang gang zhig gang gis mi stong pa de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since that is the

original: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na dbyu gu gsum las dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid bzhin pas tha snyad du yang rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na dbyu gu gsum las dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid bzhin pas tha snyad du yang rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you assert that the effect arises prior to the cause even conventionally, then it is undermined by inference.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims @122b bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims @122b bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof, the example, and the conclusion are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, because the three sticks of a tripod are not empty of the nature of the three sticks, the effect does not arise from the cause even conventionally.

original: dper na grangs can gyi dbyu gu gsum ni dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid des mi stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs nyid kyang 'bras bu myu gu zhes
analyzed: dper na grangs can gyi dbyu gu gsum ni dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid des mi stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gal te sa bon la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshogs nyid kyang 'bras bu myu gu zhes
translated: In the same way, if the collection of causes such as the seed itself is not empty of the nature of the effect such as the sprout, then the effect would not arise from the cause even conventionally.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pas mi stong pa'i phyir de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas tha snyad du yang grangs can dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pas mi stong pa'i phyir de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas tha snyad du yang grangs can dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Because it is not empty of the capacity for action and so on, that effect would not arise from that cause. Therefore, even conventionally, if one asserts that the effect exists prior to the cause, as the Enumerators do, it is undermined by inference.

original: de ni ma grub po //üîΩmngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na /
analyzed: de ni ma grub po // mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na /
translated: That is not established.üîΩBecause it is not apprehended by direct perception, it is not apprehended by direct perception alone.üîΩIf one states a reason with a distinction, then the meaning of the reason is not ascertained.

original: yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de zhes gang du gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas ba der yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de zhes gang du gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas ba der yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Where the application of the reason is made, there is no uncertainty.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu snga na yod pa'i skye ba dgag pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag la gal te rjes su dpag
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu snga na yod pa'i skye ba dgag pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis ci ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag la gal te rjes su dpag
translated: Because it cannot be demonstrated that it exists through inference in the manner that has been explained, and because it has been demonstrated that arising is impossible if the effect exists prior to the cause.

original: pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar na don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma
analyzed: pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar na don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma
