translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄúWhy do Buddhists say, ‚ÄòBecause your reason is not apprehended‚Äô? If you apply the reason ‚Äòbecause it is not apprehended by inference,‚Äô then the fault of the meaning being unestablished would ensue. Therefore, in order to completely avoid that fault, here we say, ‚ÄòBecause your reason is not apprehended.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: and because it is not perceived by direct perception alone.üîΩBut the meaning of the reason is not ascertained,

original: mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras pa'i skabs der gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas pa der yang kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras pa'i skabs der gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas pa der yang kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa
translated: because although it is not perceived by direct perception, it is perceived by inference.

original: de skad brjod na yang de'i don ma nges pa nyid ma yin te zhes lan gdab pa ston te /
analyzed: de skad brjod na yang de'i don ma nges pa nyid ma yin te zhes lan gdab pa ston te /
translated: When this is said, the Madhyamika replies, ‚ÄúEven though you say this, the meaning of your reason is not ascertained.‚ÄùüîΩThis shows the reply.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi sngar de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi sngar de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, we have already said that the seed and so on are not perceived in the collection itself, because the sprout and so on are not perceived in the collection of the seed and so on.

original: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not perceived in that collection.

original: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not apprehended in something does not exist in that thing.

original: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la snam bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cloth does not exist in a pot.

original: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu @123a * //üîΩyang de bzhin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu @123a * // yang de bzhin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid
translated: The sprout is in the assemblage itself.üîΩTherefore, as explained, the sprout and so on, which are the effects, should be understood as not existing in the seed and so on, which are the causes.üîΩSince you cannot demonstrate that the sprout and so on, which are the effects, exist prior to the assemblage of the seed and so on, which are the causes, in the manner of a potentiality, you cannot demonstrate that the sprout and so on exist in the seed and so on.

original: las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de khyed kyis yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes
analyzed: las 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de khyed kyis yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes
translated: Therefore, your reason is not established.

original: su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid ma nges pa nyid yin pas des kho bo'i gtan tshigs mngon sum kho na gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod pa de'i don ma nges pa
analyzed: su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid ma nges pa nyid yin pas des kho bo'i gtan tshigs mngon sum kho na gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod pa de'i don ma nges pa
translated: Because it is apprehended by inference.üîΩBut that is not established, and therefore your argument that ‚Äúmy reason is only nonapprehended by direct perception‚Äù is a reason that is not established.

original: nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa de ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa de ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since you cannot establish that the meaning of that argument is not established, my argument that ‚Äúmy reason is not established‚Äù is not itself not established.

original: ci re zhig mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs
analyzed: ci re zhig mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs
translated: What is it? Is it because it is not apprehended by direct perception alone? For example, things that are not apprehended by direct perception, such as objects, time, and nature, are apprehended by inference.

original: pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ram ;üîΩ'on te mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na sngar kho bos ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu
analyzed: pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin par 'gyur ram ; 'on te mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir dper na sngar kho bos ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu
translated: Or, is it that because it is not perceived by direct perception, it is like the example I previously explained, that it cannot be shown to exist by inference?üîΩ  In the same way, the collection of the seed and so on is not perceived by direct perception, and the sprout and so on that are not perceived by direct perception cannot be perceived by inference.

original: gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa rjes su dpag pas kyang gzung du med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag
analyzed: gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyi gzung ba ma yin pa rjes su dpag pas kyang gzung du med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma nges pas de'i phyir khyed kyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag
translated: Since this is uncertain, your reason is not established.

original: pas gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid ma nges pa yin pas des kho bo'i gtan tshigs mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod pa de'i don ma nges pa nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pas
analyzed: pas gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid ma nges pa yin pas des kho bo'i gtan tshigs mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod pa de'i don ma nges pa nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pas
translated: Since that is itself indefinite, you cannot prove that my argument, ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by direct perception,‚Äù is indefinite, since it is qualified.

original: kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore my argument, which is qualified, is not indefinite.

original: gzhan yang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su grangs can dag 'bras bu yod pa skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa bstan pa'i @123b tshul gyis 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su grangs can dag 'bras bu yod pa skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa bstan pa'i @123b tshul gyis 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir yang kho bo'i gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas
translated: Moreover, in the context of the chapter on nonarising, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya assertion that an existent effect arises is refuted. Since the proof of the prior existence of the effect is not established, my argument, which is qualified,

original: pa ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: is not indefinite.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis ji ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag gis ji ste sangs rgyas pa dag rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du
translated: Because it is not apprehended in any way.üîΩSince the meaning of the reason is accepted, it is not the case that it is not established.

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon du
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de gal te mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon du
translated: This is saying that previously the SƒÅ·πÉkhya said, ‚ÄúIf the Buddhist says, ‚ÄòBecause our reason is not apprehended,‚Äô if that is stated with the qualification ‚Äòbecause it is not apprehended by direct perception,‚Äô then the fault is that the meaning of the reason is not ascertained.

original: 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de /
analyzed: 'gyur ba de yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'dir rang gi gtan tshigs gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod de /
translated: Therefore, if you who wish to completely abandon that error understand the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended‚Äù as ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended in any way by any valid cognition, such as perception and inference,‚Äù then the error of the nonestablishment of the reason still exists.

original: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pas ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i lan gdab pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pas ni rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i lan gdab pa ston te /
translated: Thus, in response to the statement, ‚ÄúBecause the effect, such as a sprout, exists in the assembly of causes and conditions, such as a seed, in the manner of a potentiality, it is apprehended by inference,‚Äù he teaches the response:

original: 'di ltar kho bos sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bos sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, I do not apprehend the effect, such as a sprout, as existing in the assembly of causes and conditions, such as a seed.‚Äù

original: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa yang ma yin pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs de ni mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / tshad ma thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gzung du yod pa yang ma yin pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin
translated: Because it is not apprehended by any valid cognition, direct perception or inference.üîΩThe meaning of the reason is accepted as ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended by any valid cognition, direct perception or inference.‚ÄùüîΩSince it is not apprehended by inference, my reason is not unestablished.

original: no // zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid ni med pa ma byung ba las gdod 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sngar grangs can dag na re dngos po yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang cha phra ba'i phyir
analyzed: no // zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid ni med pa ma byung ba las gdod 'byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sngar grangs can dag na re dngos po yod kyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang cha phra ba'i phyir
translated: Since the absence of being overwhelmed and grossness are the first to arise from the nonexistence of nonarising, it follows that they are proponents of prior nonexistence.

original: dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de gnyis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye ba'i gtan tshigs su mi rung gi 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar smra ba'i gzhung yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //üîΩ'di ltar grangs can dag gi gzhung las dper na nyi @124a * //
analyzed: dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de gnyis rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye ba'i gtan tshigs su mi rung gi 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar smra ba'i gzhung yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to // 'di ltar grangs can dag gi gzhung las dper na nyi @124a * //
translated: The reason that the Sarpkhyas state, ‚ÄúIt is not observed,‚Äù is not a reason for production from a prior existent effect, but rather it is a scriptural reference for production from a prior nonexistent effect.

original: ma'i 'od kyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma'i 'od kyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, according to the Samkhya scriptures, for example, the light of the sun outshines the light of the planets, stars, and so on, and they are not observed, but this does not mean that they do not exist.

original: zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: They are not observed because they are outshone.üîΩWhen they are free from the condition of being outshone, then they clearly appear as not outshone.

original: gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na zil gyis ma non pa'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar 'byung ba dang / dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na zil gyis ma non pa'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar 'byung ba dang / dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin gyi cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: For example, smoke, dust, mist, and so on, that are in the sky are not observed, but this does not mean that they do not exist. They are not observed because they are subtle.

original: gang gi tshe cha phra bar gyur ba'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na rags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa snga na yod paüîΩyang zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang gi tshe cha phra bar gyur ba'i rkyen dang bral ba de'i tshe na rags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ba de bzhin du sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa snga na yod pa yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
translated: In the same way, the capacity of the collection of a seed and so on to produce the effect called a sprout exists prior to the effect.

original: cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs par zad kyi de med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cha phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs par zad kyi de med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not perceived because it is obscured or because it is subtle.üîΩWhen it is free of conditions that obscure it or make it subtle, then it arises as the nature of a clear object.

original: gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa dang cha phra bar gyur pa'i rkyen dang bral pa de'i tshe zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sgrub pas de ltar na zil gyis ma non pa dang rags pa nyid snga na zil gyis non pa dang cha phra ba'i gnas skabs na med pa phyis zil gyis ma non pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zil gyis non pa dang cha phra bar gyur pa'i rkyen dang bral pa de'i tshe zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sgrub pas de ltar na zil gyis ma non pa dang rags pa nyid snga na zil gyis non pa dang cha phra ba'i gnas skabs na med pa phyis zil gyis ma non pa dang /
translated: In that case, the nonobscured and the coarse do not exist prior to the state of being obscured and subtle, but later, when they are free of those conditions, the nonobscured and the coarse exist.

original: rags pa nyid kyi rkyen las byung ba yin pas med pa ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir de ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung gi / sangs rgyas pa dag 'bras bu snga
analyzed: rags pa nyid kyi rkyen las byung ba yin pas med pa ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir de ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung gi / sangs rgyas pa dag 'bras bu snga
translated: Since it arises from the condition of grossness, it arises from what was not previously nonexistent. Therefore, this is not a correct reason for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya assertion that an effect arises from a cause that exists prior to it.

original: na med pa ma byung ba las 'byung bar smra ba'i gzhung yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na med pa ma byung ba las 'byung bar smra ba'i gzhung yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that this is a treatise of the Buddhists who assert that an effect arises from what was not previously existent and did not occur prior to it.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang cha phra ba'i phyir gzung du med do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa zil gyis non pa dang / cha phra ba nyid yin par bstan dka' ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang cha phra ba'i phyir gzung du med do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa zil gyis non pa dang / cha phra ba nyid yin par bstan dka' ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nus pa'i tshul du snga
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas‚Äô scriptures state that the effect, such as a sprout, exists in the assembly of causes such as a seed in the manner of potency.

original: na yod pa nyid yin yang dper na nye ma'i 'od zer gyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang med pa ma yin pa dang / dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes smras pa dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa zil gyis non
analyzed: na yod pa nyid yin yang dper na nye ma'i 'od zer gyis gza' dang rgyu skar dang skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa dag mi dmigs kyang med pa ma yin pa dang / dper na du ba dang rdul dang khug rna la sogs pa nam mkha' la yan pa dag mi dmigs kyang de med pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes smras pa dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa zil gyis non
translated: For example, the light of the sun and moon outshines the light of the planets, stars, and constellations, and they are not perceived, but this does not mean they do not exist.üîΩFor example, smoke, dust, and mist that exist in the sky are not perceived, but this does not mean they do not exist.

original: pa dang @124b cha phra ba nyid yin par rjes su dpag pa gang gis kyang bstan dka' ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pa dang @124b cha phra ba nyid yin par rjes su dpag pa gang gis kyang bstan dka' ba'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The response of those who say this is difficult to demonstrate by any inference that the effect exists in the cause in the manner of potential and that it is subtle and outshines the cause.

original: grangs can dag las gang dag 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de'i don skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa ma yin la 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhinüîΩdu rgyas par bya'o zhes bya bas ni grangs can nus pa gsal bar smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba'i don ni skye ba'i sngon rol ma skyes pa'i dus na dper na til la til mar snga na yod
analyzed: grangs can dag las gang dag 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de'i don skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa ma yin la 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhin du rgyas par bya'o zhes bya bas ni grangs can nus pa gsal bar smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba'i don ni skye ba'i sngon rol ma skyes pa'i dus na dper na til la til mar snga na yod
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe effect exists in the cause‚Äù is that the effect is not nonexistent prior to arising, but it is not manifest in the nature of the effect.üîΩThe refutation of this is similar to the previous one.üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe effect exists in the cause‚Äù in the texts of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya who propound that potency is manifest is that, just as oil exists in sesame seeds,üîΩthe effect exists in the cause in the manner of potency prior to arising, at the time when it is not arisen prior to arising.

original: pa bzhin du rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa yin la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don ni dper na til mar gyi bdag nyid snga na gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid phyis brdung ba dang btsir ba la sogs pa'i rkyen
analyzed: pa bzhin du rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa yin la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don ni dper na til mar gyi bdag nyid snga na gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid phyis brdung ba dang btsir ba la sogs pa'i rkyen
translated: The meaning of the term arising is that, for example, the nature of sesame oil is not manifest prior to grinding and pressing it with the conditions of a mortar and pestle.

original: gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba bzhin du 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid snga na gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyang phyis bskyed pa dang bskyang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba
analyzed: gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba bzhin du 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid snga na gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyang phyis bskyed pa dang bskyang ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba
translated: Just as the nature of clarity arises from the cause, the nature of the effect, such as a sprout, does not exist in a manifest way prior to its arising, but later it arises as the nature of clarity due to conditions such as the arising and nurturing of the sprout.üîΩTherefore, the effect exists in the cause in the manner of a potency, and later it arises as the nature of clarity due to conditions.

original: yin pas des na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na nus pa'i tshul du yod pa phyis rkyen gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhin du rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: yin pas des na rgyu la 'bras bu snga na nus pa'i tshul du yod pa phyis rkyen gyis gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhin du rgyas par bya ste /
translated: The refutation of that is to be done extensively in the same way as above,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba ma grub la /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba ma grub la /
translated: because it is impossible to demonstrate that the effect exists in the cause in the manner of a potency prior to the cause.üîΩTherefore the assertion that the effect exists prior to the cause is not established.

original: gsal ba sngon ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba sngon ma byung ba las byung ba'i phyir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The assertion that the effect does not exist prior to the cause is established because the manifest arises from what did not previously exist.

original: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas yang rang gi sde pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas yang rang gi sde pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the treatise author also refutes the texts of our own Buddhist schools.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyir yang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyir yang bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Similarly, he also explains for those who assert that the effect does not exist prior to the cause.

original: 'dis ni bye brag du smra ba dang mdo sde pa dag rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bye brag du smra ba dang mdo sde pa dag rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
translated: This teaches another way to refute the texts of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and SautrƒÅntikas who assert that the effect arises from the mere assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: To demonstrate that point, he says:

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni // zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions,üîΩthen how could the effect arise from that assembly?üîΩThis teaches that the effect does not arise from the mere assembly of causes and conditions.

original: des ni bye brag tu smra ba dang do sde pa dag gi rgya la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /
analyzed: des ni bye brag tu smra ba dang do sde pa dag gi rgya la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa ston te /
translated: This demonstrates the refutation of the texts of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and SautrƒÅntikas who assert that the effect arises from the mere assembly of causes and conditions.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang / do sde pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus skye bar 'dod pas de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la @125a * //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang / do sde pa dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa las phyis rkyen gyi mthus skye bar 'dod pas de dag gi tshul gyis rgyu'i tshogs pa nyid la @125a * //
translated: VaibhƒÅ·π£hikas and SautrƒÅntikas assert that effects arise from causes that do not exist prior to the cause.

original: 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid las skye bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na med pa nyid las skye bar gyur na'o //
translated: According to their systems, effects would arise from the assembly of causes and conditions themselves, but effects would not exist prior to the assembly.

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable, it says:üîΩCauses and conditions

original: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: Would be the same as noncauses and nonconditions.

original: 'bras bu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the effect would be empty.

original: yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: In this world, causes and conditions are designated as such because they arise in dependence on each other, such that when this exists, this arises, and because when this arises, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba zhes bya ba lta bus rgyu yang 'bras bus mi stong la /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba zhes bya ba lta bus rgyu yang 'bras bus mi stong la /
translated: In this way, causes are not empty of effects.

original: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par gyur pa de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du rgyu rnams
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par gyur pa de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du rgyu rnams
translated: If the effect is generated by the cause, then if the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, as the opponent asserts, then because causes and conditions would be empty of the effect, it would follow that conventionally causesüîΩand conditions would be like those that are not causes and conditions, such as those that are not similar types,

original: dang rkyen dag ces brjod pa de dag kyang rigs mi mthun pa'am /üîΩmed pa pa dag gis rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //üîΩde'i phyir da ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dang rkyen dag ces brjod pa de dag kyang rigs mi mthun pa'am / med pa pa dag gis rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to // de'i phyir da ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste /
translated: or those that are designated as not being causes and conditions by non-Buddhists.üîΩTherefore this is illogical.üîΩNow, the difference between the characteristics of causes and conditions and the characteristics of noncauses and nonconditions should be taught.

original: de la re zhig rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the difference between the characteristics of causes and conditions, first the characteristics of causes and conditions are taught.

original: ci ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between causes and conditions?‚ÄùüîΩThe defining characteristics of causes are as follows: They are not shared, they are not multiple, and they are the nature of the cause.üîΩThe defining characteristics of conditions are the opposite of those.üîΩThey are shared, they are multiple, and they are not the nature of the cause.

original: de la re zhig rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de 'ba' zhig skyed kyi gzhan mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni de 'ba' zhig skyed kyi gzhan mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The defining characteristics of causes are as follows: They are not shared because they produce only that, not something else.

original: thun mong ma yin pa dang rgyu'i bdag nyid rnam pa mang po ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgcig pa dang / gang gi phyir myu gu skyed pas sa bon rang gi don byas par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa dang rgyu'i bdag nyid rnam pa mang po ma yin pa'i phyir / gcig pa dang / gang gi phyir myu gu skyed pas sa bon rang gi don byas par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: They are not multiple because they are not of many types.üîΩThey are the nature of the cause because the seed is the cause of the sprout.

original: rang gi don byed pa dang sa bon 'gags ma thag tu myu gu skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rang gi don byed pa dang sa bon 'gags ma thag tu myu gu skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: They are immediate because the sprout arises immediately after the seed has ceased.

original: de ma thag pa dang rigs mthun pa nyid skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma thag pa dang rigs mthun pa nyid skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: They are homogeneous because they produce what is of a similar type.

original: cha mnyam pa skyed pa ste de dag la sogs pa dag ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa skyed pa ste de dag la sogs pa dag ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other characteristics should be understood as the defining characteristics of causes.

original: de bzhin du rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The defining characteristics of conditions are the opposite of those.

original: de 'ba' zhig mi skyed kyi gzhan yang skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig mi skyed kyi gzhan yang skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: They are shared because they produce something else, not just that.

original: thun mong dang rkyen gyi bdag nyid rnam pa mang ba'i phyir du ma dang gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan gyi rgyud gso ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa dang rkyen rnams 'gags ma thag tu myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur bas thag ring ba dang rigs mi mthun
analyzed: thun mong dang rkyen gyi bdag nyid rnam pa mang ba'i phyir du ma dang gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan gyi rgyud gso ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa dang rkyen rnams 'gags ma thag tu myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur bas thag ring ba dang rigs mi mthun
translated: Because it is manyfold, it is manifold, since it has many common and conditional aspects.üîΩBecause it benefits others, it is the cause of the continuum of other beings.üîΩBecause it is distant and because it produces dissimilar types,

original: pa dag kyang skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa dag kyang skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: since a sprout does not arise immediately after the cessation of conditions.

original: cha mi nyams pa skyed pa de /
analyzed: cha mi nyams pa skyed pa de /
translated: Because it produces without loss of parts,

original: de dag la sogs pa dag ni rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par @125b bya'o ;
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa dag ni rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par @125b bya'o ;
translated: these and other characteristics should be understood as the characteristics of conditions.

original: / rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: / rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of noncauses and nonconditions are

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji skad bstan pa de dag las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: the opposite of the characteristics of causes and conditions as they have been explained.

original: da ni yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyu dang rkyen rnams dang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i tshul ni de lta bu yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu
analyzed: da ni yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyu dang rkyen rnams dang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams zhes tha snyad gdags pa'i tshul ni de lta bu yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu
translated: Now, if the collection of causes and conditions themselvesüîΩdo not have the effect, as the opponent asserts, then in that case, becauseüîΩthe causes and conditions would be empty of effects, it would follow that

original: med par gyur na de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du rgyu rnams dang rkyen dag ces brjod pa de dag kyang rigs mi mthun pa'am med pa dag gi rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i skyon
analyzed: med par gyur na de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir tha snyad du rgyu rnams dang rkyen dag ces brjod pa de dag kyang rigs mi mthun pa'am med pa dag gi rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag dang mtshungs pa'i skyon
translated: the causes and conditions would be equivalent to non-causes and non-conditions, which are not of a concordant type, and which are merelyüîΩimputed.

original: du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the subject and the predicate of a probandum, it isüîΩsaid:

original: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: They would be equivalent to non-causes and non-conditions.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi chos 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin par bstan pas zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma 'dis ni gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med pa yin na bdag cag sangs rgyas pa dag gis /üîΩkun rdzob kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams zhes brjod pa de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma yin par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bu bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi chos 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin par bstan pas zhes bya ba smras te / tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba tha ma 'dis ni gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med pa yin na bdag cag sangs rgyas pa dag gis / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams zhes brjod pa de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma yin par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bu bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang
translated: This passage explains that the effect is not produced by causes and conditions, and that it is empty of effect.üîΩThis final root verse of the stanzas explains that if, as the opponent asserts, the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, then the fault of the absurd consequence that the causes and conditions that we Buddhists say are conventionally called ‚Äúcauses and conditions‚Äù are not causes and conditions would follow.

original: / 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin par go rims bzhin du bstan pas so //
analyzed: / 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin par go rims bzhin du bstan pas so //
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishment are, respectively, that causes and conditions do not produce effects and that effects are empty.üîΩThis is taught in order, respectively.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'dir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsal ba 'di lta bu mngon te zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'dir bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag la sogs pas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga na med pa las don dam par skye ba yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs la dbu ma pas rgyu dang rkyen rnams
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsal ba 'di lta bu mngon te zhes bya ba smras te / 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag la sogs pas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga na med pa las don dam par skye ba yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs la dbu ma pas rgyu dang rkyen rnams
translated: Here, in the context of the position of those who propound that the effect is not present in the cause, this clear inference that is helpful to the point is stated.üîΩHere, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, SautrƒÅntika, and so on propound that the mere assembly of the seed and so on is the ultimate arising of the effect, such as the sprout, from that which is not present before.

original: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang rgyu rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsal ba 'di lta bu mngon
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang rgyu rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gsal ba 'di lta bu mngon
translated: In the context of the proof that the MƒÅdhyamika presents to them, ‚ÄúBecause the causes and conditions are empty of the effect, they do not generate the effect. Therefore it follows that the causes and conditions are equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions,‚Äù this clear inference that is helpful to the point is stated.

original: te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is applied.

original: skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pas gsal ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pas gsal ba de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, which is clarified by the inference that is relevant here, he says:

original: don dam par sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu skyed @126a * //üîΩpa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu skyed @126a * // pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: ultimately, seeds and so on, which are causes and conditions, are not producers of effects.üîΩThis is to be understood because the effect is emptiness.

original: 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag bzhin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag bzhin no zhes smras te /
translated: For example, it is like what are not causes and conditions.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: dper na rigs mi mthun pa'am med pa pa dag gis rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag ni 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du sa bon
analyzed: dper na rigs mi mthun pa'am med pa pa dag gis rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par btags pa dag ni 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du sa bon
translated: For example, it is like what are not causes and conditions, which are imputed by those who are of a different philosophical school or by those who are nihilists. They are to be understood as not ultimately producing effects because the effect is emptiness.

original: la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that ultimately they do not generate effects.

original: des na gal te sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams don dam par 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin na bdag cag sangs rgyas pa dag gis /üîΩkun rdzob kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams zhes bya ba de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma yin par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma
analyzed: des na gal te sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams don dam par 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin na bdag cag sangs rgyas pa dag gis / kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du rgyu dang rkyen rnams zhes bya ba de dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma yin par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma
translated: If seeds and so on, causes and conditions, do not generate effects because ultimately they are empty of effects, then we Buddhists wouldüîΩerroneously say that those called causes and conditions are not causes and conditions.

original: yin pa las skye bar 'dod pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin pa las skye bar 'dod pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to assert that an effect arises from a nonexistent collection of causes and conditions, such as the sprout arising from the collection of seeds and so on.

original: gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyod par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyod par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: If an effect is to be generated by causes and conditions,

original: rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas gal te sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag yod pa
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag sngar dbu ma pas gal te sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag yod pa
translated: But an effect arises from a definite cause and condition.üîΩThis is a response to the earlier objection raised by the opponent, ‚ÄúIf the mere assembly of the seed and so on exists, then the sprout and so on would not be empty of intrinsic reality.üîΩBut if the sprout and so on do not exist in the assembly of the seed and so on, then it follows that the cause and conditions would be the same as the noncause and nonconditions because the effect would be empty.‚Äù

original: ma yin pa ma yin na de dag 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de la phyir bzlog pa'i tshig yin te /üîΩde dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ma yin pa ma yin na de dag 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa de la phyir bzlog pa'i tshig yin te / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The response is as follows: The subject, the assembly of the seed and so on, is the example. The predicate of the probandum, the sprout and so on do not exist in the assembly of the seed and so on, is the probandum. The reason, the effect is empty, is the proof.

original: de dag na re 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dag mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag na re 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dag mthong ste /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúIn this way we see that causes and conditions are definite.

original: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye la /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye la /
translated: From a barley seed a barley sprout arises, but a rice sprout does not arise.

original: rgyu spun dag las kyang snam bu nyid 'byung gi bum pa mi 'byung bas de ltar gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par bya ba yin pas rgyu dang rkyen nges
analyzed: rgyu spun dag las kyang snam bu nyid 'byung gi bum pa mi 'byung bas de ltar gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par bya ba yin pas rgyu dang rkyen nges
translated: Thus, because an effect arises from just the ascertainment of causes and conditions, the effect is generated by causes and conditions.

original: pa rnams 'bras bus mi stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa rnams 'bras bus mi stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because ascertained causes and conditions are not empty of effects,

original: rgyu dang @126b rkyen rnams rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang @126b rkyen rnams rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: the error of the consequence that causes and conditions would be equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions does not arise.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: des kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: des kyang mi nus te /
translated: That is not possible.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because there is no concomitance and because the same objection applies to you.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba des kyang rgyu dang rkyen 'bras bus stong pa rnams rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bzlog par mi
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba des kyang rgyu dang rkyen 'bras bus stong pa rnams rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bzlog par mi
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument, ‚Äúbecause effects arise from causes and conditions that are definite,‚Äù cannot avoid the fault of the consequence that causes and conditions that are empty of effects are equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions.

original: nus te ; ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nus te ; ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: pha rol po dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong yang /
analyzed: pha rol po dag la rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'bras bus stong yang /
translated: For the opponent, although causes and conditions are empty of effects,

original: don dam par rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir /
translated: effects arise from causes and conditions that are definite in the ultimate.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the fault of the consequence that causes and conditions are equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions does not arise.

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar rtogs na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de yod pa'am /üîΩmed pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar rtogs na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de yod pa'am / med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: then does the effect arise from the assembly of causes and conditions that exists or from that which does not exist?

original: gnyi ga las kyang de'i skye ba mi 'thad de /üîΩsngar ; gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gnyi ga las kyang de'i skye ba mi 'thad de / sngar ; gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: The arising of an effect from both is untenable.üîΩPreviously it was said:

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: if the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: how could it arise from the assembly?

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: if the effect does not exist in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye ;
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye ;
translated: how could it arise from the assembly?

original: / zhes bstan pa dag dang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir des kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: / zhes bstan pa dag dang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir des kyang mi nus so //
translated: This is similar to the previous refutation and examination, so it is untenable.

original: gal te nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye bar mthong bas mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyi don med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye bar mthong bas mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyi don med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Suppose someone said that since we see that a barley sprout arises from a barley seed, there is no point in reasoning in regard to what is seen.

original: pha rol po dag na re /üîΩgang gi tshe mngon sum nyid du nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye'i /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re / gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid du nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye'i /
translated: This is the opponent's statement.

original: 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye ba de'i tshe mngon sum la gtan tshigs kyi tshig gi don med pas de la gtan tshigs btsal mi dgos so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye ba de'i tshe mngon sum la gtan tshigs kyi tshig gi don med pas de la gtan tshigs btsal mi dgos so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: When we see that a barley sprout arises from a barley seed and not from a rice seed, there is no point in the words of a syllogism in regard to what is seen. Therefore, there is no need to seek a syllogism in regard to that.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis @127a * //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis @127a * //
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dang 'bras bu skye bar mthong ba ni bden no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dang 'bras bu skye bar mthong ba ni bden no //
translated: It is true that the mind that belongs to the domain of conventional knowledge sees the arising of a sprout and the definite arising of an effect from a cause and conditions.

original: don dam bar ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: don dam bar ni ma mthong ste /
translated: But it does not see it ultimately.

original: don dam par de'i skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par de'i skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is because its arising is not established ultimately.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye bar mthong ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen nges par mthong ba la 'bras bu nges par skye bar mthong ba ni bden no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye bar mthong ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen nges par mthong ba la 'bras bu nges par skye bar mthong ba ni bden no //
translated: The mind that is included within the conventions of the relative sees that a sprout arises and sees that an effect definitely arises when causes and conditions are definitely seen.

original: don dam par gang nges par snang ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'bras bu yod na 'thad kyi /üîΩmed na mi 'thad kyi de'i phyir pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: don dam par gang nges par snang ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'bras bu yod na 'thad kyi / med na mi 'thad kyi de'i phyir pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar /
translated: That which definitely appears in the ultimate is tenable if the effect exists from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ba de don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu med na rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de'i
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye'o zhes bya ba de don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu med na rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de'i
translated: If it does not exist, it is not tenable. Therefore, because the arising of an effect from the mere assembly of causes and conditions is not established in the ultimate, as asserted by the opponent, if the effect does not exist in causes and conditions, the error of being equivalent to that which is not a cause and condition would ensue.

original: phyir med pa mi skye'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: phyir med pa mi skye'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that ‚Äúthe nonexistent does not arise.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba yang med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that effects are established when analyzed in this way, the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of establishing the effect‚Äù is not established, and it is also not a correct reason that pervades.üîΩThis is the summary.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of valid knowledgeüîΩWhen analyzed in this way, it is untenable that effects are established in either of the two positions asserted by the Vai≈õe·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya, that effects arise from the assembly of causes and conditions that exist prior to them or that effects arise from the assembly of causes and conditions that do not exist prior to them.

original: de ltar yongs su brtags na bye brag pa dang grangs can dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas sngar pha rol po dag na re don dam par dus ni yod pa kho narüîΩshes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtags na bye brag pa dang grangs can dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na yod pa las skye ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu snga na med pa las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyis ka la 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas sngar pha rol po dag na re don dam par dus ni yod pa kho narüîΩshes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, as was previously stated, the opponent asserts that time definitely exists ultimately.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe yang med pas pha rol po'i sgrub pa ma grub bo //
translated: But the meaning of that reason is not established, and there is no example that conforms with the reason. Therefore the opponent‚Äôs proof is not established.

original: yang gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyi rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram /üîΩ'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni yang na gzhan yang bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde ba dag gi lung las rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes 'byung ba de rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyi rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram / 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni yang na gzhan yang bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde ba dag gi lung las rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes 'byung ba de rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram
translated: Moreover, for those who assert that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, does the cause cease after giving rise to the effect?üîΩOr does it cease without giving rise to the effect?üîΩMoreover, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika and SautrƒÅntika scriptures state that the cause gives rise to the effect.üîΩThis is the twofold analysis: Does the cause cease after giving rise to the effect?

original: / 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur zhes brtags pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: / 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur zhes brtags pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Or does it cease without giving rise to the effect?

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi 'dri ba'i tshig yin @127b no //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi 'dri ba'i tshig yin @127b no //
translated: What is the point of this? This is a question from the opponent.

original: de la re zhig brtags pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: de la re zhig brtags pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: To this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:üîΩIf a cause ceases

original: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
translated: Having given its causal capacity to an effect,üîΩThe identity of the cause would be twofold:

original: gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa'i //üîΩrgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa'i // rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: That which is given and that which ceases.

original: zhes bya ba smras te gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rang gi nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur bas de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rang gi nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur bas de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do //
translated: If a cause ceases after it has given its own capacity to an effect, then the identity of the cause would be twofold: that which is given and that which ceases. But this is not accepted even conventionally.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain this point in more detail,

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu'i nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu'i nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: If a cause ceases after it has given its causal capacity to an effect, then the identity of the cause would be twofold: that which is given and that which ceases.

original: byin pa dang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin pa dang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the identity of that which is given and that which ceases would be different.

original: de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But this is not accepted even conventionally.

original: da ni yang 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa grogs byed pa'i rkyen khams drug la sogs bas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin pas de'i rkyen gyis kun rdzob tuüîΩ'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la kun rdzob tu yang 'bras bu snga na med par 'gyur na rgyus nus pa dbul zhing bzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi med pa
analyzed: da ni yang 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa grogs byed pa'i rkyen khams drug la sogs bas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin pas de'i rkyen gyis kun rdzob tu 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na gal te pha rol po dag 'dod pa ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la kun rdzob tu yang 'bras bu snga na med par 'gyur na rgyus nus pa dbul zhing bzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi med pa
translated: Now, in the world, the way in which causes and results are related is that if the conditions that assist the results of dependent origination, such as the six elements, and so on, provide benefit, then results will be able to arise.üîΩTherefore, results arise conventionally due to those conditions. However, if, as the opponent asserts, the result does not exist prior to the assembly of causes and conditions even conventionally, then the basis of the distinction between the potency being deposited and not being deposited by the cause

original: la nus pa dbul du mi rung bas rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la nus pa dbul du mi rung bas rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: would be untenable. Since it is not suitable for potency to be deposited, it is untenable that the cause ceases after giving rise to the result.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'bras bu la sogs pa grogs byed pas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed bar nus pa yin pas de'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu med pa bzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi medüîΩpa la nas pa dbul du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'bras bu la sogs pa grogs byed pas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed bar nus pa yin pas de'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu med pa bzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi med pa la nas pa dbul du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But if the effect does not exist, it is impossible to posit the basis of the distinction of the cause.

original: de ltar rgyus 'bras bu la nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin pas chos thams cad la rgyu 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyus 'bras bu la nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin pas chos thams cad la rgyu 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the cause does not cease after it has exerted its potency on the effect, in order to demonstrate that no cause is transferred to the effect, the text says:

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la 'pho ba med de 'dra ba las de ltar 'khrul lo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la 'pho ba med de 'dra ba las de ltar 'khrul lo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, formations are not transferred, but they are confused in that way.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba la sogs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba la sogs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus the ƒÄrya S≈´tra on Transference of Existence and so on says:

original: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'ga' yang 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'ga' yang 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: No one passes from this world to the next.

original: kun rdzob tu shi 'pho dang skye bar mngon pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun 'dra ba las de ltar 'khrul te rgyu dang gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes gsungs so //üîΩnyan @128a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu shi 'pho dang skye bar mngon pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun 'dra ba las de ltar 'khrul te rgyu dang gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes gsungs so // nyan @128a * //
translated: The appearance of death and birth in the relative is a delusion from the continuity of similar moments, like a cause and a reflection.üîΩIn the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, it is said, ‚ÄúFor example, when a seal is pressed into a lump of clay, the seal appears but does not transfer.

original: thos kyi theg pa las kyang dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu legs par byas pa las rgyas btab pa'i 'bur snang ba ni rgya nyid dang 'phos pa med mod kyi 'dra ba'i rgyun gyis 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin du sems kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung
analyzed: thos kyi theg pa las kyang dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu legs par byas pa las rgyas btab pa'i 'bur snang ba ni rgya nyid dang 'phos pa med mod kyi 'dra ba'i rgyun gyis 'bur gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin du sems kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung
translated: Similarly, the mind is like that.‚Äù

original: ngo // de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i snying po las kyang 'gro ba thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: ngo // de'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i snying po las kyang 'gro ba thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, in the Essence of Interdependent Origination, the master ƒÄryadeva also says, ‚ÄúAll beings are cause and effect.

original: 'di la sems can zhes bya ba gzhan gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la sems can zhes bya ba gzhan gang yang med do //
translated: There is no other so-called sentient being.

original: chos stong pa kho na dag las stong pa'i chos rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos stong pa kho na dag las stong pa'i chos rnams 'byung ste /
translated: From only empty phenomena, empty phenomena arise.

original: rgya dang me long dang shel sgong dang kha don dang skyur gyi dpes phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba la 'pho ba med par mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin par shes par
analyzed: rgya dang me long dang shel sgong dang kha don dang skyur gyi dpes phung po'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba la 'pho ba med par mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin par shes par
translated: One should understand that the cause does not cease after it has given its causal power to the effect.

original: bya'o // da ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya'o // da ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the second theory is untenable,

original: 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: if the cause ceases without giving its causal power to the effect,

original: de ltar na /üîΩgal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: de ltar na / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: then in that case,üîΩif the cause ceases

original: rgyu ma byin par 'gag 'gyur na //üîΩrgyu 'gag pa na skyes pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu ma byin par 'gag 'gyur na // rgyu 'gag pa na skyes pa yi //
translated: without giving its causal power to the effect,üîΩthen the effect that arises when the cause ceases

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: would be causeless.

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rang gi nus pa ma phul bar 'gag par 'gyur na rgyu 'gag pa na skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas de yang tha snyad du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rang gi nus pa ma phul bar 'gag par 'gyur na rgyu 'gag pa na skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur bas de yang tha snyad du mi 'dod do //
translated: If the cause ceased without giving its causal power to the effect, then the effect that arises when the cause ceases would be causeless. But that is unacceptable even conventionally.

original: de nyid kyi bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the commentary on that,

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSince it is not accepted that effects arise without causes.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the measure of that,

original: de'i phyir yang rgyu 'gag pa ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rgyu 'gag pa ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, a cause that has ceased does not generate an effect,

original: 'gag pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it has ceased, like something that has long ceased.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'gags nas yun ring du lan pa ni 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu 'gags ma thag pa yang 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'gags nas yun ring du lan pa ni 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu 'gags ma thag pa yang 'gag pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: For example, something that has long ceased does not generate an effect because it has ceased. In the same way, a cause that has just ceased does not generate an effect because it has ceased.

original: 'di la 'gal bar sgrub pa med pas don 'di gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'dod pa 'di la gzhan dag 'gal bar sgrub pa med pas don 'di la brgal ba dang lan gdab
analyzed: 'di la 'gal bar sgrub pa med pas don 'di gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'dod pa 'di la gzhan dag 'gal bar sgrub pa med pas don 'di la brgal ba dang lan gdab
translated: Since there is no proof of contradiction here, it is unnecessary to teach this point to others.

original: pa dag gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgal te @128b tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byed de /üîΩdper na mar ma dang 'od bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'bras bu ma skyes pas rgyu'i nus pa 'dzin par mi nus pa dang rgyu dang 'gal bas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: pa dag gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te @128b tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byed de / dper na mar ma dang 'od bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'bras bu ma skyes pas rgyu'i nus pa 'dzin par mi nus pa dang rgyu dang 'gal bas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This means that since there is no proof of contradiction in this assertion that effects do not arise without causes, it is unnecessary to teach others the refutation and response.üîΩIf the effect arises simultaneously with the assembly of causes and conditions, then the effect would be simultaneous with the nonarising of the effect.üîΩIf the effect arises simultaneously with the assembly of causes and conditions, then the effect would be simultaneous with the nonarising of the effect.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu dang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu dang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byad de /
