translated: If the effect arises simultaneously with the assembly of causes and conditions, then the effect would be simultaneous with the nonarising of the effect.

original: dper na mar me dang 'od gnyis dus gcig pa nyid yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa bzhin du skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me dang 'od gnyis dus gcig pa nyid yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa bzhin du skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: For example, just as a lamp and its light are simultaneous, yet are cause and effect, so too are the producer and the produced.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
translated: If the effect arises together with the assemblage,

original: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
analyzed: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
translated: then the producer and the produced

original: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: would be simultaneous.

original: gal te tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig tu 'bras bu skyed par gyur na de lta ni skyed pa dang gang bskyed pa dag dus gcig par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig tu 'bras bu skyed par gyur na de lta ni skyed pa dang gang bskyed pa dag dus gcig par thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: If the effect arises together with the assemblage, then the error of the producer and the produced being simultaneous would follow. But that is unacceptable.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very point in detail, he says:

original: skyed pa dang bskyed ba pha dang bu lta bu dag dus gcig tu 'byung ba nyid de ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed ba pha dang bu lta bu dag dus gcig tu 'byung ba nyid de ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But we do not accept that the producer and the produced, such as the father and the son, occur at the same time.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: How then do we accept it?

original: dus tha dad pa nyid du'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi ba'i tshul gyis sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba nyid du 'dod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid du'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi ba'i tshul gyis sngon ma byung ba las 'byung ba nyid du 'dod do zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat different times‚Äù indicates that we accept that the effect arises from what previously did not exist in the sense that the cause precedes the effect.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa nyid dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod pas de'i rjes su dpag par nus te zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa ston to //
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa nyid dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod pas de'i rjes su dpag par nus te zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the cause and effect exist in the producer and the produced‚Äù indicates that the cause and effect do not occur at the same time.

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu dang tshogs pa nyid ni lhan cig mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu dang tshogs pa nyid ni lhan cig mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, the effect and the assemblage do not arise simultaneously.

original: bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bu dang pha bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bu dang pha bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are the producer and the produced, like a son and his father.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na bu dang pha ni bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig mi skye ba de bzhin du 'bras bu dang tshogs pa nyid kyang bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig me skye'o //
analyzed: dper na bu dang pha ni bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig mi skye ba de bzhin du 'bras bu dang tshogs pa nyid kyang bskyed pa dang skyed pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig me skye'o //
translated: For example, a son and his father are not produced simultaneously because one is the producer and the other is produced. Likewise, an effect and the assemblage are not produced simultaneously because one is the producer and the other is produced.

original: tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad par 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'dod dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad par 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'dod dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The light and the lamp are not established as cause and effect because the lamp with light arises conventionally through the power of a previous assemblage.

original: dgag pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar pha @129a * //
analyzed: dgag pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar pha @129a * //
translated: Since the refutation is extensively taught earlier, it is not good.

original: rol po dag na re dper na mar me dang 'od gnyis dus gcig pa nyid yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa bzhin du skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yangüîΩma yin la /
analyzed: rol po dag na re dper na mar me dang 'od gnyis dus gcig pa nyid yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa bzhin du skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yang ma yin la /
translated: The example of the flame and light are not cause and effect.

original: lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin par yang mi 'grub par ston te /
analyzed: lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin par yang mi 'grub par ston te /
translated: They also demonstrate that it is not established that they are simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: mar me dang 'od dag ni 'bru mar dang snying po dang kong bu la sogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad du 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mar me dang 'od dag ni 'bru mar dang snying po dang kong bu la sogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad du 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang ma yin la /
translated: The flame and light are not things that are cause and effect because the flame and light conventionally arise due to the power of the prior conditions such as the wick, oil, and the lamp.

original: de dag lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin par yang mi 'grub par dgag pa yang sngar 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig dang lhan cig ma yin par yang mi 'grub par dgag pa yang sngar 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs su /
translated: Also, the refutation that they are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous was previously explained in the chapter on desire and the desirous one.

original: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: Desire and the desirous one are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
translated: As with attachment, all things

original: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: ces rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa dang / de dag lhan cig tu 'byung ba bzhin du bskyed pa dang skyed pa dag lhan cig nyid du 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni bzang po ma yin no //üîΩgang dag 'bras bu sngar skyed pa nyid tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'dir bshad de zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag las nus pa dang gsal ba smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i
analyzed: ces rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu yin pa dang / de dag lhan cig tu 'byung ba bzhin du bskyed pa dang skyed pa dag lhan cig nyid du 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni bzang po ma yin no // gang dag 'bras bu sngar skyed pa nyid tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'dir bshad de zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag las nus pa dang gsal ba smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i
translated: Since this has been extensively demonstrated, it is not good to assert that that which is produced and that which produces are simultaneous, like a flame and its light, which are cause and effect and arise simultaneously.üîΩFor those who say that the effect is produced earlier and is merely clarified by the assembly of causes, this is explained here.

original: tshul du snga na yod pa nyid phyis rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: tshul du snga na yod pa nyid phyis rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed de /
translated: In the Samkhya scriptures, those who propound potency and manifestation say that the effect exists earlier in the cause in the manner of potency and is later clarified by the assembly of conditions.

original: dper na mun khung na bum pa snga na yod pa nyid mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma 'di bshad de zhes ston to //
analyzed: dper na mun khung na bum pa snga na yod pa nyid mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung dgag pa'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma 'di bshad de zhes ston to //
translated: For example, a pot that existed previously in the dark is illuminated by a butter lamp.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te tshogs pa'i snga rol du //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gal te tshogs pa'i snga rol du //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:üîΩIf the effect were to arise

original: 'bras bu skyes par gyur na ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes par gyur na ni //
translated: prior to the assembly of causes and conditions,üîΩIf the effect were to exist prior to the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du rgyu dang rkyen de dag med par 'bras bu de yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du rgyu dang rkyen de dag med par 'bras bu de yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: without those causes and conditions, he says.üîΩThis demonstrates the position of the opponent.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan te grangs can dag las nus pa dang gsal ba smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid phyis rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan te grangs can dag las nus pa dang gsal ba smra ba dag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa nyid phyis rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do
translated: According to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who propound the theory of potency and manifestation, the effect exists in the cause in the manner of potency, and later it is manifested by the assembly of conditions.

original: zhes 'byung ba ltar gyur na'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba ltar gyur na'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúIf that were the case.‚Äù

original: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: it is said:

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa yi //
translated: If the effect existed prior to the assemblage of causes and conditions,

original: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: then the effect would arise without a cause.

original: de yang mi 'dod de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.üîΩIf the effect existed prior to the assemblage of causes and conditions,üîΩthen the effect would arise without a cause.

original: gal te rgyu dang @129b rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du rgyu dang rkyen de dag med par 'bras bu de yod par gyur na de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i snga rol du skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las byungüîΩba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang @129b rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du rgyu dang rkyen de dag med par 'bras bu de yod par gyur na de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i snga rol du skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las byung ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because the error of causeless arising would ensue.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la 'bras bu yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la 'bras bu yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, we should prove that the effect exists,

original: gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni /
analyzed: gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni /
translated: but the existence of manifestation

original: rjes su dpag par mi bya ste //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par mi bya ste //
translated: should not be inferred.

original: gsal ba'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsal ba'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the response to manifestation has already been given.

original: zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de ltar 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba de ni su yang mi 'dod pas khyed cag 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes sgrub pa de'i
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba de ni su yang mi 'dod pas khyed cag 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes sgrub pa de'i
translated: Since no one accepts that effects arise without causes, you may argue, ‚ÄúTime exists ultimately because it is the cause for the establishment of effects.‚Äù

original: phyir kho bo cag la khyed kyis don dam par 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa nyid du bsgrubs na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don 'grub kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: phyir kho bo cag la khyed kyis don dam par 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa nyid du bsgrubs na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don 'grub kyang srid kyi /
translated: In response to that, we say to you, ‚ÄúIf you try to prove that effects are established in reality, it is possible that you will succeed in establishing the meaning of your reason.

original: khyed kyi gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni da rjes su dpag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: khyed kyi gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni da rjes su dpag par mi bya ste /
translated: However, you should not infer that manifestations exist.

original: kho bo cag gis gsal ba sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis gsal ba sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: We have already refuted manifestations.‚Äù

original: des na nus pa yod ces bya ba ni rgyu med pa las byung ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod la /
analyzed: des na nus pa yod ces bya ba ni rgyu med pa las byung ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'dod la /
translated: Therefore, when you say, ‚ÄúThere is potential,‚Äù you cannot accept that, because it would follow that the error of arising without a cause would ensue.

original: gsal ba ni sngar bkag zin pas grangs can dag 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du sngar skyes pa nyid rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ma grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni sngar bkag zin pas grangs can dag 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du sngar skyes pa nyid rkyen gyi tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ma grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since clarity has already been refuted, the statement by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya that the effect is generated by the assembly of conditions, which was previously produced in the manner of a potency, is not established.

original: grangs can dag las gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag las gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag la yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag 'bras bu 'grub pa yod par sgrub pa'i gzhung yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag la yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag 'bras bu 'grub pa yod par sgrub pa'i gzhung yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause itself endures as the reality of the effect‚Äù is a SƒÅ·πÉkhya treatise that proves the existence of the establishment of the effect.

original: de dag na re dper na 'o ma nyid 'gag pa zho'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas pa de bzhin du rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas pas 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan
analyzed: de dag na re dper na 'o ma nyid 'gag pa zho'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas pa de bzhin du rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas pas 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan
translated: They say, for example, just as milk itself ceases and endures as the reality of curd, in the same way, the cause itself ceases and endures as the reality of the effect.

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the establishment of the effect exists, we do not commit the error of the meaning of the reason not being established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas sam /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas sam /
translated: In response to that, if the cessation of a cause that has not relinquished the entity of a cause endures as the identity of an effect,

original: 'on te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa'i 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas par rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa'i 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas par rtog grang na /
translated: or if the cessation of a cause that has relinquished the entity of a cause endures as the identity of an effect,

original: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: it is shown that both are untenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde dag gi yang gal @130a * //üîΩte rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhe na ni /üîΩgal te rgyu 'gag 'bras bu na //
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / de dag gi yang gal @130a * // te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhe na ni / gal te rgyu 'gag 'bras bu na //
translated: First, to demonstrate the untenability of the first option, it is said:üîΩIf the cessation of a cause that has not relinquished the entity of a cause endures as the identity of an effect,

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
translated: then if the cessation of a cause is asserted to be the identity of an effect,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the effect would not be different from the cause.

original: des ni brtag pa dang po'i pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni brtag pa dang po'i pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan te /
translated: This explains the opponent‚Äôs position in the first option.

original: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de de'i tshe yang rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de de'i tshe yang rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
translated: If you say that the cause, without relinquishing its own intrinsic reality, endures in the state of the effect when it ceases, then at that time, you assert that it has the intrinsic reality of a cause.

original: da ni de mi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni de mi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable, he says:

original: de lta na rgyu ni kun du 'pho bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu ni kun du 'pho bar 'gyur //
translated: In that case, the cause would be transferred.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir lhas byin khyim nas khyim du kun du 'pho ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir lhas byin khyim nas khyim du kun du 'pho ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it does not relinquish its intrinsic reality, it would be like Devadatta being transferred from one house to another.

original: de lta na rgyu sa bon dang / 'o ma la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ril por kun du 'pho ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu sa bon dang / 'o ma la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs bzhin du 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ril por kun du 'pho ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: In that case, the seed, milk, and so on, without relinquishing their intrinsic reality, would be transferred to the state of the effect as a whole. But that is unacceptable, because it follows that the absurd consequence of the fault of the transference of a whole would ensue.

original: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another reasoning that shows this to be untenable, he says:

original: gzhan yang / sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni yang skye bar ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni yang skye bar ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, it follows that a previously arisen cause would arise again.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus he says.

original: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur na rgyu de sngon rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing ma 'gags pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i bdag nyid du skyes zin pa de da yang
analyzed: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur na rgyu de sngon rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing ma 'gags pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i bdag nyid du skyes zin pa de da yang
translated: If the cause, without relinquishing the entity of the cause, abides in the state of the effect, then at the time when the cause has not relinquished the entity of the cause and has not ceased, that which has arisen in the state of the cause

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid du skye bar thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid du skye bar thal ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: would arise again in the state of the cause.

original: da ltar 'gags shing 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i dus na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar 'gags shing 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa'i dus na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs shing rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the error that would ensue, because even at the time when it has ceased in the present and abides in the state of the effect, it would not relinquish the entity of the cause and would be asserted to be the entity of the cause.

original: da ni mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this is untenable, he says:

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
translated: That which exists in the state of the cause does not arise in the state of the cause alone,

original: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it would be pointless.

original: sngon rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa ma 'gags pa dang da ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gags shing 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la khyad par ci yang med pas de'i skye ba don med pa'iüîΩphyir ro // gal te rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
analyzed: sngon rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa ma 'gags pa dang da ltar rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa 'gags shing 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la khyad par ci yang med pas de'i skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro // gal te rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pas rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
translated: there is no difference at all between the state of the cause when the entity of the cause has not been abandoned and has not ceased and the state of the effect when the entity of the cause has not been abandoned and has ceased and abides in the nature of the cause.üîΩIf you say that there is no error because you accept that the cause arises in the nature of the effect,

original: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: this is the statement of the response of the opponent to the Madhyamaka‚Äôs explanation: ‚ÄúThat which exists in the nature of the cause does not arise in the nature of the cause alone because it would be pointless.‚Äù

original: de dag na re rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na yod @130b pa la khyad par med na ni /
analyzed: de dag na re rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na yod @130b pa la khyad par med na ni /
translated: They say that if there is no difference between the states of cause and effect,

original: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ba yang bden pa zhig na kho bo cag gis rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skyes phan chad khyad par cung zad kyang med mi srid
analyzed: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ba yang bden pa zhig na kho bo cag gis rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skyes phan chad khyad par cung zad kyang med mi srid
translated: Because it is not necessary, it is true that it does not arise as the entity of the cause alone. But we do assert that the effect arises as the entity of the cause. Therefore, once it has arisen as the entity of the effect, it is impossible that it not have the slightest difference.

original: pas / khyed kyi gtan tshigs ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste zhes bya ba de'i skyon de kho bo cag la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pas / khyed kyi gtan tshigs ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste zhes bya ba de'i skyon de kho bo cag la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not necessary for you to state a reason, we do not have the fault that you attribute to us, namely, that it does not arise as the entity of the cause alone.

original: de skad ces zer ba de la yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir khyad par med pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med par bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de la yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir khyad par med pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med par bstan pa'i phyir
translated: If you say that the effect is the cause that has not yet relinquished the entity of the cause, then since it is merely a different name, there is no difference. To demonstrate that the fault stated above cannot be averted, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you say that the result is the identity of the cause, without relinquishing the identity of the cause, then the mere name is different, but the previously stated fault cannot be averted.

original: gal te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las ma nyams pa kho nar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'dod na de lta na 'bras bu zhes ming du btags pa'i ming tsam tha dad par zad kyi rgyu'i bdag nyid las gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par ci yang medüîΩpa'i phyir sngar kho bos rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las ma nyams pa kho nar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'dod na de lta na 'bras bu zhes ming du btags pa'i ming tsam tha dad par zad kyi rgyu'i bdag nyid las gzhan du gyur pa'i khyad par ci yang med pa'i phyir sngar kho bos rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
translated: If you assert that the result arises with the identity of the cause without relinquishing the identity of the cause, then the mere name designated as the result is different, but there is no difference at all from the identity of the cause.üîΩTherefore, the previously stated fault cannot be averted: ‚ÄúThat which exists as the identity of the cause does not arise as the identity of the cause.

original: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
analyzed: ci yang mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //
translated: Because it is pointless.‚Äù

original: da ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the second conception is untenable,

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de legs par ma brtags par
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de legs par ma brtags par
translated: If you imagine that the cause definitely endures in the nature of the effect after completely abandoning its own nature, then since that which completely abandons its own nature as a cause is not a cause, you have not analyzed well

original: smras pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: smras pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and have spoken rashly.

original: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir khyed cag na re rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so
analyzed: gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir khyed cag na re rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so
translated: If you imagine that the cause definitely endures in the nature of the effect after completely abandoning its own nature as a cause, then since that which completely abandons its own nature as a cause is not a cause, you have not analyzed wellüîΩand have spoken rashly when you say, ‚ÄúThe cause itself endures in the nature of the effect after ceasing.‚Äù

original: zhes zer ba de legs par ma brtags par smras pa yin pas de'i phyir rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas so zhes brjod par mi bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu drug pa /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de legs par ma brtags par smras pa yin pas de'i phyir rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur zhing gnas so zhes brjod par mi bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu drug pa /
translated: Therefore you should not say, ‚ÄúThe cause itself endures in the nature of the effect after transforming.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa nyid skyed par byed dam /üîΩgnas pas skyed par byed pa rtog grong na gnyi ga ltar yang @131a * //üîΩrigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa rgyus skyed par smra ba dag / rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par byed dam rgyu ma 'gags pa gnas pas
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa nyid skyed par byed dam / gnas pas skyed par byed pa rtog grong na gnyi ga ltar yang @131a * // rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa rgyus skyed par smra ba dag / rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par byed dam rgyu ma 'gags pa gnas pas
translated: Or do they give rise to the effect that exists earlier through the cause abiding?üîΩBoth are illogical.üîΩSƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the cause exists earlier in the manner of the potency of the effect and that the cause gives rise to the effect.

original: 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog grang na /
translated: Do they imagine that the effect that exists earlier is given rise to by the cessation of the cause or that the effect that exists earlier is given rise to by the cause abiding without ceasing?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes brtag pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te zhes brtag pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Both are illogical.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa snga ma mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that the former conception is illogical, it is said:

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩ'gag pa nub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'gag pa nub par gyur pa yis //
translated: How?üîΩHow could the effect that has arisen

original: 'bras bu skyed pa ji ltar skyed //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa ji ltar skyed //üîΩces bya ba smras te /
translated: be given rise to by the cause that has ceased and disappeared?

original: rgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skye ba snga na yod pa ji ltar skyed de skyed par mi byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: rgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skye ba snga na yod pa ji ltar skyed de skyed par mi byed do zhes ston to //
translated: It does not generate it.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩrgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir des 'bras bu skyed par mi nus la /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir / 'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te / rgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir des 'bras bu skyed par mi nus la /
translated: To explain that in detail,üîΩthe meaning of the words ‚ÄúThe cause that has ceased does not generate the effect that has arisen‚Äù is that since it is illogical for the cause that has ceased and devolved to be a cause, it cannot generate an effect.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa snga na yod pa yang skyes zin pa'i phyir yang bskyed mi dgos pas rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa snga na yod pa yang skyes zin pa'i phyir yang bskyed mi dgos pas rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: And since the effect that has arisen already exists, it does not need to be generated again.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag las yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag dbu ma pas 'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang skyes pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag las yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba dag dbu ma pas 'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang skyes pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu
translated: ‚ÄúSome Samkhyas say‚Äù indicates that the Samkhyas who propound transformation respond to the Madhyamaka refutation that it is illogical for cessation to be the cause and that it is not necessary to generate what has already arisen.

original: skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig ston to //
analyzed: skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i lan 'debs pa'i tshig ston to //
translated: The response is that the effect does not arise from the cessation of the cause.

original: de la rdzas nges par gnas pa'i chos gzhan ldog pa na chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu 'gags nas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas 'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du
analyzed: de la rdzas nges par gnas pa'i chos gzhan ldog pa na chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu 'gags nas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas 'gag pa ni rgyu nyid du
translated: In that regard, when a different attribute of a substance that definitely endures is stopped, a different attribute arises. Since that is transformation, therefore the effect does not arise from the cessation of the cause.

original: mi rigs pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i lan 'debs te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bshad pa'i lan 'debs te /
translated: This indicates that the response to the Madhyamaka refutation that it is illogical for cessation to be the cause and that the effect that has arisen does not need to be generated again is that the effect does not arise from the cessation of the cause.

original: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las dper na gser gyi rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs pa chos gzhan skye ba ni rang bzhin ni rtag
analyzed: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las dper na gser gyi rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs pa chos gzhan skye ba ni rang bzhin ni rtag
translated: They say, ‚ÄúIn our scriptures it says, for example, that when the nature of a substance of gold, which definitely remains, changes from being an ornament such as a bracelet or an armlet, then another phenomenon, such as an earring or a golden chain, arises.üîΩThe nature of the gold is permanent, but the state of the gold changes.

original: la gnas skabs ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos @131b 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i chos gzhan skye ba
analyzed: la gnas skabs ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos @131b 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i chos gzhan skye ba
translated: In the same way, when the nature of the cause, which definitely remains, changes from not appearing as the essence of the effect to the effect arising as another phenomenon that exists previously in the manner of potential, the state of the cause changes.

original: yang rang bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
analyzed: yang rang bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the cause definitely remains,

original: gnas skabs ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul du yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags shing nub par gyur bas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul du yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags shing nub par gyur bas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: but the state of the cause changes in the manner of appearing and not appearing. Therefore the cause does not produce the effect that has arisen by ceasing and disappearing in every respect.

original: rgyu'i rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos snang ba dang mi snang ba dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos snang ba dang mi snang ba dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the substantial cause definitely remains in its nature, it produces the phenomena of the effect, whether they appear or not.üîΩSince the effect exists in the manner of potency, it is not the case that the nonarisen special manifestation does not need to be generated.

original: nus pa'i tshul du yod pa'i phyir gsal ba khyad par can ma skyes pa bskyed par bya mi dgos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar dbu ma skyes pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byedüîΩdo zhes bstan pa'i lan 'debs te /
analyzed: nus pa'i tshul du yod pa'i phyir gsal ba khyad par can ma skyes pa bskyed par bya mi dgos pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar dbu ma skyes pa yang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan pa'i lan 'debs te /
translated: This is the response to the objection that since the cause ceases, the effect that has arisen is not generated by the cause,üîΩbecause the effect that has arisen does not need to be generated again.üîΩThey say that because the effect exists prior to the cause in the manner of potency, the nonarisen special manifestation does not need to be generated.

original: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i phyir gsal ba khyad par can du ma skyes pas 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod cing skyes pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid du med cing
analyzed: de dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las rgyu la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i phyir gsal ba khyad par can du ma skyes pas 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod cing skyes pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid du med cing
translated: The effect exists prior to the cause in the manner of potency, but it does not exist in the nature of the manifest that has arisen.

original: ma skyes pa bskyed par bya dgos pas 'bras bu skyes pa yang bskyed par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa bskyed par bya dgos pas 'bras bu skyes pa yang bskyed par bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is necessary to generate that which has not arisen, that which has arisen does not need to be generated again.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: de lta na yang rdzas nges par gnas pa yang chos gzhan ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rdzas nges par gnas pa yang chos gzhan ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, a substance that definitely endures would cease when another attribute ceases,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not different from that.

original: dper na chos gzhan ldog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dper na chos gzhan ldog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the cessation of another attribute.

original: des ni grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu dang gser gyi rang bzhin du nges par gnas la 'bras bu dang gdu bu la sogs pa'i chos ni snang ba mi snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: des ni grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu dang gser gyi rang bzhin du nges par gnas la 'bras bu dang gdu bu la sogs pa'i chos ni snang ba mi snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: In that way, if, according to the scriptures of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, the cause definitely endures with the nature of gold and the attribute of the result, such as a bracelet, appears and disappears,

original: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu ldog cing mi snang ba'i dus na rgyu yang ldog cing mi snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar ston te /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu ldog cing mi snang ba'i dus na rgyu yang ldog cing mi snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar ston te /
translated: then it demonstrates the error that the cause would cease and disappear when the result ceases and disappears, because the cause and result would have the same nature.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, a bracelet and so on and the manifestation of the effect are not different from their own nature, and therefore when their own nature ceases, they cease.

original: dper na gdu bu la sogs pa dang / 'bras bu gsal ba ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gser dang rgyu nges par gnas pa dag kyang gdu bu la sogs pa dang 'bras bu gsal ba dag las gzhan ma
analyzed: dper na gdu bu la sogs pa dang / 'bras bu gsal ba ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gser dang rgyu nges par gnas pa dag kyang gdu bu la sogs pa dang 'bras bu gsal ba dag las gzhan ma
translated: Likewise, the gold and the definite abiding cause are not different from the bracelet and so on and the manifestation of the effect,

original: yin pa'i phyir gdu bu la sogs pa dang 'bras bu gsal ba'i chos gzhan @132a * //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir gdu bu la sogs pa dang 'bras bu gsal ba'i chos gzhan @132a * //
translated: and therefore when the bracelet and so on and the manifestation of the effect cease, they would also cease.

original: ldog pa'i dus na ldog pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas pha rol po'i sgrub pa de ni tha snyad du yang 'gal bar snang bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ldog pa'i dus na ldog pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas pha rol po'i sgrub pa de ni tha snyad du yang 'gal bar snang bas mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, because the opponent‚Äôs proof appears to be contradictory even conventionally, it is not correct.

original: de bzhin du chos can yang chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos can yang chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: Likewise, the subject must also be asserted to arise when the other phenomenon arises.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na chos gzhan skyes pa bzhin pas tha snyad du yang sgrub pa de ni 'gal bar snang ngo zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu dang gser gyi rang bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na chos gzhan skyes pa bzhin pas tha snyad du yang sgrub pa de ni 'gal bar snang ngo zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu dang gser gyi rang bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
translated: In accordance with the texts of the Samkhyas, the nature of the cause, gold, definitely remains,

original: 'bras bu dang gdu bu la sogs pa'i chos ni snang ba dang mi snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang gdu bu la sogs pa'i chos ni snang ba dang mi snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: but the phenomena of the result, the bracelet, and so on, appear and disappear.

original: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye zhing snang ba'i dus na rgyu yang skye zhing snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar ston te /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye zhing snang ba'i dus na rgyu yang skye zhing snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur bar ston te /
translated: In that case, because the cause and the result would have the same nature, it would be erroneous to say that when the result arises and appears, the cause also arises and appears.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example, and the conclusion, which should be applied in order.

original: dper na rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos can gser dang / rgyu nges par gnas pa dag kyang rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du chos can gser dang / rgyu nges par gnas pa dag kyang rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because the earrings and so on and the potential of the result are not different from their own nature, they would arise when their own nature arises.üîΩIn the same way, because the subject, gold, and the cause, which definitely endures, are not different from the earrings and so on and the potential of the result, the error arises that they arise when the other phenomena, the earrings and so on and the potential of the result, arise.

original: rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa'i chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas pha rol po'i sgrub pa de yang tha snyad du yang 'gal bar snang bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rna cha la sogs pa dang 'bras bu nus pa'i chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas pha rol po'i sgrub pa de yang tha snyad du yang 'gal bar snang bas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because the opponent‚Äôs proof appears to be contradictory even conventionally, it is not suitable.

original: don dam par ni ji ltar rdzas nges par gnas pa de ni chos gzhan snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ji ltar rdzas nges par gnas pa de ni chos gzhan snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, how could a substance that definitely endures be a different phenomenon that is a transformation characterized by the appearance and disappearance of another phenomenon?

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag na re gser rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni sngar grangs can dag na re gser rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say: Just as gold is a substance whose nature definitely endures, when the attributes of bracelets, armlets,

original: la sogs pa gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs ba chos gzhan skye ba ni rang bzhin ni rtags la /
analyzed: la sogs pa gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs ba chos gzhan skye ba ni rang bzhin ni rtags la /
translated: and so on are destroyed, other attributes such as earrings and golden chains arise.üîΩThe nature definitely endures, but the state is completely transformed.

original: gnas skabs ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i chos gzhan skye ba yang rang
analyzed: gnas skabs ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i chos gzhan skye ba yang rang
translated: In the same way, the nature of the cause definitely endures, but when the attributes of the effect that do not appear as the essence of clarity are destroyed, other attributes that exist earlier in the manner of potential arise.

original: bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
analyzed: bzhin ni nges par gnas la /
translated: The nature definitely endures,üîΩbut the state is completely transformed.

original: gnas skabs ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul du yongs @132b su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags shing nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs ni snang ba dang mi snang ba'i tshul du yongs @132b su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags shing nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Since the state of the cause is completely transformed into the state of the effect, the cause is not the producer of the arisen effect, since the cause has completely ceased and disappeared.

original: rgyu'i rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos snang ba dang mi snang ba dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: rgyu'i rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pas 'bras bu'i chos snang ba dang mi snang ba dag skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de la /
translated: However, the substantial cause, which definitely endures with its own nature, produces the phenomena of the effect, both the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: don dam par dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Since an example such as ‚Äúit is like such and such‚Äù does not exist in any way, this is also illogical.

original: yang gzhan yang chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las gser gyi rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa
analyzed: yang gzhan yang chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes bya bas ni grangs can dag gi gzhung las gser gyi rdzas rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa
translated: Moreover, is the cessation of another phenomenon the nature of the cause or is it not the nature of the cause?

original: gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs pa chos gzhan skye ba bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'iüîΩchos gzhan skye'o zhes zer ba'i chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan ldog pa na rna cha dang gdub kor la sogs pa chos gzhan skye ba bzhin du rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa'i chos 'bras bu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi snang ba gzhan ldog pa na 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du snga na yod pa'i chos gzhan skye'o zhes zer ba'i chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: When the other ceases, just as the arising of other phenomena such as earrings and bracelets occurs, the nature of the cause that definitely endures does not appear as the nature of the clearly manifest effect. When the other ceases, the effect arises as a different phenomenon that exists previously in the manner of potential.üîΩThe question is asked: Is the other phenomenon that ceases the nature of the cause of the arising of the other phenomenon?

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes dri ba gnyis ston to //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin zhes dri ba gnyis ston to //
translated: Or is it not the nature of the cause?

original: de la dri ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dri ba dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first question,üîΩit says:

original: de la gal te de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na ni de 'gag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gal te de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na ni de 'gag pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is the nature of the cause, then because it ceases,

original: rgyu 'gag pa yin pas /üîΩ'gag ba nub par 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: rgyu 'gag pa yin pas / 'gag ba nub par 'gyur ba yi //
translated: the cause ceases.üîΩHow could the arisen effect

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //
translated: be produced by the ceased cause?

original: rgyu 'gag pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na 'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyu 'gag pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na 'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that when the cause ceases, it has no power to generate the effect that has already arisen.

original: chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na de ldog pa ni 'gag pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag pa yin pas rgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur bas 'bras bu skyes pa snga na yod pa ji ltar skyed de /
analyzed: chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na de ldog pa ni 'gag pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag pa yin pas rgyu 'gag pa nub par gyur bas 'bras bu skyes pa snga na yod pa ji ltar skyed de /
translated: If the cessation of one phenomenon is the nature of the cause of the arising of another phenomenon, then since that cessation is the cause that ceases, how could the effect that has already arisen be generated by the cause that has ceased and disappeared?

original: rgyu 'gag pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'gag pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that when the cause ceases, it has no power to generate the effect that has already arisen.

original: dri ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ba gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present the second question, he says,

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if it is not the nature of the cause, then in that case, since the cause definitely endures, it is logical that the effect would appear.

original: 'on te chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gzhan zhig ldog par zad kyi rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu dus thams cad du snang ba'i skyonüîΩdu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de chos gzhan skye ba'i rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gzhan zhig ldog par zad kyi rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu dus thams cad du snang ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the cessation of one phenomenon is not the cause of the arising of another phenomenon, then in that case, the cessation of something that is not a cause would be exhausted, but the cause would definitely remain, and the error of the effect appearing at all times would ensue.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni grangs can dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa snga ma mi rigs par bstan to //üîΩde ni grangs @133a * //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni grangs can dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa snga ma mi rigs par bstan to // de ni grangs @133a * //
translated: Thus, these arguments demonstrate that the first hypothesis of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, that the effect that is said to preexist in the cause is generated, is illogical.

original: can dag rgyu ma 'gags pa gnas pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: can dag rgyu ma 'gags pa gnas pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the second hypothesis of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, that the effect that preexists in the cause is generated by the cause that remains without ceasing, will be shown to be untenable.

original: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir de mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du rtag tu snga na yod par 'dod
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir de mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du rtag tu snga na yod par 'dod
translated: If you say that this is not a fault because you assert that,

original: pa'i phyir de mi gnod do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir de mi gnod do zhes zer na'o //
translated: if the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say, ‚ÄúBecause we assert that the nature of the cause always exists prior to the effect in the manner of a potency, this is not a fault,‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in response to that, the author of the commentary explains:

original: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
translated: How could a cause related to an effect

original: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
translated: that endures give rise to it?

original: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not different from itself, like the nature of the cause itself.

original: des ni yang 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul ni rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni phyi ba yin na grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du rtag tu snga na yod pa yin na
analyzed: des ni yang 'jig rten na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul ni rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni phyi ba yin na grangs can dag gi gzhung ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin nges par gnas pa la 'bras bu nus pa'i tshul du rtag tu snga na yod pa yin na
translated: But according to the Samkhya system, the nature of the cause definitely endures, and the effect is always present in the cause in a potential form.

original: 'bras bu de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des kyang 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed par ston te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang 'brel pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des kyang 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed par ston te /
translated: The cause related to that effect is not different from the nature of the effect itself, and therefore it does not produce the effect that has already arisen.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des rang gi bdag nyid mi skyed pa de bzhin du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rgyu gnas pa yang 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des rang gi bdag nyid mi skyed pa de bzhin du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rgyu gnas pa yang 'bras bu'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des
translated: For example, because the nature of a cause is not different from itself, it does not generate itself.

original: kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, because the cause that is related to the effect is not different from the nature of the effect, it does not generate the effect.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another reason for that,üîΩif you say, ‚ÄúThe cause definitely endures and generates its effect,‚Äù then the statement that the cause and effect are simultaneous is inferred.

original: de lta bas na rgyu nges par gnas bas de nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu nges par gnas bas de nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de
translated: Since the cause does not generate the effect,

original: skyed pa nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir de rgyu nyid yin pa gsal bas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyed pa nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir de rgyu nyid yin pa gsal bas pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa la chos can rgyu'i ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is clearly the producer, it is clearly the cause. Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs thesis has the fault of contradicting the nature of a cause.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu ma yin par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu ma yin par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is clearly not the cause, since it is inferred to be simultaneous.üîΩ‚Äú Connection‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúcollection.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma las /
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma las /
translated: The previous verse

original: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
translated: states, ‚ÄúThe cause is connected with the effect.‚Äù

original: zhes smos pa'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bshad pa de /
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bshad pa de /
translated: The term ‚Äúconnection‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: 'brel @133b pa dang tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang dus gcig pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'brel @133b pa dang tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang dus gcig pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚Äú Connection,‚Äù ‚Äúcollection,‚Äù ‚Äúpossession,‚Äù and ‚Äúsimultaneity‚Äù are synonyms.

original: de ltar re zhig de dag gis ni grangs can dag rgyu ma 'gags par gnas pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig de dag gis ni grangs can dag rgyu ma 'gags par gnas pas 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid skyed par rtog pa'i brtag pa gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, for the time being, this shows that the second conception, that the effect exists prior to the cause, is untenable, since the cause endures without cessation.

original: da ni mdo sde pa dag rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel bas 'bras bu skyed par rtog pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mdo sde pa dag rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel bas 'bras bu skyed par rtog pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the SautrƒÅntika assertion that the cause generates the effect without being related to it is untenable, the root text states:

original: gang dag / ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
analyzed: gang dag / ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
translated: If the cause is not related to the effect,üîΩwhat effect does the cause generate?

original: rgyu de 'bras bu dang ma 'brel par smra ba de dag gi yang 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed /
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu dang ma 'brel par smra ba de dag gi yang 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed /
translated: The intended meaning of this statement is that if the cause is asserted to be unrelated to the effect, then what effect does the cause generate?

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The cause does not generate an effect because it is empty of an effect, just like something that is other than that cause.

original: des ni mdo sde pa dag rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pas 'bras bu skyed par smra ba dag gi gzhung bkag pa ston te /
analyzed: des ni mdo sde pa dag rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pas 'bras bu skyed par smra ba dag gi gzhung bkag pa ston te /
translated: This demonstrates that the root text refutes the SautrƒÅntika assertion that the cause generates the effect without being related to it.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na rigs mthun pa de las gzhan pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pa ni 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pa yang
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na rigs mthun pa de las gzhan pa'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pa ni 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ma 'brel pa yang
translated: Moreover, they are respectively applied as the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, a cause of a different type, which is not related to an effect of a similar type, does not generate an effect of a different type, because it is empty of an effect.

original: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //üîΩde ltar re zhig 'bras bu spyir dgag pa byas so zhes bya ba ni skabs gong ma dag gi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do // de ltar re zhig 'bras bu spyir dgag pa byas so zhes bya ba ni skabs gong ma dag gi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, a cause of a similar type, which is not related to an effect, does not generate an effect of a similar type, because it is empty of an effect.üîΩThus, an effect is generally refuted in this way. This is a summary of the previous sections.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni phyi nang gi 'bras bu spyir yang dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni phyi nang gi 'bras bu spyir yang dgag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this way, effects are generally refuted in terms of internal and external causes.

original: da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par dag gsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu skye mched rnams kyis 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par mi byed par ston to //
analyzed: da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par dag gsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyu skye mched rnams kyis 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par mi byed par ston to //
translated: Now, in order to clarify the specific effects of visual consciousness, etc., he says, ‚ÄúThis should be taught, etc.‚Äù He shows that the causal sense-spheres do not generate the resultant consciousnesses.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin na des gzugs mthong nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / 'di la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin na des gzugs mthong nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed dam /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúHere, if the eye faculty is the cause of visual consciousness, does it generate visual consciousness after seeing form?

original: ma mthong bas skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: ma mthong bas skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Or does it generate visual consciousness without seeing?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid de zhes brtag pa gnyis smras so //üîΩkha cig na re mthong na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong na yang rkyen med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid de zhes brtag pa gnyis smras so // kha cig na re mthong na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong na yang rkyen med pa'i phyir //
translated: Both are impossible.‚Äù Thus he states two alternatives.

original: rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
analyzed: rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
translated: Some say that if it sees, then it is meaningless to generate visual consciousness, and if it does not see, then there is no condition.

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: The cause does not generate the effectüîΩwhether it sees or does not see.

original: zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa'i gzhung yin te /üîΩdes ni dbang pos yul @134a * //üîΩmthong nas sam /
analyzed: zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa'i gzhung yin te / des ni dbang pos yul @134a * // mthong nas sam /
translated: This is the text explained by the commentator himself.

original: ma mthong bar yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma mthong bar yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: It demonstrates that the sense faculty does not generate the effect, consciousness, having seen or not seen the object.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong nas zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong nas zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Others say: Seeing means meeting.

original: 'di ltar yod na phrad par 'gyur bas yod pa la skye bas ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod na phrad par 'gyur bas yod pa la skye bas ci bya /
translated: Since it would meet if it existed, what use is there for it to be generated?üîΩSince meeting is impossible if it does not exist, what is generated if it does not exist?

original: med pa la yang phrad pa mi srid pas med pa la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta la sogs pa 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag gis bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: med pa la yang phrad pa mi srid pas med pa la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta la sogs pa 'grel pa byed pa gzhan dag gis bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of other commentators such as the elder Buddhapalita.

original: de dag gis ni dbang po dang rnam par shes pa phrad nas sam ma phrad par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dbang po dang rnam par shes pa phrad nas sam ma phrad par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: They explain that the sense faculty does not generate the effect, consciousness, having met or not met the object.

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: If it is not different, then the author of the commentary himself says, ‚ÄúThat is not logical.‚Äù

original: gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a statement refuting the explanation of the elder Buddhapalita as illogical.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not logical?üîΩPreviously it was taught:

original: sngar / 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: sngar / 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
translated: If a cause related to an effect

original: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
translated: were to generate it, how could it generate it?

original: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
analyzed: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
translated: If it were not related to an effect,

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
translated: what effect would it generate?

original: ces bstan pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
