analyzed: ces bstan pa dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: And:

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it were to arise from the mere assemblyüîΩof causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: if the effect existed in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //üîΩgal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi ;
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi ;
translated: how could it arise from the assembly?üîΩIf it were to arise from the mere assembly

original: / tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: / tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: if the effect did not exist in the assembly,üîΩhow could it arise from the assembly?

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: Just as you say, ‚ÄúIt arises from the assemblage itself.‚Äù

original: zhes bstan pa dag dang yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa dag dang yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus, there is no difference between your position and the position that has been taught.üîΩIn the same way, you should say that the ear and so on, as causes, do not produce the effects, the ear consciousness and so on.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rgyu dag gi rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa nyid du yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dbang po lhag ma rnams kyis kyang yul rnams dmigs nas sam ma
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rgyu dag gi rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa nyid du yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni dbang po lhag ma rnams kyis kyang yul rnams dmigs nas sam ma
translated: Thus, the remaining faculties also do not apprehend objects or

original: dmigs par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: not apprehend objects and produce the effects, the consciousnesses.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de //
analyzed: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de //
translated: Ultimately, a cause does not produce an effect

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of an effect.

original: 'di na gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not produce something is not its cause.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu bzhin pas de lta na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'bras bu skyed par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu bzhin pas de lta na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub po zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis 'bras bu skyed par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the opponent who proves that the effect is generated by the reason of being the cause of the effect.

original: @134b de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: @134b de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason that proves, the example of the dissimilar class, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary himself says:

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here it is said...

original: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na phrad nas skyed par 'gyur grang na 'bras bu dang rgyu dag phrad pa ni mu rnam pa dgu'i tshul gyis ji ltar yang mi 'thad par ston te /
analyzed: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na phrad nas skyed par 'gyur grang na 'bras bu dang rgyu dag phrad pa ni mu rnam pa dgu'i tshul gyis ji ltar yang mi 'thad par ston te /
translated: If the cause were to generate the effect, it would generate it either having contacted it or without having contacted it. The contact of the effect and cause is not tenable in any of the nine ways.

original: de la / 'bras bu 'das pa rgyu 'das dang // ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: de la / 'bras bu 'das pa rgyu 'das dang // ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The unborn and the born,

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Never meet.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu dang po gsum yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu dang po gsum yin no //
translated: This is the first three alternatives.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very distinction,üîΩThe past effect and the past cause,

original: 'bras bu 'das pa ni rgyu 'das pa dang / ma skyes pa dang lhan cig phrad par gyur pa nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa ni rgyu 'das pa dang / ma skyes pa dang lhan cig phrad par gyur pa nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The unborn and the born, never meet.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that this is because both the effect and the cause do not exist.

original: 'bras bu 'das pa dang rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa dang rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The past effect and the born cause also never meet.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩ'bras bu ma skyes rgyu ma skyes //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so // 'bras bu ma skyes rgyu ma skyes //
translated: It is said that this is because the effect does not exist.üîΩThe unborn effect and the unborn cause,

original: 'das pa dang ni skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The past and the born,

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Never meet.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu bar ma gsum yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu bar ma gsum yin no //
translated: These are the three middle alternatives.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain this in detail,üîΩan unarisen effect never makes contact with an unarisen cause,

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: with a past cause, or with a simultaneous cause,

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in both cases, neither the effect nor the cause would exist.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An unarisen effect never makes contact with an arisen cause,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩ'bras bu skyes pa rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so // 'bras bu skyes pa rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: because the effect would not exist.üîΩAn arisen effect never makes contact with an arisen cause,

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: with an unarisen cause, or with a past cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu tha ma gsum yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu tha ma gsum yin no //
translated: These are the last three alternatives.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain this in detail,

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with a arisen cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been refuted that cause and effect occur at the same time.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa dang rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa dang rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with a cause that has not arisen or that is past,

original: rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @135a * //
analyzed: rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @135a * //
translated: because neither cause exists.

original: smras so ; / de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: smras so ; / de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, when analyzed in this way, cause and effect never make contact in any way. Therefore,

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: if they do not make contact,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed /
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed /
translated: how could a cause generate an effect?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te skyed par mi byed do /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te skyed par mi byed do /
translated: It could not generate it.

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon no zhes bya ba ni phrad pa yod pa ma yin pas skyed par mi byed pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon no zhes bya ba ni phrad pa yod pa ma yin pas skyed par mi byed pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúbecause contact does not exist‚Äù is the probandum, and the meaning of the statement ‚Äúis evident‚Äù is the probative sign.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause contact does not exist‚Äù is the summary of the statement ‚Äúbecause it does not produce.‚Äù

original: skyed par mi byed pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i tshig gi don sngon la phrad pa yod pa ma yin pas ni sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon par ston to //
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i tshig gi don sngon la phrad pa yod pa ma yin pas ni sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon par ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it does not produce‚Äù indicates the meaning of the probandum, and the phrase ‚Äúbecause contact does not exist‚Äù indicates the meaning of the probative sign.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference,

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do /
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúHere the inference is: ultimately, a cause does not produce an effect

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because contact does not exist, just like a seed on the ground and a seed on a mountain peak.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon ni ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir des de skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu yang 'bras bu dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyus 'bras
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon ni ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir des de skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rgyu yang 'bras bu dang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyus 'bras
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, a seed on the ground does not produce a sprout that is in contact with it, because a seed on the ground is not in contact with a seed on a mountain peak.

original: bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, a cause does not produce a result that is in contact with it, because a cause is not in contact with a result.üîΩThose who say that a cause and result are in contact because they are not dissimilar are also refuted by this argument.

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par smra ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po gang dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la phrad par mi
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par smra ba de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po gang dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la phrad par mi
translated: If an opponent says, ‚ÄúWe do not say that a cause and result that are related are in contact,

original: smra ste / dper na dbyug pa can dbyug pa dang 'brel pa rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: smra ste / dper na dbyug pa can dbyug pa dang 'brel pa rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, a man with a stick is not in contact with the stick that is related to him. A cause and result are not in contact.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa yin par smra ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa yin par smra ste /
translated: The non-concordant cause and effect is the meeting of cause and effect.

original: dper na nas kyi sa bon las kyang mi mthun pa med pa nas kyi myu gu nyid 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon las kyang mi mthun pa med pa nas kyi myu gu nyid 'byung la /
translated: For example, from a barley seed, a barley sprout arises, which is not discordant.üîΩFrom a rice seed, a rice sprout arises, which is not discordant.

original: 'bras kyi sa bon las kyang mi mthun pa med pa 'bras kyi myu gu nyid 'byung ba lta bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa yin par smra bas khyed dbu ma pas 'bras bu dang rgyu dag lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma
analyzed: 'bras kyi sa bon las kyang mi mthun pa med pa 'bras kyi myu gu nyid 'byung ba lta bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad pa yin par smra bas khyed dbu ma pas 'bras bu dang rgyu dag lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma
translated: Since you Proponents of Action assert that the meeting of cause and effect is the non-concordant cause and effect, you say, ‚ÄúThe cause and effect never meet.‚Äù

original: yin no zhes bshad pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin na de dag la yang 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin no zhes bshad pa de dag kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi gnod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin na de dag la yang 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This statement does not invalidate our position.

original: de'i phyir / rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas rgyu ma yin pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas rgyu ma yin pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if a cause generates an effect, it is a cause. Since that which does not generate an effect is not a cause, how could a noncause become a cause?

original: rgyus 'bras bu skyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang @135b med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba dag gis gal gnyis kyi rgyu nyid mi 'thad par bstan te /
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu skyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang @135b med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba dag gis gal gnyis kyi rgyu nyid mi 'thad par bstan te /
translated: Because there is nothing to be generated again by a cause that has already generated its effect, it is impossible for it to be a cause.

original: de dag gi don rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med du zin kyang gang gi tshe rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de'i tshe na rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas ji srid du 'bras bu ma skyed pa
analyzed: de dag gi don rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med du zin kyang gang gi tshe rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de'i tshe na rgyu yin gyi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas ji srid du 'bras bu ma skyed pa
translated: The meaning of those is as follows: Even though cause and effect are not different, when a cause generates an effect, at that time it is a cause. But if it does not generate an effect, it is not a cause.üîΩAs long as it does not generate an effect,üîΩat that time it is not a cause. Therefore, as long as it does not generate an effect, at that time it is not a cause.

original: de srid du 'bras bu dang rgyu lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa rgyu ma yin pa de rgyur mi 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu bskyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de srid du 'bras bu dang rgyu lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin pas rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa rgyu ma yin pa de rgyur mi 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu bskyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, as long as the effect and cause do not simultaneously make contact, the cause does not generate the effect.

original: byed do byas so byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa byed na yang zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa ni byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba yin pas 'dir 'bras
analyzed: byed do byas so byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa byed na yang zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re rgyu zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa ni byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba yin pas 'dir 'bras
translated: If you explain the word cause as the specific cause, then the word cause would be the specific cause, and in that case,

original: bu dang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba med du zin kyang 'jig rten na da ltar byed do sngon byas so phyis byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa mthong bas de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yang yod la /
analyzed: bu dang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba med du zin kyang 'jig rten na da ltar byed do sngon byas so phyis byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa mthong bas de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu yang yod la /
translated: even though the cause does not make contact with the effect, it is seen that in the world, people say, ‚ÄúI am doing it,‚Äù ‚ÄúI did it,‚Äù ‚ÄúI will do it,‚Äù and therefore that is the cause.

original: rgyu yod na des 'bras bu yang skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod na des 'bras bu yang skyed par byed do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: If the cause exists, then it produces the effect.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: tha snyad kyi bden par sgrub par zad kyi don dam par de dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden par sgrub par zad kyi don dam par de dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is merely established in conventional truth, but ultimately it is not able to demonstrate anything that accords with that.

original: de ltar byed do byas so byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa sgrub par zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar byed do byas so byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa ni tha snyad kyi bden pa sgrub par zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does so,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt did so,‚Äù ‚ÄúIt will so,‚Äù are merely conventional expressions that establish the truth of convention.

original: don dam par rgyu dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus pas des kyang rgyus 'bras bu skyes par sgrub mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam par rgyu dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus pas des kyang rgyus 'bras bu skyes par sgrub mi nus so //
translated: But ultimately, since it is not possible to teach anything that accords with a cause, it is not possible for a cause to establish the production of an effect.

original: ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du rtog na yang //
analyzed: ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du rtog na yang //
translated: But if you imagine that it is tenable,

original: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
translated: even though it is not tenable,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed //
translated: how could a cause give rise to an effect?üîΩEven if the effect exists, as before, its production would be pointless.

original: 'bras bu yod na yang snga ma bzhin du skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par rtog na de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na yang snga ma bzhin du skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par rtog na de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu
translated: But if you imagine that it is tenable, even though it is not tenable, that a cause and effect meet, then even in that case,

original: yod pa nyid na phrad pas rgyu yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu de ji ltar skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa nyid na phrad pas rgyu yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu de ji ltar skyed par 'gyur /
translated: how could a cause give rise to an effect that exists, since it is pointless for a cause to give rise to an effect that already exists?

original: 'bras bu yod pa de nyid la yang bskyed par bya ba'i don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa de nyid la yang bskyed par bya ba'i don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But if the effect already exists, then it would be pointless to generate it again, and that is also untenable.üîΩOr else, this is another path of refutation:

original: yang na 'di ni sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yin te zhes bya bas ni 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa 'am mi stong bas 'bras bu de skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yin te zhes bya bas ni 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa 'am mi stong bas 'bras bu de skyed par byed grang na /
translated: If a cause generates an effect, then is the effect generated by a cause that is empty of the effect‚Äôs intrinsic state or not empty of the effect‚Äôs intrinsic state?

original: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to //üîΩde la @136a * //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes ston to // de la @136a * //
translated: Both of these analyses are untenable.

original: brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the untenability of the first of these two analyses,

original: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de dag la //üîΩgal te 'bras bu stong pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de dag la // gal te 'bras bu stong pa'i rgyu //
translated: if in your philosophical system the cause is empty of the effect,üîΩthen how could an empty cause

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //üîΩces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed // ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: generate an effect?

original: des stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is empty of the effect.

original: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like something other than that.

original: des ni 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan te /
translated: This teaches another aspect of the refutation of the position of those who advocate that the effect is not present in the cause.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are to be applied in order to the subject, the property to be established, the proof, and the example.üîΩFor example, a cause of a different type that is empty of effect is not a producer of an effect that is empty of effect, because it is empty of that effect.

original: dper na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de las gzhan pa rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bus stong pa ni 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir 'brasüîΩbu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: dper na rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de las gzhan pa rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bus stong pa ni 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pa'i rgyu 'bras bu des stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: In the same way, a cause of a similar type is not a producer of an effect that is empty of that effect.

original: ci ste byed na ni bye mas kyang til mar dang chus kyang mar bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni bye mas kyang til mar dang chus kyang mar bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then sand would produce oil and water would produce butter.

original: yang na bye ma dang til dag la yang til mar med la /
analyzed: yang na bye ma dang til dag la yang til mar med la /
translated: Moreover, sand and sesame seeds do not have oil.

original: chu dang zho dag la yang mar med par 'dra na /üîΩtil nyid las til mar 'byung la /
analyzed: chu dang zho dag la yang mar med par 'dra na / til nyid las til mar 'byung la /
translated: If water and milk are similar in that they do not contain butter,üîΩthen why is it that butter is produced from sesame oil and not from sand,

original: bye ma dag las mi 'byung ba dang / zho nyid las mar 'byung la /
analyzed: bye ma dag las mi 'byung ba dang / zho nyid las mar 'byung la /
translated: and that butter is produced from milk and not from water?

original: chu las mi 'byung ba la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos te /
analyzed: chu las mi 'byung ba la khyad par ci yod pa brjod dgos te /
translated: You must explain the difference between these two cases.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable to state, ‚ÄúA cause that is empty of the effect itself produces the effect.‚Äù

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus mi stong de dag la yang /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus mi stong de dag la yang /
translated: To demonstrate the untenability of the second option,

original: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyu //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyu //
translated: if in your philosophical system cause is not empty of effect,üîΩthen why would the cause

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: produce the effect?

original: ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what you must explain.

original: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intended meaning is that because it is not empty of it, it is like the nature of the effect itself.

original: des ni 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i rnam pa gzhan bstan to //
translated: precedes its cause.üîΩThe subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, since the nature of the effect is not empty of itself, it does notüîΩgive rise to the effect. Similarly, since the cause, which is not empty of the

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'bras bu mi stong pa'i rgyu yang 'bras bu des mi stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du 'bras bu mi stong pa'i rgyu yang 'bras bu des mi stong pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: effect, is not empty of the effect, it does not give rise to the effect.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin la /
translated: When the effect exists, it is not empty by virtue of its own nature.

original: mi stong pa skyes zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de /
analyzed: mi stong pa skyes zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de /
translated: Since that which is not empty and has already arisen does not need to ariseüîΩagain, therefore it is not tenable to say that the cause, which is not empty of

original: de lta @136b bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta @136b bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: the nature of the effect, gives rise to the effect.

original: da ltar gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod de /
translated: Even prior to the arising of the present effect, the future effect exists in the future.üîΩThus, even prior to the arising of the effects, they exist without being empty of the effect itself. When they pass into the present, the causes give rise to them in their respective states.

original: de ltar 'bras bu rnams skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod pa de dag dus 'phos na rang rang gi gnas skabs su rgyus skyed par byed do zhes 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu rnams skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod pa de dag dus 'phos na rang rang gi gnas skabs su rgyus skyed par byed do zhes 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo
translated: In this way, the cause is said to exist inherently in virtue of the effect‚Äôs existing inherently.

original: nyid yod par smra bas 'dir de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid yod par smra bas 'dir de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to refute this,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: it would be erroneous to say that even prior to the arising of the effect, the effect exists without being empty of the effect itself, for then there would be no arising and no cessation.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la /
translated: This is not accepted, because the entity of the effect is characterized by arising and cessation and thus is essenceless.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: In this way, in virtue of the effect‚Äôs being essenceless, the cause is also essenceless.

original: don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bstan par ste zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bstan par ste zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: The ultimate does not generate the effect‚Äù is the other path that is taught.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: The non-empty effect does not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /üîΩdes ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par gyur na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang 'gag pa med pa'i
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smras te / des ni bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par gyur na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang 'gag pa med pa'i
translated: The non-empty does not cease.üîΩThis demonstrates that, as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert, if the effect existed prior to its arising, it would not be empty of the effect‚Äôs own state. Whatever exists is not a phenomenon that arises and is not a phenomenon that ceases.

original: chos can yin pas 'bras bu mi stong par yod pa de yang skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ltar ni mi 'dod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos can yin pas 'bras bu mi stong par yod pa de yang skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de ltar ni mi 'dod do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the error of the non-empty effect not arising and not ceasing would ensue.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that very point, the Subcommentary states:

original: 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur @137a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur @137a * //
translated: Since the effect is not dependently arisen, it would be pointless for it to arise again since it already exists by way of its own intrinsic reality.

original: ro ; / ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ro ; / ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that which has not arisen is devoid of intrinsic reality, it would not cease.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par gyur na de ni 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par gyur na de ni 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If the effect were not empty of the effect prior to its arising, as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert, it would not be dependently arisen.

original: de ltar 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa la ni yang skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa la ni yang skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the effect is not dependently arisen, it would be pointless for it to arise again since it already exists by way of its own intrinsic reality.

original: skyes na 'gag par 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur bas ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: skyes na 'gag par 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur bas ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: If it were to arise, it would cease. But that which has not arisen does not cease. Therefore, that which has not arisen is not subject to transformation.

original: de'i phyir 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not cease.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: But even so,

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: That which is not empty would be Unceased and unarisen.

original: zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid kyis mi stong par btags pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid kyis mi stong par btags pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa'i skyon du yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas impute that the future effect is not empty because it exists, but that would entail the error of its being unceased and unarisen.

original: de lta mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta mi 'dod de /
translated: But we do not accept that.

original: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan te /
translated: The statement The effect is asserted to be subject to arising and cessation indicates the meaning of the context by refuting the statement that provides an opportunity for such an interpretation.

original: 'bras bu ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that the effect is not subject to arising and cessation.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod la ;
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod la ;
translated: They assert that the effect has the attribute of being produced and ceasing,

original: 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i sgo de nas rgyu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i sgo de nas rgyu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do zhes bstan to //
translated: and from that door, they assert that the cause also has the attribute of being produced and ceasing.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid mi stong pa yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid mi stong pa yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de
translated: To demonstrate the reductio that if the effect is not empty of intrinsic reality, it would follow that it would not arise and not cease, as the Vaibhasikas assert, he says, Therefore, whatever exists

original: ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste /
translated: is seen to be a phenomenon that does not arise and does not cease.

original: yod pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it exists, for example, like the present moment.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the proof and the example are applied in order, respectively.

original: dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma ni yod pa'i phyir de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par mthong ba de bzhin du bye brag tu smra ba dag gis btags pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa de yang yod pa yin na yod pa'i phyir de la
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi skad cig ma ni yod pa'i phyir de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par mthong ba de bzhin du bye brag tu smra ba dag gis btags pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa de yang yod pa yin na yod pa'i phyir de la
translated: so too, if that future effect imputed by Vaibhasikas exists, it would have no arising or cessation because it exists.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur bas des ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur bas des ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable to them.üîΩTo demonstrate that there is another fault in the assertion of Vaibhasikas,

original: bye @137b brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye @137b brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the treatise states:

original: de ltar 'bras bu yod pa nyid dang rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa la mi
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu yod pa nyid dang rjes su dpog pas yod pa nyid la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba dag gi dam bcas pa la mi
translated: Thus, since an existent effect and that which exists by being inferred have no arising and no cessation, arising and cessation are refuted.

original: stong bar sgrub pa'i chos can 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: stong bar sgrub pa'i chos can 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To refute that, the fault of establishing a subject that is not empty, the nature of the effect, is stated.

original: de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the present context is taught by the opposite of the words that leave an opening for dispute.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas impute the substantial existence of things that are causes and effects in the three times. They assert that the effect that exists in the present from a past cause and the effect that exists in the future from a present cause exist without being empty of the nature of the effect.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis dus gsum gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rdzas su yod par btags pa dag las rgyu 'das pa'i 'bras bu da ltar yod pa dang / rgyu da ltar yod pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par 'dod pa de dag la ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis dus gsum gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rdzas su yod par btags pa dag las rgyu 'das pa'i 'bras bu da ltar yod pa dang / rgyu da ltar yod pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par yod par 'dod pa de dag la ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: They have the fault that arising and ceasing would not exist.

original: 'bras bu dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la ;
analyzed: 'bras bu dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med la ;
translated: That is unacceptable because effects are things that have the property of arising and ceasing and therefore are essenceless.

original: de ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu da ltar yod pa dang / 'bras bu da ltar yod pa'i rgyu 'das pa'i dus na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par yod par 'dod pa de dag la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /üîΩrgyu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu da ltar yod pa dang / 'bras bu da ltar yod pa'i rgyu 'das pa'i dus na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong par yod par 'dod pa de dag la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de / rgyu'i dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir don dam par rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, those who assert that the effect exists in the present as the cause of the future, and that the cause of the effect, in the past, exists without being empty of the entity of the cause, would also incur the error that there would be no arising and no cessation.üîΩTherefore, since the entity of the cause is characterized by arising and cessation, it is essenceless. Therefore, ultimately, the cause does not give rise to the effect.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The LokƒÅyata maintain that since the effect is not an existent entity prior to its arising, the entity of the effect is empty.

original: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' las snga na med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pas dngos po thams cad stong par 'dod pas 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid ni snga na med pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes zer bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten rgyang pa na bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' las snga na med pa dang / gcig la gcig med pas dngos po thams cad stong par 'dod pas 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'bras bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid ni snga na med pa yin la /
translated: The Lokayata school asserts that since things are empty of prior nonexistence and mutual absence, the entity of an effect does not exist prior to its arising.

original: 'bras bu da ltar skyes na yang dper na 'bru'i ngo bo nyid la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ltar 'bras bu la dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni gcig la gcig med pa yin pas snga na med pa ni skye ba'i snga
analyzed: 'bras bu da ltar skyes na yang dper na 'bru'i ngo bo nyid la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ltar 'bras bu la dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni gcig la gcig med pa yin pas snga na med pa ni skye ba'i snga
translated: When the effect arises, it does not have the entity of another thing, just as the entity of a grain does not have the entity of a nongrain.

original: rol na med pa'i tshul gyis rgyu med pa las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: rol na med pa'i tshul gyis rgyu med pa las skye ba yin la /
translated: Prior nonexistence is arising from a nonexistent cause, in the sense of not existing prior to arising.

original: gcig la gcig med pa ni @138a * //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa ni @138a * //
translated: Mutual absence is the absence of one thing in another.

original: gzhan sel ba'i tshul gyis rgyu med par 'gag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i tshul gyis rgyu med par 'gag pa yin te /
translated: They cease without a cause by the process of other-exclusion.

original: da ltar dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag par snang ba tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: da ltar dngos po ni skye ba dang 'gag par snang ba tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
translated: The present thing is merely the appearance of arising and ceasing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni med do zhes zer bas da 'dis de dgag pa'i phyir snga na med pas stong pa dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni med do zhes zer bas da 'dis de dgag pa'i phyir snga na med pas stong pa dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'dod de /
translated: Since they say that cause and effect do not exist, this refutes them because the error arises that if they are empty of prior nonexistence, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: Since the entity of the effect arises from a cause and has the nature of ceasing by itself, it is not an entity that does not exist.

original: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: Since the effect is not an entity that does not exist, the cause is not an entity that does not exist. Therefore, ultimately, an entity that does not exist does not arise and does not cease without a cause.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yang /
translated: Therefore, in response to them,

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could emptiness arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could emptiness cease?

original: zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what should be said.üîΩThey assert that the emptiness of the prior nonexistence of the world arises causelessly.üîΩHow could that emptiness arise?

original: de dag gis ni 'jig rten rgyang ban bdag 'dod pa ltar snga na med pa stong pa rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar stong pa de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhing gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag go zhes bya bar stong
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'jig rten rgyang ban bdag 'dod pa ltar snga na med pa stong pa rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar stong pa de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhing gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag go zhes bya bar stong
translated: How could that emptiness cease causelessly, since it is devoid of mutual dependence?

original: pa de ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur zhes go rims bzhin du dgag pa ston to //üîΩde la re zhig snga na med pas stong pa rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar stong pa de skye bar mi rigs par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rjes te med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i
analyzed: pa de ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur zhes go rims bzhin du dgag pa ston to // de la re zhig snga na med pas stong pa rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya bar stong pa de skye bar mi rigs par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rjes te med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the refutation of that, respectively, it is said:

original: me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Ultimate emptiness does not arise because it does not exist, like a sky flower.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, because a sky flower does not exist, it is illogical that it arises.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir skye bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du snga na med pas stong pa yang med pa'i phyir skye bar mi rigs pas snga na med pas stong pa skye ba med par rgyu med pa las skye bar mi rigs
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir skye bar mi rigs pa de bzhin du snga na med pas stong pa yang med pa'i phyir skye bar mi rigs pas snga na med pas stong pa skye ba med par rgyu med pa las skye bar mi rigs
translated: In the same way, because that which is empty of prior nonexistence does not exist, it is illogical that it arises. Therefore, that which is empty of prior nonexistence does not arise causelessly.

original: so // da ni gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag go zhes bya bar stong pa de 'gag par mi rigs par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so // da ni gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag go zhes bya bar stong pa de 'gag par mi rigs par rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the inference that it is illogical that that which is empty of mutual existence ceases causelessly, he says:

original: don dam par 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
translated: Ultimately, it is illogical that the nature of the effect itself ceases because the nonexistence of a non-effect does not exist.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bras bu ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the nonexistence of a non-effect that has ceased.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub @138b par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na 'bras bu ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa zhig nas med pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa yang 'bras
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub @138b par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'bras bu ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa zhig nas med pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa yang 'bras
translated: Moreover, they are respectively applied to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, a non-effect such as a pot, having been destroyed and become nonexistent, is not reasonable to cease because of the nonexistence of a non-effect.üîΩLikewise, in the nature of an effect, the nonexistence of a non-effect is also not reasonable to cease because of the nonexistence of a non-effect.

original: bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi rigs pas gcig med pas stong pa 'gag pa med pa rgyu med par 'gag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: bu ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gag par mi rigs pas gcig med pas stong pa 'gag pa med pa rgyu med par 'gag par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for the empty one, which is the absence of one, to cease without a cause.

original: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de las bzlog pas skabs kyi don 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the present context is taught by reversing the words of the opportunity.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag snga na med pas stong pa rgyu med pas las skye ba dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag par 'dod pa de dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skyeüîΩba dang 'gag par mi 'dod de /üîΩ'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag snga na med pas stong pa rgyu med pas las skye ba dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pa rgyu med par 'gag par 'dod pa de dag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'dod de / 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rgyu las skye zhing rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: They are at fault because they assert that there is no arising and no cessation.üîΩThey do not assert that things arise and cease causelessly because the nature of things is that effects arise from causes and that they cease by their own power.üîΩThus, because the effect is not nonexistent, the cause is not nonexistent.

original: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas don dam par med pa'i ngo bo nyid rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that ultimately, things do not arise and do not cease causelessly.

original: yang na kho bo cag ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par brjod pas mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na de ni de las bzlog par
analyzed: yang na kho bo cag ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par brjod pas mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na de ni de las bzlog par
translated: Or else, since we speak of emptiness in terms of the ultimate truth, if something were to exist that is not empty of emptiness, which is the nature of dependent origination, then that would be the opposite of emptiness.

original: 'gyur bas de lta bu de ni tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du ma grags pa'i phyir /üîΩ'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gyur bas de lta bu de ni tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du ma grags pa'i phyir / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: But such a thing is not renowned in the world, not even conventionally, like a sky flower.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not cease.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that were so,

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then that which is not empty would be unceasing and nonarisen.

original: zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba dgag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ji skad bstan pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston to
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sngar bye brag tu smra ba dag 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra ba dgag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa ji skad bstan pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston to
translated: This teaches that the meaning of the verses that refute the VaibhƒÅ·π£hikas‚Äô claim that prior to the arising of the effect, it is not empty of the nature of the effect, should be explained in a different way.

original: // 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /üîΩbye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu mi stong par btags pa de dbu ma pa don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du blta ba'i phyogs la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du
analyzed: // 'dis ni 'di skad ston te / bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'bras bu mi stong par btags pa de dbu ma pa don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du blta ba'i phyogs la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du
translated: This shows the following.

original: yod par ma grags @139a * //
analyzed: yod par ma grags @139a * //
translated: The non-empty effect imputed by the Vaibhasikas, in the Madhyamaka view, which views ultimate dependent origination as empty of essence, is not renowned as existent even conventionally, like a sky flower.üîΩTherefore, it is not the case that there is some non-empty effect.

original: pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa cung zad cig yod ces byar mi stong pa de med pa'i phyir med pa de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi stong pa cung zad cig yod ces byar mi stong pa de med pa'i phyir med pa de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that non-empty effect does not exist, the error of saying that it has neither arising nor ceasing would ensue. Therefore, the non-empty does not exist.

original: 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang 'thad pas dper na sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu stong pa nyid yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang 'thad pas dper na sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa yin te /
translated: If the effect is empty, then arising and ceasing are tenable. Therefore, it is essenceless, like an illusion.

original: de ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the effect should be said to be essenceless.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos thams cad don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gyis stong par brjod pas des na gal te mi stong pa cung zad
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos thams cad don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gyis stong par brjod pas des na gal te mi stong pa cung zad
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way, in dependence upon the ultimate truth, say that all dependently arisen phenomena are empty of an ultimate nature. If there were even the slightest existent that was not empty,

original: cig yod par gyur na de ni stong pa de las bzlog par 'gyur bas mi stong pa'i dngos pa de lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod par ma grags pa'i phyir /üîΩ'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: cig yod par gyur na de ni stong pa de las bzlog par 'gyur bas mi stong pa'i dngos pa de lta bu ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod par ma grags pa'i phyir / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: that existent would be the opposite of emptiness. But such a nonempty thing is not renowned in any way, even conventionally, just like a sky flower.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not cease.

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: We say this.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: 'bras bu mi stong pa cung zad cig yod ces byar mi stong pa de nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du gtan mi srid pa'i phyir de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong pa cung zad cig yod ces byar mi stong pa de nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du gtan mi srid pa'i phyir de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not cease.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: We say this.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not arise.üîΩAn effect that is not empty would not cease.

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: That nonempty thing would be unceased And also unarisen.

original: zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'bras bu mi stong pa yod pa ma yin pa de skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur bas mi stong pa de yod ces byar de ni ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'bras bu mi stong pa yod pa ma yin pa de skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur bas mi stong pa de yod ces byar de ni ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bas mi stong pa yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This is saying that since an existent nonempty effect does not arise or cease, that nonempty thing would be unceased and also unarisen.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach that in detail,

original: 'di ni mi stong pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni mi stong pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: since it is taught that it follows that nonempty things would be unarisen and unceasing, they are empty.

original: 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos mngon pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos mngon pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the effect has the quality of arising and ceasing, the quality of the probandum and the quality of the proof are stated by the logicians.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag mi stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis mi stong pa de dbu ma pa la mi srid pas de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba dag mi stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis mi stong pa de dbu ma pa la mi srid pas de la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas /
translated: This means that the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas infer that it is not empty, and that since it is not empty, it is impossible for the MƒÅdhyamika that arising and ceasing would follow.

original: stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba chos stong pa nyid dang / sgrub pa'i @139b chos skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa mngon pas rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba chos stong pa nyid dang / sgrub pa'i @139b chos skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa mngon pas rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Since it is empty, it has the quality of producing and ceasing effects. Thus, the probandum is the quality of emptiness, and the proving property is the quality of arising and ceasing. This is how inference should be done.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very inference, he says:

original: don dam par 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúUltimately, the effect is emptiness,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it arises and ceases, like an illusion.‚Äù

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are to be applied in order to the subject, the property to be established, the proof, and the example.

original: dper na sgyu ma ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: For example, just as an illusion is empty because it arises and ceases, so too is the effect empty because it arises and ceases.

original: de ltar 'bras bu stong zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang stong zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu stong zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi sgo nas rgyu yang stong zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cause should be stated to be empty and essenceless in terms of the effect‚Äôs emptiness and essencelessness.

original: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: Similarly, if the effect were to have no essence,

original: tha snyad du yang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: it would not arise and would not cease even conventionally.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas /üîΩstong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas / stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing ;
translated: Because it would not exist, like, for example, a flower growing in the sky.üîΩHow could the empty arise?

original: / stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: / stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could the empty cease?

original: zhes bya bas ni sngar 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'bras bu snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong par smra ba dgag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed ji skad bstan pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sngar 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'bras bu snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong par smra ba dgag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed ji skad bstan pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the meaning of the half-verse that previously refuted the Lokayatikas‚Äô claim that the effect is empty of prior non-existence and mutual non-existence is explained in a different way.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te ;
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te ;
translated: This shows the following.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis 'bras bu stong par btags pa de stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas stong pa de rgyu med par
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis 'bras bu stong par btags pa de stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas stong pa de rgyu med par
translated: The Lokayatikas‚Äô imputation of the effect as empty is itself empty. Since it is an inference, it is like a sky flower. It has no arising or cessation even conventionally.

original: skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that emptiness does not arise or cease without a cause.

original: 'bras bu mi stong pa nyid yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang 'thad pas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong pa nyid yin na de la skye ba dang 'gag pa yang 'thad pas rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If the effect is not empty, its arising and cessation are tenable. Therefore, it does not arise or cease without a cause.

original: dper na rgyu ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu med par skye ba dang / 'gag pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rgyu ma skyes pa dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu med par skye ba dang / 'gag pa ma yin pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, because a cause has the property of being unborn and unceasing, it is not the case that it arises without a cause and ceases without a cause.

original: da ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: da ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par ston to //
translated: In the same way, because an effect does not have the nature of not existing prior to its cause, it is not the case that it has the nature of not existing.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: gal te 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If an effect were to have the nature of not existing, as the Lokayatas maintain, because it does not exist prior to its cause and because it does not exist in its cause,

original: de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur @140a * //
analyzed: de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur @140a * //
translated: then, like a sky flower, it would be erroneous to say that it arises and ceases even conventionally.

original: bas stong pa de rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bas stong pa de rgyu med par skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, an empty effect does not arise and cease without a cause.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, the example, and the conclusion.üîΩFor example, because a sky flower does not exist, it does not arise and does not cease even conventionally, and therefore it does not arise without a cause and does not cease without a cause.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas rgyu med pa las skye ba dang rgyu med par 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis brtags pa'i 'bras bu yang
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni med pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas rgyu med pa las skye ba dang rgyu med par 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis brtags pa'i 'bras bu yang
translated: Likewise, the effect imagined by the Lokayatas

original: snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur na med pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas rgyu med pa las skye ba dang rgyu med par 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang gcig la gcig med pas stong pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur na med pa'i phyir tha snyad du yang skye ba dang 'gag pa med pas rgyu med pa las skye ba dang rgyu med par 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is also empty of prior nonexistence and mutual nonexistence, and therefore it is nonexistent. Because it does not arise and does not cease even conventionally, it does not arise without a cause and does not cease without a cause.
