original: de ltar na skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it does not arise and does not cease,

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: emptiness would also follow as unceased and unarisen.

original: zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na med pa dang ; gcig la gcig med pas stong pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu stong pa de yang ma 'gags pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'bras bu snga na med pa dang ; gcig la gcig med pas stong pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na de la tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu stong pa de yang ma 'gags pa dang /
translated: This verse teaches that if the effect were empty of an essence of nonexistence, as the Lokayatas assert, because it would be a non-existent entity, it would be like a sky flower, and it would not arise and would not cease even conventionally.

original: ma skyes pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the error would arise that the effect would be unceasing and unarisen.üîΩSince this is unacceptable, this verse also teaches, as the previous verse does, that the meaning of the reason is unestablished.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas 'dis kyang gong du bstan pa bzhin du dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don mngon pas zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas 'dis kyang gong du bstan pa bzhin du dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don mngon pas zhes bya bas ni glags yod pa'i tshig las bzlog pas skabs kyi don nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the meaning of the reason‚Äù is a reversal of the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the meaning of the fault.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid yin pas /
translated: The meaning of the context is that the effect is a phenomenon that arises and ceases.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'dis kyang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis stong pa de la skye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag 'dod pa ltar med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa tshig le'ur byas pa'i skabs kyi don 'dis kyang 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag stong par rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis stong pa de la skye ba med pa dang /
translated: This topic of the verses also indicates that the LokƒÅyatas are inferred to be empty, and that emptiness entails that they are unborn and unceasing.

original: 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas mi stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas mi stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: If they are not empty, then they would possess the attributes of arising and ceasing,

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos med pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa dang ; sgrub pa'i chos skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang ldan pa mngon pas rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos med pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa dang ; sgrub pa'i chos skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang ldan pa mngon pas rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: and this would be established by the inference that the probandum is not a reality devoid of attributes and that the proving attribute possesses arising and ceasing.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that very inference,

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi /
translated: Here, the inference is only a distinction in the thesis, ‚Äúultimately, internal effects do not have the nature of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: lhag ma @140b ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lhag ma @140b ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar te /
translated: This is how it is applied:

original: don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äúultimately, internal effects do not have the nature of nonexistence,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: because they arise and cease, like, for example, external effects that are illusions.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu sgyu ma ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du nang gi 'bras bu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu sgyu ma ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du nang gi 'bras bu yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, external effects that are illusions do not have the nature of nonexistence because they arise and cease. In the same way, internal effects also do not have the nature of nonexistence because they arise and cease.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi dam bcas pa la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi dam bcas pa la skyon gzhan yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are other faults in the Lokayata thesis,

original: yang na 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi dam bcas pa la med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa'i chos can 'bras bu'i khyad par skye ba dang 'gag pa bstsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa ni 'dir tshig gi don yin no zhes bya
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi dam bcas pa la med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa'i chos can 'bras bu'i khyad par skye ba dang 'gag pa bstsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa ni 'dir tshig gi don yin no zhes bya
translated: the meaning of the words here is this: The Lokayatas‚Äô thesis is established as having the fault of the subject, the effect, being devoid of the property to be established, arising and ceasing, because it is not inferred to have the nature of an effect, and because it is devoid of the nature of arising and ceasing, and because it is devoid of arising and ceasing.

original: ba smras te /
analyzed: ba smras te /
translated: This is said.

original: de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is not accepted.

original: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de la bzlog pas skabs kyi don ji skad bstan te 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi med pa'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa de dag la skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyu las
analyzed: des na glags yod pa'i tshig de la bzlog pas skabs kyi don ji skad bstan te 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gi med pa'i ngo bo nyid du brtags pa de dag la skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyu las
translated: Since it is untenable that things imputed by LokƒÅyatas to have an entity of nonexistence arise and cease, the entity of the effectüîΩdoes not arise from a cause that is an entity of nonexistence.

original: skye zhing / rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: skye zhing / rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin la /
translated: Since it ceases by its own power, it is not an entity of nonexistence.

original: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu bdun pa /üîΩgzhan yang skyed pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sgo nas rgyu yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to / // / bam po drug cu bdun pa / gzhan yang skyed pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: Thus it is shown that the cause is not an entity of nonexistence from the perspective of the effect not being an entity of nonexistence.üîΩMoreover, would the producer and the effectüîΩbe the same or different?

original: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na zhes bya bas ni gzhan yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, if the effect is produced by the cause, would the cause and the effect be the same or different?

original: brtag pa gnyis ka ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis ka ltar yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: It is shown that it is not tenable according to either of the two analyses.

original: de gnyis kyi dam bcar ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dam bcar ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the thesis of those two, it is said:üîΩIt is never tenable

original: de la / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //üîΩnam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du // nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That cause and effect are the same.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,üîΩIt is never tenable

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //üîΩnam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //üîΩda ni dam bca' ba de gnyis kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i @141a * //üîΩphyir go rims bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du // nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smras so // da ni dam bca' ba de gnyis kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i @141a * // phyir go rims bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That cause and effect are different.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the inferences of those two theses, the faults should be stated in order.

original: de la re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs la skyon brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs la skyon brjod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the statement of the fault in regard to the position of sameness, it is said:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid la //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid la //
translated: If cause and effect were the same,

original: skyed dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: That which is produced and that which produces would be the same.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu gang dag yin pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu gang dag yin pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar ni mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That which is produced and that which produces, like a father and son, would be the same. Since that is unacceptable, it is said.

original: 'dir yang glags yod pa'i rgyu thabs kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang glags yod pa'i rgyu thabs kyi chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Here, a similar example is presented that is a means of refuting the possibility that cause and effect are identical.

original: gal te shing de me yin na //
analyzed: gal te shing de me yin na //
translated: If fire were fuel,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
translated: agent and action would be identical.

original: zhes bya ba der bstan pa'i tshul bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid yin na skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyi tshig dor gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig
analyzed: zhes bya ba der bstan pa'i tshul bzhin no zhes bya bas ni 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid yin na skyed pa dang bskyed pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyi tshig dor gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as it was explained there‚Äù means that if cause and effect were identical, that which is produced and that which produces it would be identical.

original: pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni pha dang bu dag yin par nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni pha dang bu dag yin par nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: The similar example that refutes the possibility that cause and effect are identical is the example of a father and son.

original: de ltar sngar me dang bud shing brtags pa'i skabs su gal te me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyi tshig dor gyis me dang bud shing dag
analyzed: de ltar sngar me dang bud shing brtags pa'i skabs su gal te me dang bud shing dag gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyi tshig dor gyis me dang bud shing dag
translated: In the previous chapter on fire and fuel, the phrase ‚Äújust as it was explained there‚Äù means that if fire and fuel were identical, that which is produced and that which produces it would be identical.

original: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe byed pa po dang las dag yin par nye bar gzhag pa'i tshul bzhin no zhes bstan to //üîΩde'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe de las shes par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i dpe pha dang bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin par 'jig rten la grags pa de'i dbang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe byed pa po dang las dag yin par nye bar gzhag pa'i tshul bzhin no zhes bstan to // de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe de las shes par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa'i dpe pha dang bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin par 'jig rten la grags pa de'i dbang gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin
translated: The example of a non-identical thing is like the case of the agent and the action.üîΩTherefore, it is possible to understand that cause and effect are not identical by means of this example that is known in the world.üîΩThis is how the syllogism should be formulated: ‚ÄúThe cause and effect are not identical,

original: par shes par byar nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: par shes par byar nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because the cause is not the effect, like a father and son.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cause and effect are not identical,

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin te /
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin te /
translated: because the cause is not the effect, like a father and son.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he said.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na pha dang bu dag ni skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na pha dang bu dag ni skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dag kyang skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, father and son are not identical because one is the begetter and the other the begotten. Likewise, cause and effect are not identical because one is the producer and the other the produced.

original: de ltar re zhig gi cig pa nyid kyi phyogs la 'o zhes bya ba ni skyon brjod do zhes @141b bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gi cig pa nyid kyi phyogs la 'o zhes bya ba ni skyon brjod do zhes @141b bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, first of all, the fault is stated in the phrase ‚Äúin the case of identity.‚Äù

original: gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang 'di ltar skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang 'di ltar skyon brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The fault is also stated in the phrase ‚Äúin the case of difference.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
translated: Therefore: If cause and effect were different,

original: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: cause and noncause would be equivalent.

original: 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yin phyir //
translated: Because the effect would be different from the cause,

original: dper na de las gzhan bzhin pas //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan bzhin pas //
translated: it would be like something else.

original: de yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But this is unacceptable.üîΩSince the cause and effect are asserted to be of the same continuum, they can be known here as well.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang shes par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang shes par byar nus te zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid
translated: The reason that proves that the cause and effect are not different is the fact that they are of the same continuum.üîΩSince the cause and effect are asserted to be of the same continuum, they can be known here as well as not being different.

original: yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin par shes par byar nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin par shes par byar nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The inference is to be applied as follows:

original: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The cause and effect are not different,üîΩbecause they are of the same continuum,

original: rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: rgyud tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: like
